Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Superhot Mind Control Delete is an expansion of the game Superhot. This standalone expansion takes and combines the well-loved challenge and endless mode from Superhot together, and essentially it is a rogue-lite game.

Loosely followed the ending of Superhot. the protagonist determines to find the secrets hidden in the Superhot server. During your playthrough, you will get lots of fragmentary information that hardly makes any sense. With the narrative getting very “stream of consciousness”, it is hard to understand what is going on with the story. Anyway, the story is not the point here.

Mind Control Delete (MCD) shares the same basic “time moves when you move” mechanic with the base game, however, it also has some differences.

The biggest difference, as I say, this is a rogue-lite game. Like endless mode, you play the same a few levels again and again, with different spawning locations and a different number of enemies to defeat in order to get past like one of the challenge modes. These levels are arranged into one “big level”. At the beginning of each “big level”, you choose your ability (in-game word core) and cannot change them halfway. There are some rewards in the “big level” that offers you buffs (in-game word hack) to give you some edges against your enemies. The enemies are relentless and diversified, unlike Superhot they are only “red guy”. You have “white armor guy”, “spike guy”, “demon”, "samurai" etc., each of whom has their own features. Even plain red guys with Katana or bats can reflect items you throw (katana guy reflects handgun bullets unless in close range). There is even trap making the game more challenging. To compensate, you can take one hit or more. But once your lives (in-game word heart) run out, you have to replay the whole “big level” again, which contains five to ten levels and lose all the buffs you gain. MCD ticks the characteristics of a rogue-lite game, and it is more unforgiving than the base game.

MCD encourages you to do melee (including throwing) rather than just shooting. Not only there are a few buffs and abilities related to melee, but the game also offers more weapons, most of which are throwing items like dart and shuriken (only one new gun), and they are actually fun to play with. Besides, melee weapons like bat are more durable than the base game, and katana feature has changed. Katana can only cut bullets before while in MCD it can reflect bullets back to the enemy. If you equip Katana core, it can be quite handy by flying back to you after throwing while cutting enemies on its way into halves.

It seems to have some small aesthetic differences, but I like the base game more. Like guns reflect more light and the arm and weapon are in dark blue. In my opinion, the colors of the arms and weapons are not really in tone with the whole color setting. They should be in purely black with less weird reflection. Besides, some levels have music or noises that I don’t recall the base game has, and these should be removed for congruence.

The whole experience is smooth, just as its clean aesthetic. But there are two flaws I noticed that make it feels sloppy. Using charge ability requires you to drop guns and items beside katana or bat, otherwise, a warning will show up. But when I was holding a bottle, the warning told me to leave my gun. Another one is sometimes items sink into the environment model. I think it is considered as a bug. Fixing these two flaws will be nice. And there is one complaint that the aim is white which is very hard to see when the backgrounds are mostly white.

Mind Control Delete is for fans demanding more Superhot experience, just like the achievements suggest. In the beginning, the game literally tells you to stop playing, as it just repeats a few levels with more enemies and different abilities and buffs. I didn't play to the bottom of it as it is almost endless and I do feel grindy and repetitive when played for consecutive hours, but I think it will be nice to pick it up and play once in a while.
 
Oi

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2018
LEVEL WARPING EFFECT!!! It's in the main menu. I love SUPERHOT and have had a good review on this game, from early access for a LONG time. I'm finally playing 1.0, after setting this one down, a long while back. I think it's awesome. SUPERHOT with more urgency and choice. That's my simple thoughts.

The ONE thing that ALMOST made me give a bad review... When you get to NODE 7 on Floor 3, there is a visual effect that (for me, at least) gives massive headaches. It's like a.... depth thing... kinda? Anyways. Pretty sure I just realized this is the "Level Warping Effect", tuneable in the settings. If you're like me and this "effect" gives you headaches and causes EXTREME nausea, turn the effect down to Low; and I believe that should help.

To the SUPERHOT TEAM.... I love ya. Lots and lots. Please change that part of the game. I didn't even realize, until my head started feeling off and I got a headache. That Level Warping Effect is super cool, but just not great on the eyes.
 
Blissful Ignorance

Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPER HOT老玩家来谈谈新作感想吧：
优点：
1、更多种的武器与更多的招式：新增了一种弹道速度极快的狙击类枪械，以及一些飞镖类武器。这作中的飞镖是可以造成杀伤的，显得合理了很多。此外挥舞近战武器和徒手攻击的花样更多了，有几招神似禅雅塔；
2、武士刀相关内容大幅度增多：制作者明显感受到武士刀就是玩家的G点，增添了大量与武士刀相关的技能，如召回、闪现攻击等；
3、AI敌人更多样化：拿着刀的AI可能会挡开投掷物或子弹了，还新增一种会自爆的敌人，后面可能还有其他类型的新敌人；
4、画面更佳：光影效果更加突出系列特色了，同时场景制作更加精细；
5、各种技能的引入：也许很多人认为各类技能能让过关思路更加多元化，但其实并不是这样，原因在缺点中会细说。但至少相比前作可玩性确实更高了；
6、其他优化：本作只占本地空间2G稍多，前作有4G多。也可能是因为本作不包含前作里隐藏的一些很鬼畜精神污染的影片。
缺点：
1、剧情：玩了4个小时后并不知道本作想讲什么。让玩家在碎片化的线索中拼凑整个故事，这样的游戏并不少见，但是起码得让玩家知道自己为什么要玩这个游戏吧？还是说默认所有玩家都玩过前作了？
2、过分重复的关卡：本作声称游戏时间远远超过前作，但实际上是靠重复的关卡堆叠起来的，实际上关卡数还不如前作多。每一小节用数个关卡组合而成，用完生命数就要整个小节重来，玩到后面很容易烦躁；
3、不合理的关卡设计：SUPER HOT本质上是一个策略游戏，需要在有限的时间内思考当前情境下的对策，比如前作的电梯关卡，关卡总共就5个敌人，需要解决掉电梯中的3个敌人后再解决电梯开门后的两个敌人，可行解其实是拘束的，然而正是这种类似解密的过程能给玩家带来极大的成就感。但是本作中，所有的关卡都是类似的：较大的场景，开局时面对一个或两个近身敌人，然后根据情景随机应变。我认为这种设计是抛弃了前作中非常重要的一个玩法，玩家很快就会觉得关卡千篇一律。大场景有大场景的乐趣，小场景也有小场景的乐趣，完全倒向任何一方都会给游戏性带来一定的不利影响。各种技能的引入在大场景下其实作用也很有限，不过是换了一套装备虐AI而已。
其他和前作不一样的地方：
1、AI大幅度削弱：本作中如果打到小节的后面关卡中失败，需要整个小节重新来过，势必给玩家造成非常不好的游戏体验。所以本作AI直接被削成狗，最直观的体验：自己操控的人物仿佛没有碰撞体积，甚至可以从霰弹枪子弹中间钻过去，这在前作是完全不可能的；如果被背刺，游戏甚至会直接提醒小心后面。
 
Tudala
0
41 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 octobre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I loved the first one, but they took the game in a worse direction imho. They added a health system so its not as challenging, the transition times between levels is way too long, and its kill count based instead of having to clear all the constantly enemies from a map. Along with the random .hacks, it feels like all the danger has been removed and you don't need to think as hard to get out of situations when you can just bite the bullet and have a heart/life removed.

I did like that they added way more weapons, like throwables that stick into enemies and walls.
 
MAESA
296 produits enregistrés
7
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4
Non recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Das erste SUPERHOT war ein geniales Spiel, das mit einem genial coolen Spielprinzip und tollem Design voll und ganz überzeugen konnte. Umso erfreuter war ich, als ich hörte, dass es einen Nachfolger gibt. Doch leider haben die Entwickler sich entschieden, einiges vom Spielprinzip auf den Kopf zu stellen.

Der Grundsatz ist wieder derselbe: Man spielt eine Figur, die sich durch einen Raum voll Gegner schiesst, schlägt und schnetzelt. Die Zeit steht dabei fast still und bewegt sich fort, wenn man sich selber bewegt. Das lässt unglaublich coole Manöver zu und führt zu einem coolen Flow, wenn man Schüssen ausweicht und sich in Zeitlupe einen Gegner nach dem anderen vorknöpft. Und wiederum ist der extrem minimalistische Look präsent, der sehr stimmig ist und die Umgebungen gut lesbar macht.

Und zu Beginn ist er sofort wieder da, der gute alte SUPERHOT Flow, der einfach Spass macht. Dazu bahnt sich wieder eine mysteriöse Geschichte an, die einen als Spieler irgendwie kitzeln will. Trotzdem wird auch schnell deutlich, wie anders das Spiel funktioniert: Statt linear Level um Level zu absolvieren, muss man jeweils eine fixe Anzahl an zufälligen Levels schaffen, um einen Schritt vorwärts zu kommen und das nächste Levelpaket absolvieren zu können. Dafür hat man jeweil seine beschränkte Anzahl Lebenspunkte und wenn diese aufgebraucht sind, muss man das Levelpaket wieder von vorne anfangen. Dafür darf man zwischendurch immer wieder eine ebenfalls zufällige Auswahl von Spezialfähigkeiten wählen, die einem für den Rest des Levelpakets das Leben erleichtern sollen.

Dass dieses System Schwächen hat merkt man bald, sobald man mehrfach beim letzten Level innerhalb eines Pakets scheitert. Doch zumindest zu Beginn überwiegt die Freude, wenn man es schafft und freut man sich über die coolen Spezialfähigkeiten. Doch je länger das Spiel dauert, desto mehr wird hier der Zufallsfaktor zum Ärgernis. Die Nützlichkeit dieser Fähigkeiten ist extrem unterschiedlich und so spielt es eine enorme Rolle, wie viel Glück man hier hat, wie viel einfacher die anschliessenden Levels im Paket werden.

Ist hier der Zufall schon mühsam, wird er in einem anderen Bereich aber mit der Zeit zum völligen Spielspasskiller: So sind auch die Levels sehr unterschiedlich und spielen sich manche einfacher als andere. Auch hier spielt also Glück eine Rolle. Am meisten merkt man das aber innerhalb der Levels. Auch hier ist das Geschehen zufällig. Anders als in Teil 1 sind die Levels nicht wie Puzzles, die man lösen kann, sondern ergeben sich immer wieder unfaire Situationen, weil man z.B. zufälligerweise gleich zwischen zwei Gegner spawnt und so nullkommanix ein Herz weniger hat.

Das wäre alles noch ok, könnte man den Level einfach von vorne beginnen. Durch die Mini-Roguelike-Mechanik kommt es aber immer wieder vor, dass man beim letzten Level innerhalb eines Pakets einfach durch Pech (um nicht zu sagen eine unfaire Spielsituation) sein letztes Herz verliert und das ganze Levelpaket von vorne beginnen muss. und während das am Anfang noch dazu anstachelt, es doch zu schaffen, wird das Ganze mit zunehmender Spieldauer nur noch nervig und völlig frustrierend.

Ist also der Zufall das Problem? Nicht ganz. Jede einzelne Zufallsmechanik für sich wäre interessant gewesen. Aber die Kombination aus zufälligen Levels, zufälligen Spielgeschehen in den Levels und zufälligen Spezialfähigkeiten innerhalb einer Roguelike-Mechanik ist einfach nur ein perfektes Rezept für Frust.

Fazit: Wer sehr frustresistent ist und Roguelike-Mechaniken mag, der mag diese Version von SUPERHOT auch mögen und wird viele alte Stärken wiederfinden. Alle anderen werden das fast schon puzzlemässige Levels-lösen vom Original vermissen und irgendwann frustriert aufgeben, weil der Zufall den Spielspass völlig zerstört.
 
Gibor
1,540 produits enregistrés
2
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2022
The only problem of the original game was its shortness. It made up for that with nice, hand-crafted levels. The sequel scraps the whole concept and throws the player into a repetitive autogenerated nonsense of the same 8-or-so maps repeating.
It's longer because of the extreme repetition and the punishing start-over mechanic that requires the player to ace 10+ consecutive maps or start from the beginning.
In the original game, there was a pattern to enemy spawning, at least no enemy was spawned on the player. But in this version, a single item pickup is enough time for an enemy to spawn on the player, aim, shoot and hit. Have fun.
 
Gahen

5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2018
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

한줄평 : 도전 정신으로 깨게 만드는 파괴본능 게임

이 게임은 능숙한 컨트롤을 요구하므로 익숙치 않다면 구입을 희망하지 않습니다.
하지만 언제든지 그에 따른 컨트롤이 뒷바쳐주고 인내와 도전정신만 있다면 클리어가 가능합니다.

게임은 전작과는 다르게 어려워서 그런진 몰라도 살짝 길었습니다.
갑자기 20스테이지나 안죽고 깨라는 미션이 뜨질 않나 ..
깰때마다 심장 쫄깃하면서 플레이 했습니다.

그냥 단순하게 모니터에 있는 알파벳과 숫자로 들어가서
빨간색 수퍼핫 친구들과 1대 다수로 싸우면 됩니다.

게임 플레이 팁은 대충 이렇습니다.
1. 권총은 뒷전하고 소총과 샷건 먼저 죽여라.
2. 근접? 총? 무조건 총을 먼저 죽여라.
- 근접은 적어도 타이밍만 잘맞추면 맨주먹으로 스턴을 줄 수 있으나
총은 장거리이기 때문에 섣불리 다가갈 수 없으니 먼저 죽입니다.
3. 능력에 따라 이해가 높아야 한다 !
-제가 주로 하는건 닌자와 몸바꿔치기인데 의외로 쓸만합니다.
닌자는 던지기와 회수 위주로 플레이 하시면 되고요.
몸 바꿔 치기는 상대가 총 든 상태라면 물건을 던져 총을 버리게 한다음에
바꿔치기해서 다시 총을 먹으면 새로운 총이 바로 앞에 떨어져 있습니다.
4. 주변 둘러보기 필수 !
- 바로 옆에 공격해오려는 친구가 있을 수 있습니다.
5. 예측을 해라 !

뭐 이 정도 있습니다.

플레이 하시면 대충 무슨 소리인지는 아실거예요.
그럼 즐겜 !

수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫 수퍼핫

KRozzi (
0
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
15.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE is one of the only games on Steam that I've felt this compelled to write a serious review about. My opinion goes against what seems to be the majority vote, and I feel like my thoughts should be heard.

I'll start first by touching on gameplay. Unlike the original, the story mode's gameplay is fed to you through what the game calls "Nodes". In these nodes, there will be a specific amount of levels that you must get through in one shot to complete said node. These levels are randomized upon every retry or death. To help you in your quest, you're granted 2 or 3 hearts (depending on which "CORE" mode you select). The hearts function as hit points, and if you lose all of them, you will be forced to restart the node. Also included in the nodes are what the game calls "Hacks", which help to give you more abilities and skills as you progress through a single node.

My problems with the game unfortunately immediately start here, as some levels are more open and dangerous, and other levels are more enclosed and easier to kill/hide in. You don't get a say in what levels you're getting, and don't know what to prepare for until you load into the node. Not to mention that the hacks are also severely unbalanced. You can get ones that are flat out useless (the Grenade hack comes to mind, in which throwing something and having it hit an enemy makes it explode into a hefty amount of bullets. The bullets always tend to fly directly back at you, making it extremely risky to try throwing anything at enemies when you have that hack), or ones that make you severely overpowered, turning the game's difficulty to Trivial at best (The Lightning Reflex hack is a great example here. With this hack, any bullets coming near you will slow down to a total crawl. Getting this hack basically means you barely have to worry about the enemy gunfire, which... goes against the point of the game?) My main problem with all of this is that your success is pretty much entirely based on what maps and hacks the game randomly gives you, and not much else. The element of skill required in the original SUPERHOT is gone. It feels way more RNG-based than it should be.

Also introduced in SUPERHOT: MCD are brand new enemy types. My favorite of which is the ones who are only colored red on a specific section of their body, the rest of their bodies being a white, concrete-like texture. To kill these enemies, you have to damage them only in the red parts. This enemy type is what I found to be the most welcome addition to the game, adding a little spice and challenge to the original SUPERHOT formula. The other main enemy type introduced looks identical to a standard Red Dude, but with spikes protruding out of several different parts of their bodies. These enemies explode into a bunch of bullets when killed, which is an excellent idea on paper, but terribly executed here. The bullets that they explode into can also damage you, requiring you to make sure that you keep your distance when killing this type. But even when making all the necessary precautions to not get hit from the explosion, there's a high chance that you still will be anyways. This made me feel like I was being punished for killing the enemies that I was supposed to kill, and set me back quite often within multiple runs of my nodes. Another gripe I have with this enemy type is that from far away, it's difficult to tell if they're a normal Red Dude or a Spiky one. This might get some into sticky situations where they'll lose hearts not realizing that they've just been hurt by the shrapnel of a Spiky Dude.

A little later on into the game's story, boss characters will begin to appear. There are 3 boss types, most commonly referred to as the Dog, the Ninja, and the Addict. These characters tend to spawn once the game thinks you've taken a little too much time in a level, at least in my experience. It's important to note that none of these characters can be damaged or killed, and you're forced to live with their annoyances until you complete the stage. The Dog is the easiest of the 3 to avoid, as he only uses his own unique dash move as well as melee punches to attempt to hurt you. The Ninja always carries a Katana, but can throw it at you and call it back to himself at will. The Addict acts like a normal Red Dude, but will forcibly switch his position with yours at any time he feels like. Keep in mind that because he functions as a normal Red Dude, he will attack you with whatever guns he can get his hands on at the time. His ability to switch positions with you at will can end your entire strategy that you were planning on using for a stage, and you'll end up having to wing it. Did I mention that none of these enemies can be damaged or killed?

These unique boss character ideas sound very fun on paper, but again, are just painfully executed and end up pumping more frustration into your gameplay. If you go a little further into the story, the game's maps begin to play tricks on you. The maps will begin to appear with mines at set locations stuck onto the walls, floors, and ceilings. These mines will explode outward in a bunch of bullets when you shoot them or if you get too close to them. While it is amusing to kill Red Dudes in this manner, it also means that you have to look out and be extra careful in every single nook and cranny of the stage, all while avoiding the BS that these brand new enemy types introduce to the game. Sometimes these mines are very difficult to spot, and you'll end up feeling like you've just been punished for daring to walk. A basic concept that they've ended up making frustrating.

Another thing I'd like to mention is the story. I always thought the story in the original SUPERHOT was a little lackluster and possibly even dated now, but the story in SUPERHOT: MCD takes the story from its predecessor and amplifies its bad qualities, making the original's plot look like a masterpiece. There's simply nothing to grab onto in this game's story, whereas in the first game, it was fun to learn more about "The System" and such. It's really hard to describe what plot there is in this game, as for most of it you're told that "There is no more story". You're treated like an addict just for wanting more SUPERHOT. The game treats you like a ♥♥♥♥ for no other reason than the sake of it. The game makes you feel bad for even daring to play it. In my opinion, it's making a message about addiction that it simply isn't qualified to make.

All of these frustrations combined into one package make for an unfortunately dull gameplay experience, which pains me to say as I was really looking forward to a good sequel to SUPERHOT. This takes the SUPERHOT formula and runs in the entirely wrong direction with it. My personal idea of a better follow-up would have been closer to the opposite of this, and I really wish they would have rather played it safe and just made slight adjustments to the original, rather than giving it a new Roguelite coat of paint. This game genre doesn't work with SUPERHOT. Like one of the achievement names from this game, sometimes, less is MORE.

A popular line used in marketing from the end of the first SUPERHOT was "It's the most innovative shooter I've played in years!", parroted by fans across all of the years since its original release, and I stand by that quote. Where SUPERHOT was the most innovative shooter I've played in years, SUPERHOT: MCD is a shooter that I've played.

TL;DR: The game is mostly an unfun slog where the RNG decides if you'll be able to win or not. The new enemy types just provide additional frustration, and the story is worse than the original. A disappointing, halfbaked game after almost 4 years of development.

If you haven't seen all the original SUPERHOT has to offer, try 100%ing it first. If after that you want more and are able to play SUPERHOT VR, I recommend also doing that before playing this. If you still want MCD, then wait for a massive discount.
 
Jimmy Kimmel Gaming

Non recommandé
13.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2022
There's a point early on in Mind Control Delete where the game has you move through the apartment complex from the first game. On your way, you will be teleported back a few steps intermittently each time you get closer to the end point. The message on the screen reads "Two steps forward, one step back. There is no climax. Just more and more of the same." It was at that point that I knew what to expect, and I was hoping dearly to be wrong.

Keep that thought in mind because in the interest of fairness I'm going to start with what I really like, before finally ending with why you shouldn't spend money on this game. Mind Control Delete is a much different variant of Superhot from the previous two games. Whereas those primarily focused on structured cinematic action puzzles, MCD eskews that in favour of arena combat. Basically the other games' endless modes, only not actually endless. All the levels are far more open and allow for player experimentation for styling on your opponents to your heart's content. What really sets it apart the most, though, is the new "progression" system, in quotes because of how it is semi-temporary.

Every time you begin a stage you'll have to endure numerous arenas back to back. As you go through the arenas you'll periodically be able to download a hack. These can range from spawning with a gun or a katana, making throwable objects explode, healing, and several others. Yes, healing is actually a factor in MDC, which wasn't a change I was super keen on but in retrospect wasn't a bad fit at all. The way health works is that by default you have two hit points to carry you across a whole stage's worth of arenas: fail and you start at the beginning of the stage. It's as annoying and frustrating as it is tactical and thrilling. Honestly it does encourage you to be a little bit more chaotic with your approach on account of giving you a second chance, while still making the game sufficiently hard; you're gonna be repeating these stages a lot.

For the first half an hour I was genuinely enjoying the experience. Unlocking new hacks and even "core powers" that you equip before a mission and always have at your disposal is legitimately fun and exciting and provokes a sense of progress and discovery, making you wanna delve further into the game to unlock other abilities for more combos. It's genuinely great stuff, and with new added enemy varieties and more complex enemy maneuvers to test your mettle, patience, and planning, MCD is by far the best playing entry in the trilogy.

However, it wasn't very long before I would start eating those words of praise.

Not very long into the game, you're going to discover something fishy. Each stage is composed of arenas, but between them there's no variation. I don't mean that they're basic and uninteresting. I mean, quite literally, all stages will share the same basic pool of arenas within the game. As the story progresses you'll unlock new arenas to be added into the pool piecemeal. But for the vast majority of the game you will quite literally be playing the same level. Over and over and over again.

Two steps forward, one step back.

It's actually pretty insulting to think about it, but the game actually actively wastes your time as a player by making you slog through content you already played before. All of it just an "endless mode arena" with randomly dispersed enemies of which you have to "kill x amount" to proceed, doubly made feeling cheap by the fact that the number is arbitrary: each arena will spawn more enemies than you need to kill, throwing the illusion of it at all being a carefully constructed experience entirely out the window and more like they're just throwing stuff at you entirely at random. If the levels were randomly generated or something that'd have been fine in my books. But no, these levels are hand-crafted, and you will be replaying them ad nauseum. Somehow, switching between them so rapidly is actually way more boredom-inducing than sticking on one map in the endless mode and trying to see how far you can get. The only way I can describe the feeling is that it's like you're being shown all the game has to offer from the get go only to be pulled away from it to be shown the same thing from another angle and demanding you act impressed.

But truthfully, none of that is nearly as bad - at least, it wouldn't be as bad as it is if it wasn't for the abysmal story, the proverbial straw that broke this game's back and turned it from a flawed but interesting game into an actual act of hostility to the player.

To put it in as few spoilers as possible, the entirety of the story of Mind Control Delete is basically just a non-stop barrage of badgering you for continuing to play Superhot, not unlike the first game in the series. But whereas this series used an in-universe narrative to send that message across with lore that was intriguing and made you wanna get to the bottom of it, Mind Control Delete eskews all of that and instead criticizes you, specifically the very player actually playing the game in the real world. There is no secret shady organization, there are no strange eldritch technologies with mysterious purposes. In fact, there's no purpose to any of this at all.

Make no mistake, the entire story of Mind Control Delete is literally just a response from the devs to the criticism of their games in the series being far too short: a criticism rightfully levied against the studio asking the consumer to pay $30 for such a simple experience. There is no depth or complexity behind that, as much as you might be reading into it. Even if there was, that doesn't change what this game very much says on the surface in bold text: "You are an entitled, mindless pig for wanting to get what you paid for."

Honestly, for this entry and how improved the mechanics were, I could have been forgiving for how light on content it was.
I could have been forgiving for how repetitive it was.
What I couldn't forgive is that, on top of that all, they had a pointed "♥♥♥♥ you" to the player for daring to play the game, thinly veiled as a self-felating artistic statement. Maybe they should have reconsidered charging the player $30 for the opportunity to experience being ♥♥♥♥ on by the devs from their high horses. All I can say was I'm glad I waited on a sale to get all three games bundled up for the price of one. Even then I still feel like I'm the one who should be getting paid after playing this one.
 
CoffeeCup
526 produits enregistrés
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Non recommandé
14.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2023
TL;DR: The roguelike/lite direction they went with for MCD did not have enough variety for me to think this is better or even as good as the more curated levels of the original SUPERHOT. That's not to say it's bad, I just don't like the direction they took it in. I put it as a negative review, as I honestly would probably not recommend this game to people and just direct them to the original SUPERHOT, but my thoughts on it are more mixed than it is entirely negative.

My feelings on this game are a bit mixed. I very thoroughly enjoyed the original SUPERHOT, and while this game wasn't necessarily bad or anything, I found myself getting less enjoyment from this game. I really wish Steam would allow for a more diverse rating system, because ultimately I think many people would still find this game fun, but I personally would not recommend it if you've played the first game.

The main issue I have with MIND CONTROL DELETE (will be stated as MCD from now on) is the roguelike/roguelite (not sure which one it would be classified as) direction they took it in. While initially, getting all the powerups and stuff is cool and fun, you can honestly get all of them fairly quickly. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, however the amount of variety you get is not that much in my opinion. And for a game focused on repeating levels and the endless mode, This focus on the repetition/endless mode also required that maps/levels are fairly simple, at least in comparison to the first game. Many of the maps in MCD are areas with wide open areas with some obstacles here and there. In the original, there was much more variety for the maps, such as a tight office space, or in the middle of a subway, etc. This allows for what I personally feel is more engaging gameplay, as each level was almost like a puzzle in how you should approach it. Now, you get cool powers, but instead of carefully planning out how to approach each level or enemy, you kinda just kill the people that are running at you trying to kill you. The original SUPERHOT also had challenges, where you would go through all the levels again but with certain restrictions, such as Katana only or no bullet time, which added replayability while not feeling overly repetitive like MCD did for me. I did have a fun time messing around with the new powers and some of the new weapons, but I feel for me the novelty wore off pretty quickly.

Some may argue this can be chalked up to the artistic purpose of conveying the message of the game. And while I can see it, I also quite frankly did not care enough about it to take it into consideration. I also found the infamous 2.5 hour waiting screen at the end (which apparently used to be longer) pretty annoying. Again, that definitely falls into the message/story they are trying to tell, but I personally was not engaged enough to find that enjoyable or thought-provoking or anything other than an annoyance.

Ultimately, I would say the game is still fine, I just wish they went more in the direction of the original game. I think if this was the original SUPERHOT, I would not be as critical, but alas. If you just want more SUPERHOT gameplay, then honestly this fills that want pretty well. If you want something similar to the original with more curated levels though, you're out of luck here.
 
Julton
183 produits enregistrés
1
29 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2022
This game had the potential to be great,

But the devs must've ran out of ideas...
Or, maybe they just became lazy.

The start of the game lures the player in with the promise of more hacks, more cores, and more levels--

but when you do get to the later levels:
the only rewards for beating them are small snippets of lore.

I had hoped that at the end of the game I would unlock a Sandbox.core, or God.core, but sadly the devs decided to play a prank on their player base by making it the least rewarding ending possible.

I don't mind the enemy spawning, it's like endless mode in the first game, but the level design is totally uninspired:
No jumping between moving trucks on a highway, no dodging between gears inside a giant clock:--
Don't get me wrong, the levels are well-designed for fair difficulty, but they lack the novelty of the original game.

When I first saw the hack mechanic I was excited to discover them all. There were some interesting ones like "lightning reflexes" and "flow recall".
Sadly, those two are the height of it: there're no more to discover after them.

The cores are fun to experiment with. A great idea, but like everything else in this game: it feels half-a$$ed. Only 3 unique cores? Did the devs run out of ideas?

Some ideas:
-H4X0r.core; press E to spawn and equip a random item. Choose from 4 hacks instead of 2. Hack: higher chance to spawn a firearm.
-Worm.core; press E to brainwash enemy, enemy throws held weapon then runs to nearest foe, enemy head explodes after three seconds. Hack: brainwashed enemies become spiky OR contagion spreads to nearby enemies when head explodes.
-Jump.core; press E to change between jump heights, deathstomp by default. Hack: Shockwave on landing.
-Psychic.core; catch and store bullets, press E to fire them back with a finger gun. Hack: store up bullets to shoot like a shotgun OR combine 2 bullets to shoot like a sniper.
-Melee.core; press E for sweep attack. Doubled enemy spawn count, faster enemy movement, no firearms. Hack: no delay between attacks.
-Speed.core; everything moves faster, press E for temporary player speed boost (slow down everything else). Hack: fullstop.
-Sandbox.core; select six hacks at the start. Hack: choose one additional core.
-God.core; invincibility, press E to kill all. Hack: explode with bullets when hit.
-Dodge.core; levels have a countdown timer, invincible enemies, press E for temporary invincibility. Hack: longer i-frames.
-highway.level; convoy of trucks, enemy spawn from truck cabin (add simple animation to look like enemy climbs onto roof from window).
-clock.level; like in Super Mario 64.
-mirrors.level; maze with glass walls, by the end of a long level most panes will be broken.
-hotel.level; penthouse suite with stairway up to roof, stairway down to three smaller rooms, and a moving window cleaning platform.
-elevators.level; 4 elevators in one shaft, each moving up and down between 3 floors, each floor has enemy spawn doors, elevator doors always open, enemies path to doorway and shoot into shaft.
-butcher.hack; recently defeated enemy body parts can be picked up and used as weapons.
-stickman.hack; player hitbox width reduced.
-antivirus.hack; player can kill special enemies.
-bumpfire.hack; thrown firearms fire at nearest enemy upon impact.
-highpressure.hack; increased player bullet speed.
-dwarf.hack; player size halved.
-randomizer.hack; shotguns can shoot like snipers, rifles like shotguns, pistols like rifles, etc.


I do like this game.. I just can't help but feel that it could have been so much MORE.

Imagine what it could've been if there was a level editor, custom hack creation tool, and mod support for custom cores. So much potential.



To any dev who might be reading this:

Did you encounter too many bugs?
Did you become too fixated on the jaded meta-narrative of "less is more"?
Did your focus on difficulty prevent you from experimenting more with the gameplay?
Did you simply lose interest in the project?

You don't have to answer me, I just had to ask.
 
Chyt1
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2022
Superhot with some light rogue-like elements thrown in.

Honestly, the game suffers massively for moving from hand-crafted combat puzzles to a procedurally generated sets of levels. It's fun to just have a bit more Superhot at first, but once you realise that you're literally just doing the same few levels over and over with some very slight variation in gameplay based on the 'hacks' you acquire, it's really difficult to stay the distance.

And no, just because the game's narrative addresses a theme of boredom and repetition doesn't mean you should forgive it for being boring and repetitive.
 
invi
1,074 produits enregistrés

21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
23.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mai 2022
MCD feels like dlc, and bad, disappointing dlc at that.

Gameplay-wise, MCD is mostly the same as the original Superhot. There are a few new concepts and features, and it's just barely enough to keep you from getting bored. If you just want more of the same from the original with a tiny bit of extra spice, you'll get exactly what you wanted.

The place where MCD really falls flat is the plot. It's very, very, VERY apparent that the developers wanted to have the story be a big part of the game, and they very clearly think it IS considering some of the decisions they made, but it's just not. The original's story was relatively flat, sure, but it existed. MCD has literally zero substance. Just vague elaborations on the lore from the original that don't add up to anything, a red voice telling you to stop playing and give up, and an ending sequence that requires you to wait 2.5 hours REAL TIME before you're allowed to play the game again.

If you're set on playing MCD, and you didn't get it for free, definitely wait till it's on sale. I got it for $10 and that felt like an ok price for how much time I got out of it. $25 is definitely too much for how disappointing it is.
 
LanceFyre99
0

0
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2020
拥有原版superhot的玩家可以在新作发行之际免费获得新作
这个设定真的太加好感了
superhot初代游戏就非常好玩，爽快，独特的子弹时间模式，一击必杀的击杀体验
在续作中，游戏的体量比起前作大了太多，内容丰富了太多太多
游戏采用肉鸽类关卡制，每次进入关卡都是不同的随机生成的几个种类地图
比起前作，敌人的种类变多了，AI明显得到了提升，虽然还是一样命中率感人，但是整体难度上升了很多，武器的种类也变多了，长柄近战武器敌人也会格挡玩家的子弹了，出现了小BOSS一样敌人的设定，会使用各种技能，居然还无敌！考验玩家技巧和运气的时候到了
本作最大的改变是增加了技能，玩家在进行游戏的过程中会解锁一些核心和技能，在关卡中随机2选1来使用，各种技能的搭配，总会产生意想不到的效果，这就是这款游戏带来的魅力吧
本作的成就，比起前作的直观来说，变得很奇怪，看说明完全不明白是什么意思，但是随着剧情的推进也会慢慢解锁，不过还是喜欢前作那样的成就，完成的时候成就感和现在简直不可同日而语
本作在保留前作所有的优点的情况下能够扩展如此丰富的内容，非常推荐想要短时间体验爽的玩家来体验


欢迎关注我们的鉴赏家:突突突发糖辣！ 一起感受游戏的魅力
 
TioPlato

这个游戏很简单，杀红人就可以了。
其实这种红人最好对付了，如果他朝你跑来那等他挥拳的时候你可以借力对着他一拳，让他头朝地摔到脑袋就碎裂了。
如果他拿着枪的话也没问题，预判他开抢的位置就行。我曾经就在极度愤怒的情况下，顶着十二发步枪弹，在他缓冲期间一拳使他缴械。
我赌场打架，打了75波，完事还能跑三十公里，人和人的体质不能一概而论。
 
Church
1,111 produits enregistrés
1
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
19.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I enjoyed this game, maybe even more than the first game. However, there are a lot of things that might be unappealing to some people:

- The game is very repetitive
- It's buggy
- At the end of the game, there is a 2.5-hour unskippable credits scene

The game is the same thing stretched out for a couple of hours. You spawn on a random level, kill a certain amount of red guys, then spawn into the next level, and do the same thing. The reason I don't find it bad is because as you progress, you unlock more and more abilities. These abilities drastically affect gameplay, making it a lot more compelling. They are the sole reason I like this game as much as the first one.

The bugs aren't that bad. You might encounter a few while playing but they won't make the game any less fun. One bug I encountered was that I didn't get the first achievement (which you get for launching the game for the first time). After I beat the game I had all of the achievements except for that one. To get it I had to delete my game data, launch the game, then reupload my old save data from the cloud. The dev team is working on fixing up the game so I don't think bugs will be an issue for much longer.

The unskippable 2.5-hour credit scene doesn't allow you to play the game until you've watched it all. This wasn't a big issue for me because I just minimized the game and went to do something else, and I imagine this won't be that big of an issue for most steam users. However, I feel bad for console players since they can't use their console at all for two and a half hours. It seems that it just wastes their time and electricity. The reason for this credit scene is so that players get to take a break and reflect on the game. It's a moral of one of the main themes, and it executes it well. Nevertheless, this move will cost them a lot of players.

If these issues don't bother you then I recommend it. Waiting to buy the game could be beneficial because the majority of the bugs will be patched, and you might be able to get it on sale.
 
LangBang
202 produits enregistrés
0

That was highly annoying, to the point where I didn't even feel like trying to get back to the main menu.

If you're going to make another one, please, don't do that again.
I'm reinstalling your first game.

I usually don't leave reviews, but this deserved it, sorry guys.

17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Это не тот суперхот, который мы ждали. Или как суперхот попытался стать рогулайком, но не смог.
Оригинальный суперхот был безусловным шедевром. Интересная, пусть и простенькая история, куча крутых челенджей и разумеется божественно подобранная гемплейная формула:
* уровень завершается со смертью последнего чувака
* все события на уровне заскриптованы и не подвержены рандому, можно выучить кто откуда и когда вылезет
* уровень проходится за десятки секунд, не жалко терять прогресс
* все уровни чем-то отличаются. Не воспринимаются как "о, ещё одна безликая арена с N входов"
* уровни относительно сложные. Нормой является умирать десятки раз, прежде чем получится отточить навыки или подобрать решение к прохождению конкретного
* после смерти уровень начинается заново
В итоге умирать не страшно, а наоборот добавляет азарта, с каждой попыткой учишься проходить конкретно этот уровень все лучше и лучше, все быстрее и быстрее или вообще проходить уровень. Буквально кожей чувствуется азарт, вызов и то как ты становишься все лучше и лучше в игре. Чувствуется душевный подъем и хочется порекомендовать игру всем своим друзьям, если бы они у меня были.

Но довольно о хорошем.

Юра, мы все просрали. Казалось бы, на первый взгляд перед нами все тот же суперхот. Замедленное время, красные чуваки, огнестрел с микрообоймой, ближний бой, метание предметов. Все как мы любим. Но! Сюжет был полностью убран. Забудьте, никакой истории тут нет. Несколько фейковых гейм овера и уверения что тут больше ничего нет вызывают лишь фейспалм. Такое ощущение, что сюжет писал уборщик компании SUPERHOT. Ладно, сюжета нет, допустим он не так важен. А что же по геймплею? Геймплей полностью ушел в сторону, потеряв все свои положительные качества:
* есть очень маленький набор безликих арен, как из бесконечного режима оригинала. Просто локация, N входов с которых прут случайные чуваки, зачастую появляясь из-за спины и стреляя ещё даже не полностью проявившись.
* есть что-то вроде игровой сессии. Выбираешь некий основной скил из доступных, потом генерируется набор сражений и точек выбора перков между ними. Каждое сражение длится до какого-то количества убийств, после чего все оставшиеся умирают
* На всю сессию даются несколько жизней. Умирать страшно. Не сколько страшно, сколько крайне противно, ибо теряешь прогресс за несколько минут, а то и десятков минут.
* Сражения в основном крайне простые, так что до тех пор пока не встретится более серьезный вызов, игра кажется рутинной и скучной.
* Когда же начинаются сложные уровни, они вызывают лишь раздражение. Поскольку потеря всех жизней, которая неизбежна в случае повышения сложности, отбрасывает тебя далеко назад и все проведенное за прохождением игры время просто летит в трубу.
* Рандом во всем. Увы если для качественных рогулайков это работает и обеспечивает перепроходимость и интерес, то тут он наоборот раздражает. Ну и не работает это если концептуально просто жонглирование малым количеством арен, каждая из которых ничем радикально от другой не отличается.

В результате этих нововведений игра из драйвового сложного шутера в котором адреналин не покидает тебя всю игру, несмотря на небольшое количество контента превратилась в безликое нечто с кучей контента, но в которое не интересно играть ни когда все получается, ни тем более когда с повышением сложности получаться перестает.

К счастью как счастливый обладатель оригинала я получил эту игру бесплатно, так что потраченных денег не жаль. По инерции наиграл уже несколько часов, в тайне надеясь на улучшение, на то что сюжет с какого-то момента таки проклюнется или ещё на что-то, но нет. Достаточно пройти 1-2 сессии, чтобы понять всю игру. Всю игру будет одно и то же, только по мелочи будут добавляться скилы и противники, что впрочем игру не спасает. Может быть даже, если не сравнивать игру с оригиналом, то все не так уж и плохо, но увы оригинал был буквально шедевром, но вместо того, чтобы сделать следующий проект тем же самым, только с бОльшим количеством уровней, оружия и возможностей у противников, вместо того, чтобы продолжить или сделать еще один сюжет команда сделала куча контента, просрав собственно ключевую деталь - геймплей.
 
YarikTH
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Ocelot
1,072 produits enregistrés

11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2023
Під час запуску продовження шикарного оригіналу виникає думка, що тут буде все те саме, але на нових рівнях із сюжетом у тому самому ключі, відчуття це триває десь ще хвилин 10-15, після чого настає справжнє розуміння того, що це дійсно сіквел, хоч і не номерний.

Найперше, що відчувається – різкий старт: немає попередньої інформації стосовно сюжету, повідомлення на DOS-інтерфейсі максимально абстрактні, навіть для тих, хто попередню частину затер до дір; невеличке навчання і в бій. Одразу в лівому верхньому куті кидаються в очі піксельні серця, котрі мені довго не вдавалося витратити, але через годину стало зрозуміло, що це не просто кількість пошкоджень, котрі можна отримати перед остаточною смертю, яких за замовчуванням два, бо вони відносяться не до поточних рівнів, а до місцевих вузлів – сукупності рівнів, мінімум з п’яти. Тобто, у разі повної втрати усіх, починається перезапуск з початку послідовності, при чому сам їх набір теж випадковим чином змінюється.

Оскільки було почато з них, то продовжимо цю тему. Їх стало у півтора рази більше, але десь половина перейшла з оригіналу, проте була серйозно модифікована та перероблена під специфіку нового ігрового процесу. Вони так само дуже цікаво створені, а також наповнені в рази більшою кількість інтерактивних об’єктів, які, у свою чергу, ще й отримали значно розширений асортимент, котрий не вибивається із загального дизайну. Графіка залишилася така сама, але за рахунок більш якісної реалізації освітлення та зменшення його сліпучої дії, деталізація рівнів підвищилася, що тільки ще один плюс на рахунок проєкту. На тлі грає більш виразний саундтрек, а для одного рівня навіть записали щось схоже на ремікс із саундтреку DOOM.

Наступне нововведення – це можливість певну кількість разів за одну послідовність рівнів обирати собі hack’и, що є аналогом перків з відомого проєкту Crimsonland. Діють вони тільки у межах одного вузла, а також на вибір надається лише один з двох, котрі хоч і випадково видаються грою, проте частково орієнтуються на початковий обраний, котрий зветься core. Сюди входить збільшення максимуму сердець, їх повне відновлення, розширення магазину зброї, починати рівень зі зброєю, можливість уникати рукопашного пошкодження чи пришвидшити рух протагоніста, переселення в червоного чувака та можливість вбивства його під час падіння тощо: так, тепер це не входить у стандартний набор навичок, котрі відкривалися з часом у Superhot.

Червоні чуваки так само наші цілі, але, тепер вони з’являються на рівні постійно й необмежено, вам необхідно знищити певну кількість, яку неможливо дізнатися, тому процес запам’ятовування шляху вже не варіант: додатково, місце початку різанини може бути в будь-якій точці локації, так само і порядку появ ворогів немає. Їх асортимент розширили: звичайними шипованими – після вбивства розлітаються у певні сторони кулі; моноблоковими – зброя в руках такого самого кольору як вони, тому неможливо вибити її чи підняти потім; броньованими – частина покриті бетоном, вицілювати треба ті зони, де його немає; буде ще особливий тип, що включає декілька варіантів, що мають зв’язок із сюжетом. Для спрощення бою з ними є вже згадані перки, котрі частково нівелюють їх переваги, так само як і новий вид вогнепальної – щось на шталт railgun із серій Quake чи Unreal, у котрого відсутній недолік повільного польоту кулі.

Якщо уважно грати в оригінал, то стає зрозумілим злиття головного героя із системою. MIND CONTROL DELETE обслуговує саме цю ідею, тому головного меню в нас немає, а лише вузлова структура, котра розгалужується на: набори рівнів, серед яких є і класичні нескінченні, фрагменти чату, блоки отримання hack’ів та core’ів та суто сюжетні. Тільки звідси гру можна поставити на паузу, а також спеціальною кнопкою вийти у підменю, де вже присутні класичні налаштування. Сам сценарій змінив жанр з фантастики на артхаус, що підкріплений спеціальними прийомами, що притаманні роботам Девіда Лінча, тому частинки інформації потрібно буде постійно тримати в голові, щоб нове надходження не загубилося. Фінал гірший вийшов, але зі своїми цікавими речами, хоча й з дірами, які вже потрібно самому заповнювати.

У кінцевому рахунку фанати отримали гідне продовження, яке має свої плюси і мінуси, але неодмінно сподобається всім зацікавленим. Досягнення не вимагають ніяких особливих дій, треба банально завершити всі звичайні рівні та понатискати на доступні вузли; знайти потрібно лише один єдиний термінал з 32, а в кінці нічого не робити 2.5 години, тому пограти в задоволення не відволікаючись на керівництво можна без проблем.
 
Bloody Punisher
317 produits enregistrés
0

So far so good. I like that is a rogue-lite which is one of my favorite genres. The procedural generation makes each level fresh.

I really have high hopes for this game so far.

EDIT: After playing it and unlocking the first mind "ADDICT", I can say for certain that I have never ever felt so OP in a game. His ability HOTSWITCH makes you switch places with another enemy but it kills the one that appears in your old position.

There was a situation where I had a gun, I threw the gun and HOTSWITCH to an enemy that was in the way of the gun I threw, and then I grabbed the gun and killed another enemy on the other side of the room. This felt like MATRIX, which I love.
 
Tentou

16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2022
SUPERHOT 系列最拉胯的作品
相比 SUPERHOT 原版创意十足的 Meta 元素，以及 SUPERHOT VR 版身临其境的电影感，SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 实在说不上是一款优秀的游戏。

该加又不该加的剧情
可能是制作组设定的剧情在原版已经表达得淋漓尽致了，本作几乎没有剧情。
而作为一款衍生作品，要么就干脆没有剧情，要么就做一些剧情拓展，而偏偏就是这个几乎，成为了最差的选项：游戏中偶尔在关卡之间会穿插纯走路的桥段，表现的概念与原版别无二致，对于这种关卡类游戏有非常出众的割裂效果。

该长又不该长的关卡
每一个大关卡采用地图式布局，玩家自行选择节点，最终到达出口，前往下一个大关卡（类似 FTL, Slay the Spire 等）。
每一个节点又包含若干个小关卡，通关每个小关卡有几率获得 hack 奖励，用于提升玩家强度，通关若干小关卡后才算完成节点。

每一个小关卡短小而不精悍，几乎每一关给人的体验都是：“就这？我还没爽够呢！”经常在战斗的高潮戛然而止，响起“SUPER HOT”的提示音，强制进入下一个小关卡。而节点与节点之间的 hack 奖励又会清零，这直接导致玩家切换节点继续前进时，玩家经常会忘记已经没有了某 hack 奖励，需要再次重新获取，负能量满满。

该有又不该有的野心
尽管有些玩家在评测中说本作含有 roguelike 元素，但是制作组还是非常有自知之明地没有在介绍中出现任何 roguelike 字样——尽管在游玩的过程中你能清晰地感受到制作组想往 roguelike 上靠的意图。
是的，在此我需要提醒那些误会的玩家们，这款游戏可不能算作 roguelike 哦。

但是如果制作组能够再多打磨打磨，去掉多余的桥段，延长小关卡的长度，加入继承部分 hack 的机制，是非常有可能成为一款并肩原版和 VR 的衍生作品的，实在令人扼腕。
 
Crooner
197 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2020

Produit reçu gratuitement

John Wick simulator 2020.

Same formula as the original but with roguelike elements added (Choose between upgrades every so often, Level selection tree, etc..). The game play has been tightened and polished so even if you've never played SH you will still love it. The storytelling has improved as well with multiple playable characters and a bevy of new weapons. There's tons of love poured into this project and it definitely deserves your money and attention.

-Casey
 
RockyBalbroa

Non recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

After I completed SUPERHOT and unlocked every achievement all I wanted was SUPERHOT 2 with same concept just with more levels, more possibilities, more weapon, more of everything just implemented as same as in original game. Instead we got SUPERHOT MIND CONTROL DELETE - a procedurally generated mess.

To be honest, I partially got what I wanted: more levels, more enemies more weapons and more posibilities. The problem is, they were delivered in such a way that I lost fun and interest in game after first 2 hours and continued to play to see what content the game has, whats there after the end and for unlocking achievements.

The biggest problem of the game is it is fully RNG based what I really hate in games. Everything but placement of weapons and objects on levels is RNG. Damn, even order of levels themselves is RNG.
To provide some context, game uses rogue-like structure: you have 'Nodes' which contain 10+ levels (there are about 30+ levels and each node mixes 10+ of them and in case of death, game changes the maps and their order), each level has RNG amount and variety of enemies.

Due to RNG nature of Nodes I didnt enjoy maps as they were getting freaking repetative and I didnt have chance to get used to them because you always getting pushed by enemies so I ended up with jumping around the maps like bitten by bee in the ass. Speaking about enemies, MIND CONTROL DELETE introduces 3 invincible enemies which cant be killed or stunned so player should keep distance from them while trying not to get killed by plenty of other enemies. I didnt have that much problems with first 2 of them but the last one,damn, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ always spawns with weapons and because it cant be stunned game turned into "matrix simulator", sweating trying to avoid bullets while also keeping an eye on other enemies. If devs call it challenge then I strongly disagree, RNG based games are not challenging they are annoying.

Game also introduces new abilities called Cores and Hacks. Cores are essentially Hacks with one exception: they work throughout the Node while Hacks are given 2 or 3 times and you have to choose between 2 of them and when player completes the Node game just resets choosen Core and Hacks and this is the first problem. The second problem is, due to again RNG system player simply cant experiment with different combos of hacks because you just choose from 2 of hacks given by the game. I would fully enjoy all these new hacks and cores if they were implented in seperate "Challenges" mode as in original SUPERHOT.

After you complete all the nodes you have to wait 2:30 hours (changed from 8 hours in latest update) in order to fully complete the game and all you get is PURE.core (1 hp, no hacks, no cores). I wonder how masochist you should be to use this core in MIND CONTROL DELETE because game simply isnt designed for the gameplay of original SUPERHOT, at least 2 hp is needed.

Game is overall not rewarding at all. You get ♥♥♥♥ Core for waiting 2:30 hours, you get small portion of "lore" for beating '100 Node' and so on, just useless ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

I could write more about my complaints in detail, but that would be even longer post.
I do not recommend this game even during sales, better pass and hope for true sequel which isnt ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up as SUPERHOT MIND CONTROL DELETE.
 
#AKS

Non recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 25 mars 2019
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

The original SUPERHOT truly was a work of art. But this? This feels more like an incoherent and directionless sandbox of ideas.

The devs are either trying too hard, trying to do too much at once, or have lost the vision of what made the original such a masterpiece. Yes, it's early access. But any decent EA title at least gives you an impression of the framework they're building. I can't tell what they're even trying to do here, other than add some bells and whistles on a formula they've already used.

It's going to take a LOT of polish and organization before I change my mind on recommending this one.

My issues with MCD:

* The current levels are SMALL. Really small. They are cramped and unoriginal. Open them up! Make them even bigger than we saw in the original game, not smaller. This is a huge step backwards. You're killing any possibility of exploration.

* Levels just end abruptly with remaining enemies shattering after a certain number of kills, why?! Maybe these levels aren't a part of the actual story, but I can't tell. I seriously hope this mechanic isn't in your final draft. I miss the thrill of getting into a beer bottle vs shotgun duel with that one last, pesky enemy.

* There is no logical progression of the story. Unlike the original (which had a unique and engaging story that was hard to put down,) I'm not feeling any incentive or desire to see what happens next. I don't even know what the heck is happening to be honest.

* Vanilla is easy enough, why are you giving me hacks to make things even easier? Try implementing viruses instead, give me a challenge. But if you're going to add abilities, try to be a bit more original than implementing uninspired ones like "run faster." Boring.

* The enemies are pretty brainless. They ignore any defensive utility in the environment and just blitz you with no regard for their life. The enemies haven't changed much either, other than making some more durable. The lack of variety was acceptable in the original but you have to raise the bar. Give us some high mobility kung-fu experts, phase-shifters, something, anything.

I offer this criticism constructively, because SUPERHOT will always hold a special place in my heart. But all in all MCD feels more like a community mod. I will be incredibly disappointed if the devs don't have a lot more in store for us. Until that happens, I can't recommend this one.

Edit: After waiting almost a year, I gave this another honest chance. My original save was deleted because the devs claimed they changed so much that it was necessary. That got me excited to see what they had in store for me. To my complete disappointment, almost nothing has changed. With the exception of a lackluster and hollow story, every single one of my original points still stand. Levels are STILL really small. Levels STILL end abruptly without reason. Levels are STILL really easy. And the AI is STILL really dumb.

Maybe I'll try again in another year, but I doubt it. It's clear the devs aren't interested in bringing anything new to the table, instead they're just trying to cash in on the success of the original, using an almost identical formula which is somehow inferior to its predecessor.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
King
0

LAUNCH UPDATE:

the final game is better than I could have possibly expected. the updated graphics are gorgeous and minimalist, the soundtrack sets the tone perfectly, the story is as dark as ever and brilliant if you just dare seek it out. whether you're into the lore of SUPERHOT or you just enjoy the slow-motion violence (and who could blame you), I can't recommend Mind Control Delete enough.

again, play it

Recommandé
13.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
Anyone who played the original SUPERHOT can testify that it was a truly innovative experience. And a completely unbalanced one. Any balance that the game held was achieved through level design and not through game systems.
Well. They’ve fixed it. MIND CONTROL DELETE game realizes the true potential of SUPERHOT ideas to the fullest by completely overhauling the formula they developed for the first game. Here are the most important changes:

1. The game has become balanced. Enemies shoot a little slower. They don’t spam the shots as much. Now there are audio cues whenever a gun-armed enemy enters your line of sight so as to let you know where bullets will soon start flying from. Whenever an enemy you haven’t seen creeps up on you from behind and lands an attack on you, you get a warning and not a hit. Seeing how enemies move silently, it negates a lot of potential frustration.

2. MIND CONTROL DELETE has embraced a partially rogue-lite structure:
a. The game is separated into ‘nodes’ which are a set of levels sandwiched by upgrades you can use. As you complete nodes, you upgrade yourself and progress the story, but inside a node the progress doesn’t save. Each node takes about 5-15 minutes to complete. So, when you lose progress it’s not as frustrating as in regular rogue-lites.
b. You’ve got health now. Don’t get too excited though: you’re only allowed a couple of mistakes for the entirety of those 5-15 minutes.
c. The levels are handcrafted and chosen randomly from for each node. There are not too many of them, but they are really big by SUPERHOT standards. Level-design is solid and allows for smooth flow of both player and enemies throughout the level which is critical for a shooter.
d. The player upgrades themselves with different abilities – partially deliberate, partially randomized. The developers have done a great job with them – almost all of the upgrades in the game feel meaningful and transform the experience greatly: stronger punches that reflect bullets, throwables turned into grenades, signature hotswitch, boomerang katana – you name it. Some are less impressive, like a ‘more bullets in a gun’ upgrade but generally the player really does feel empowered by new abilities.

3. More power means more challenge. Which comes in three flavors:
a. New enemies. Some enemies have only one vulnerable body part, and some explode upon death.
b. Levels can oppose the player as well. Sometimes explosive outgrowths spawn across the level, sometimes paths get obstructed by digital ruble and sometimes the perspective itself starts warping giving you a hard time estimating the distance to an enemy and\or whether there are objects between you and him. Sometimes it’s a combination of a few.
c. Nemeses. As you progress, you will free other entities that got consumed by the game, and sometimes they will randomly spawn on a level to hunt you down. Each of the three have unique attacks, and are all indestructible – so your best bet is to finish the level as fast as possible when they show up. The things you say when you hear their spawn audio cue on a level close to the end of a long node…

And all of it you will throw away. Because the developers have decided to go all the way in exploring the problems of gaming addiction “of which there has been no scientific confirmation whatsoever“ despite the foundation of most real-time games being player developing a set of conditional reflexes. Across the game you will slowly amass your stuff, and then you will slowly be stripped of it. And that’s the entire point of the game. Many people seem to hate it, and that’s good, that’s clearly intended. When put in words, it might appear shallow, but when you are riding this empowerment-disempowerment curve, experience it, exist through it – then it stops feeling like a cheap trick and starts being a powerful deliberation on the nature of gaming.

MIND CONTROL DELETE reveals who the SUPERHOT Team really are. Very much like FromSoftware they’ve shown a curious trait of videogames as a medium: if you have a good enough gameplay, story-wise you can spit in the face of public taste and create something so far from the mainstream it will offend people. With the original SUPERHOT I thought the developers are just apt gimmick-riders with a peculiar sense of style, going for another cyberpunk thriller. Now I see that they are true experimenters testing the boundaries of the medium. I can only hope that their first non-SUPERHOT game will follow the same trend of liberation and experimentation.
 
Orderly
571 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2021
The first game was a true masterpiece. This sequel /update / ??? strays too far from what made the original so compelling by adding elements that change the formula too much and make me care less about the levels, enemies and story.

Levels no longer are based on eliminating all the enemies and the levels themselves get repeated over and over and over and over. The new enemy type that ruined the game for me was the final straw. Superhot was about feeling like John Wick fighting human enemy types not random dudes that spawn in front of you and explode into bullets. I can deal with enemies spawning behind me every two seconds but cheap hits in a game like this is not cool.

9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2020
Fun for the first few hours until you realise it's the same arenas on repeat with endlessly spawning enemies until you kill enough in that arena. Instead of carefully constructed unique environments, you go through the game doing levels which consist of a number of arenas (the same limited number of arenas on shuffle). Kill enough enemies and you'll advance to the next arena. Die and you'll get knocked back to the first arena.

As you play through the game, you'll unlock different skills such as charging at an enemy and force pull your katana you just threw or found on the floor. You can only use one skill at a time in a single and you choose which one at the start of a level. Skills are kinda nice. They add another dynamic to the game that would be very tedious without them. That being said, I find myself only using the charge skill because it's practically a get out of jail free card. The others I've found so far don't feel anywhere near as potent, but maybe I just haven't played with them enough.

Along with these skills, you can unlock buffs. Buffs are additional effects such as piercing bullets, stronger punch, kills reload your gun instantly etc. You start each level with no buffs and you'll get a choice between 2 buffs between every couple of arenas in a level. There are some buffs you'll rarely want because they rarely do anything for you, such as headshots ricochet bullets towards enemies; it sounds good until you realise the bullets ricochet towards an enemy's current position, meaning if they're moving (which they're going 95% of the time) they're not getting hit. Ever. This means in some situations your 2 options are a clear cut choice. Your choice of buffs can also lead to some very potent combos; for example, the "kills reload your guns" and the "more bullets in each gun" buffs can lead to you killing a huge chunk of enemies in short periods of time. I've used it a number of times to get out of situations I should've died in because I've gotten surrounded by too many enemies to deal with otherwise.

I'm at 4 hours at the time of this review. Outside of new skills and buffs I've unlocked, I feel like the game has done very little to make things interesting, which it sorely needs to do given it's shuffling arenas based gameplay loop. The biggest change so far has been the introduction of traps which explode bullets when you get near and an enemy which randomly spawns which you cannot kill and will chase you around the arena, forcing you to always be on the move. Both were introduced at the same time. To me, the game had been consistent on it's difficulty up until this point and suddenly spiked because of these new mechanics. This spike, I've found it more frustrating than engaging.

I played and finished the first game a few years ago. It was short, but sweet and an experience I'll never forget. The devs gave this game out for free to those who owned the original. I was quite excited for this game, expecting it to be more of the original, but instead we've been given something tedious and uninteresting once you've played enough. It's not a bad game, but it's not good either, especially in comparison to the original. It still have the same basic mechanics as the original but has not even half it's soul. If you just want more of the mechanics, this will be great for you. If you wanted the same puzzle-like shooter experience the original provided, you won't find it here.
 
Tyfuzzle
660 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2023
ТЕРПЕНИЕ ЗАКОНЧИЛОСЬ НА ОДНООБРАЗНОСТИ

ПЛЮСЫ
  • Наконец разбавили геймплей улучшениями, благодаря которым появилось разнообразия и новые тактики.

  • Ура добавили 1 крутой трэк, но играет он только в локации “Ночной клуб”.

  • По мере прохождения будут появляться новые усложняющие элементы, что не хватало основной компании.

МИНУСЫ
  • В одном уровне упоролись и возвращали в начало 5 раз наверное. Такой бред! Три раза ещё норм, но игрок каждый раз подходит ближе к цели и вас откидывают назад в самое начало.

  • Игра тонет в одинаковых локациях на каждом этапе зачистки. Всего 29 новых уровней, но мне кажется что их меньше. Они просто такие однотипные. Игра рандомит уровни для зачистки, но вы можете играть 3 локации зачистки на одинаковых уровнях. Что сразу кидается в глаза.

  • Слишком долгая кампания за один присест пройти не получится. Если играть подходами по 20-30 минут с большими перерывами, то возможно получится. Так блэт, я вернулся, когда достиг этапа 3 и немного 4 уровни стали пипец душные.

  • Чем ближе к концу, тем сильнее задушили сложностью. Говорил о новых элементах в плюсах, а вот когда они сразу в одном уровне вот тут вам и минус. Вас ограничивают в выборе тактики.

  • Режим блеватрона - вы не видите, что происходит вдали, но при движении вперёд предметы приближаются к вам. Выглядит это ужасно 2-3 уровня в таком режиме и у вас укачивание. Просто кошмар!

ИТОГИ

Купил дополнение паком за ~330 руб, вроде DLC обошлось в 213р. За фулл прайс брать не рекомендую, можете по большой скидке взять на пробу. Наиграл 5,1ч, что не является конечным результатом,т.к. бросил. Здесь уже постарались куда лучше в плане разнообразия геймплея, но переборщили с количеством этапов. Очень сильно затянули полное прохождение по ачивкам видно, что большинство бросили после второго этапа. Игра утопает в однообразии локаций, врагов и с каждой следующее душат сильнее и сильнее. В начале у вас 3-4 мисси в этапе, где нужно убить 4-5 врагов. А, чем дальше, тем больше усложнений. Появляются мины, взрывные враги, ваша бессмертная копия с 1 из доступных ядер, больше этапов теперь их стало 8, возможно 11 врагов на каждой локации нужно убивать по 8-11. В начале было весело, но чем больше играл тем более скучным всё становилось. Если ищете драйвовый геймплей - вам не сюда!

Всем спасибо, кто дочитал. Обзор был написан после дропа на 3-ем этапе и частично 4-ом.
 
AxelBlade
1,380 produits enregistrés
0

Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2020
The original was brilliant but short. And so this 'new' game has 'LONGER!' plastered all over the store page. But how did they fix the issue? More content? Hell naw, just implement clown closets and 'kill N dudes' objective. Rinse and repeat, over and over. Aaand they also managed to break the fine balance of it's main gameplay loop by small but important changes in favor of perks. In the end it feels like a step back - less cerebral gameplay that doesn't challenge your wits.
Otherwise it's the same SUPERHOT formula but worse. See, the simplicity of gameplay and the design of actual encounters were the things that made original so memorable. Now simplicity moved away in favor of bloat, and smartly designed encounters moved away to randomly spawning dudes from clown closets. It's MUCH longer game, but the point is it just ain't fun anymore. Original game lasted for 2 hours and it was so good you wished for more. MCD will get you bored in an hour.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
22.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2021
终于是通关了，别问我为什么都20小时了才通关，问就是不小心把那个100节点当成了主线磨了好久......
这作给我的感觉总体上是不如一代的。一代作为一个小体量的游戏，将自己的特色在短短2、3个小时内展现得淋漓尽致，通了主线之后，我会有一种想去玩挑战与无尽的欲望，并且在过了许久之后还忍不住回味一下。
但二代却没有给我上述的感受。我承认，在刚开始玩的时候，它本身的时停特色与肉鸽模式的结合确实挺讨我欢心，但在经历过漫长的、重复的关卡之后，这份新鲜感逐渐消失，到后面就完全没有了一开始的激情（也有100节点的影响）。二代最大的问题就在于关卡的重复冗长，难度高虽然也是一个问题但不是最重要的一点。制作组可能也考虑到了这一点，所以设计了30个左右的地图，增加了新的敌人类型（会爆炸、“钙质化”等），甚至设计了三个类似于小boss的敌人，但这并不能很好地解决这个问题。
剧情也是十分的意识流。一代好歹有个比较明确的故事线，但二代就压根不知道有没有一个具体的故事，一条条断片式的信息杂乱无章，我甚至都不知道最后一层的“放弃”是为何，通关之后仍是一脸懵逼。并且留下了很多坑，那三个小boss的背景也没介绍，设计这个游戏的也不知道是什么组织，设计出来的目的也不明。（或许二代本就没有主线？）那两个小时的数据恢复也给我整得迷迷糊糊的，不过yysy最后那几个彩蛋小游戏挺有意思的。
总而言之嘛，还是给了好评，因为在这么多地图与敌人的设计上能够看出制作组是用心的，解密也很不错。希望能够再遇到这样有特色的游戏，顺便期待一下能有续作。
 
失眠ing
263 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Hru jsem dostal zdarma, protože vlastním původní titul. Strašně moc děkuji tvůrcům, kteří se k tomuhle kroku rozhodli.

Jsou to tři roky, co jsem se tu rozplýval nad prvním dílem této již třídílné série (SUPERHOT, SUPERHOT VR a tohle). A prakticky nic se nezměnilo, zároveň je MCD ale zcela jiným zážitkem. Vysvětlím.

To, co zůstalo stejné, jsou základy hratelnosti. Čas se hýbe pouze tehdy, když se pohybuje vaše postava. Hra je spíše než akční FPS řežba zaměřená na taktizování a nyní sice nemáte jeden život, ale dva, i když ani to není moc a když si nedáte pozor, skončíte brzy pod drnem. Nepřátelé jdou po jednom zásahu dolů. Vy musíte plánovat, kam střílet na pohybující se červené panáčky, uhýbat kulkám letícím vaším směrem a případně se i jít schovat někam, kde nejste tak moc otevření. V tomhle ohledu se nic nezměnilo.

Co je však jiné, je stavba levelů, potažmo celé hry. Je tu příběh, ale opět je upozaděný a není zas tak moc důležitý. Celkem tu najdete 32 levelů, což je rozhodně nárůst oproti jedničce. Jenže na rozdíl od lineárního procházení jednoho levelu za druhým tu najdete tzv. uzly a právě v nich naleznete pár z těchto levelů. Když je dáte bez úmrtí, odemkne se vám další uzel, který je těžší, protože má levelů vícero, případně má méně míst na vylepšení vaší postavy nebo nabízí něco unikátního.

Ano, další velkou novinkou jsou schopnosti, zde pojmenované hacky. Na začátku každého uzlu si zvolíte jeden z těch hlavních (hotswitch z jedničky, o život navíc atp.) a pak se vám v průběhu jednotlivých uzlů čas od času dá na výběr ze dvou hacků, jejichž počet neustále narůstá, čím dále ve hře jste. Kromě toho tu je také více druhů nepřátel, více zbraní a celkově to působí jako takový nabušenější bratříček prvního dílu.

Jenže... díky svému zaměření na roguelite prvky zde vyvěrá na povrch i hromada negativ. Předně to je logicky náhodnost celého průchodu hrou, kdy každý uzel náhodně vygeneruje jak nepřátele (a pokud máte "štěstí", dočkáte se i takových, kteří jsou nesmrtelní a musíte před nimi utíkat), tak i lokace, které se vám tu objeví a taktéž i hacky. A věřte, že některé mapy jsou lehčí než ostatní, zatímco ty otevřenější bez možnosti úkrytu nedokážete dát bez ztráty kytičky. Tedy života. Je to frustrující zvlášť ke konci hry, kdy musíte projít nějakých patnáct levelů a opravdu to není zábava, když stačí chvilka nepozornosti a je konec. U prvního dílu se šlo hezky po jednom levelu, který jste si museli pořádně nacvičit a nic nebylo dáno do rukou náhody. Zde tak ale funguje většina hry a je to občas na zabití.

Celá hra je postavená jen na uzlech, kdy procházíte neustále ty stejné mapy, bojujete proti nepřátelům a po čase se to celé začne tak nějak ohrávat. Ano, stále se jedná o výjimečnou a neuvěřitelně stylizovanou hru, ale když už po desáté jste na jedné mapě, tak to nemá takové grády. Právě proto se tohle nedá zas tak moc srovnávat s prvním dílem, protože ten je v určitých ohledech lepší. Tady naleznete všeho víc, zároveň je to ale tak podivně namixované. Tím ale netvrdím, že by to byla špatná hra. Protože není. Je to výborný zážitek, který opět všem doporučuji, jen očekávejte něco jiného, než co byl první díl.

PS: Katanka je tady až směšně OP. Což mi nevadí, protože ji miluju! :D
 
Lonely FireWolf

这一作比前作更耐玩很多，而且还增加技能以及buff元素。使得整个游戏还能玩上几个小时都还没玩完

Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2023
Отзывы все равно никто не читает напишу Фаршированные яйца с креветками🍤

Яйца отварите. Креветки очистите и обжарьте с чесноком и любимыми специями.
Готовые яйца разрежьте на половинки, выньте желток.
Для начинки смешайте желток, майонез, шрирачу, немного мелко нарезанных маринованных огурцов, горчицу и копченую паприку. Консистенция должна получится слегка густой.
Положите начинку в кондитерский мешок и выдавите на яйцо. Сверху выложите креветки, украсьте зеленью и паприкой.
 
Yan

Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2020
Не понравилось.

Не помню сколько было разных локаций в оригинальной SUPERHOT, но тут их от силы пять и их нужно проходить снова и снова. Оригинал прошел с удовольствием, тут совсем другие эмоции. В самом начале, минут через десять игры, показали титры. Сначала удивился, а потом стало ясно, что лучше бы игра на том месте и закончилось, ничего интересного дальше не будет. Думаю, разработчики понимали ситуацию и раздали игру бесплатно обладателям оригинала.

The coolest Zeke
459 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2023
The basic gameplay of SUPERHOT is there so obviously it's still fun.

I enjoyed the core/hacks and how they modified the gameplay loop, and the new enemy types. Really fun gameplay.

And Although I don't like rogue-lites, and I was gonna pass on this, it's easily the lightest of the bunch, as you only restart a node not the whole game similar to other rogue-lites and likes.



The game is TOO big though. It gets repetitive FAST.

The number of times you fight in the whole game does not correlate well with the number of abilities and maps.

There are almost 35ish nodes, each containing a somewhere between 4-30ish fights with 35 maps and 4 main cores with 21 hacks (abilities)...... YEEEAAAAH.

Keep in mind you unlock all those gradually (and in my opinion in a slow pace compared the the frequency of nodes and fights), AND it's random what you get so in my experience this resulted in me playing select maps and builds A LOT more than others.

This resulted in me getting sick of playing, and when I found out the final node takes about an hour and a half to finish (and when you die, you restart all of that) I just didn't bother as I have already been there and done that.



One thing I will mention that I wish was different is the way you get the cores/hacks (abilities).

Instead of picking only the core, then getting to select between 2 random hacks three times a node, between each hack there are 3 or 4 fights, maybe we could select the whole build before entering, or maybe at least select the possible hacks that will appear.

As currently I never felt as I had fully explored a certain build because either the node is short, the random abilities that appeared didn't really complement each other, or finally, I needed the health because I'm not about to restart 7 fights or a combination of all three.
 
aho_1029

不推荐
刚开始的rogue内容其实我还是很喜欢的，可玩性也不错。但是越玩下去就越会觉得怎么这游戏还没完。
剧情方面很差，完全比不上一代，而且高重复性的关卡真的很能消磨人的斗志
达到第二层一半我就已经没耐心玩下去了

22.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2020
Você gostou de SUPERHOT?
Mind CTRL DEL é simplesmente MAIS SUPER HOT.
Mais cenários; inimigos tem mais possibilidades de ação como desviar de disparos;
Mais variedade em inimigos incluindo alguns que funcionam como 'chefões' ou 'boss;
Mais possibilidades de combate como ricochetear balas;
Um sistema de progressão entre os cenários que promovem ainda mais rejogabilidade.

em resumo: MAIS SUPER HOT pra quem deseja MAIS do primeiro jogo...
ainda muito divertido, ainda muito interessante, ainda cheio de possibilidades para experimentação em uma premissa bastante simples: o tempo corre na medida em que você se move...
 
Samuel Galvão
