7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Got the game for free as owner of the original.

TLDR - good game with 2 hours of content padded out to ~6-8 hours

The original game introduced quite a unique game mechanic, but lacked in content. So I was very excited to see that sequel is in the works, as the only thing they needed to do is to add more levels and story. Easy....right?.....right guys?

W R O N G

Clearly what this game needed in the eyes of devs are same dozen of levels being repeated throughout whole game, with big punishments for death. Each batch of levels are represented as a "nod" and will contain 4-10 levels from the map pool, which again consists of dozen levels max. If you run out of lives (you would usually have 2-3 on hands). You are being sent to the start to do whole nod ALL OVER AGAIN. Died during last map of the nod? Too bad buddy, brace for 10-15 min resets. This becomes extremely frustrating closer to the end of the game (people who tried to do nodes 8A/B/C etc. will know), where you are sent on a literal gauntlet of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of maps with way more enemies you can handle at one time - just lazy game design.

Moment to moment gameplay is awesome! Pretty much a perfected formula from the first game with a couple of new additions thrown in. Only annoying thing is that your node "runs" are heavily RNG dependant, as you are getting random temporary upgrades throughout the "run" from the pool which keeps increasing throughout the game. In theory this should make you adapt your strategy on the fly, but in reality the upgrades are either top tier or complete BS, no middle ground whatsoever. And yes, you WILL have runs with only bad upgrade options - just deal with it.

Story is as pretentious as the last game, basically we still don't know anything, delivery is lazy at best. AND GET THIS - YOU HAVE TO LEAVE YOUR GAME OPEN FOR 8 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ HOURS (OR SPEEDHACK) IF YOU WANT TO GET ONE OF THE ACHIEVMENTS AND GO FOR NG+. YOU ARE NOT EVEN PLAYING DURING THAT TIME - JUST LITERALLY W A I T I N G

DEVS, GET YOUR ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ HEADS FROM YOUR BUTTS. IF YOU HAVE A COOL GAME CONCEPT IT DOESNT MEAN YOU CAN DO ♥♥♥♥ LIKE THAT, CMON - COMMON SENCE ?????
 
Fast And Furious -300
644 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
54.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2020
一通り全クリア。自分が動けば時間も動くスローでスピーディーなバレットタイムFPS、SUPERHOTの拡張版。基本ルールはそのままに、新たな敵や武器を加え、新たなゲームモードで遊べる。前作はストーリーモードのみで必ず同じマップを順にクリアするだけだったが、今回はランダムに選択されたマップで戦うことになる。クリア条件も、全滅ではなく、指定された人数の敵を倒す、となっている。

前作と大きく違うところは

・ マップが固定ではなくランダムで選択される
・ 複数の特殊能力があり、そのうち１つを選択する
・ マップをクリアしていくと新たな能力を得ることができる
・ ライフ制となり、一撃では死なない
・ 武器、敵の種類が増えている

前作ほどではないが、ストーリーらしきものもある。またおまけとして、100面クリアなどの地獄モードもある。

前作で「もう少しこうだったらいいのに」と思っていたところをカバーした良作。それほどテキストは多くないが、日本語も対応しているので安心。

★★★★★
 
Kusshie

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Из неё бы сделать ритм-игру! Ну или хотя-бы просто добавить музыку на задний план. А то ощущение будто вся игра в большой пещере проходит из-за гула.
Игра старается разнообразить концепцию замедления времени всякой фигнёй по типу: прокачка, выбор способностей.
Сюжетец понапрокачен всякими там тайнами и недлмолвками, и прочими вещями по которым ютуберы любят делать теории. Не всех зацепить.
Игра на данный момент развивается и нтересное времяпрепровождение гарантирует.

元祖SUPERHOTの爽快感を受け継ぎつつ、ゲームプレイ面でパッシブスキル(hack)をを取り入れたり、敵キャラのバリエーションが増えていたりと様々な要素を取り入れた続編。
正当進化であるものの、ステージがひたすら使い回されていたり、一度死んだらノードの一番最初からやり直しなど、ゲーム進行のテンポが全体的に悪い。やっていると30分くらいで眠くなってくる。
ステージの構造もSUPERHOTには欠かせない要素であるとおもっていたので、少々残念な出来。

Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2018
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

While not yet released, SUPERHOT; mind control delete already shows improvements over the original game in almost every way. The rouglite elements keep the game focused on being turn based instead of feeling like a puzzle, as does the induction of a health system. The environments are tighter in design, making them feel more intense. The mind system, along with the introduction of a new weapon, leathal throwables, enemy types, mushrooms and glitch barriers, keep the game varied, challenging, and bada$$.

One of us.
One of us.
 
9seed
328 produits enregistrés

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
17.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Underwhelming

I think they've delivered their message correctly, we shouldn't want more of SUPERHOT. The original game had simple mechanics, but every stage was a hand-crafted experience, making for a well-paced, balanced game. In this one, you repeat the same 17 or less maps in random order and with random spawns, it's underwhelming. At first, I liked the modifiers introduced, but since you get them randomly, you often can't build a fun synergy. The game gets stale fast. There are no challenge modes. Having to wait two hours and a half on a process bar for the ending is just the ultimate insult to injury.
 
Bunny
343 produits enregistrés
6
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2022
Alright. I got this game in 2021. It took me 38 non-consecutive hours to beat it (SPOILER not counting the recovery sequence ). This game is hard. So much harder than the original.

If you want to just hear my rating, it's 6/10 (Good)

if you want specifics, be warned, spoilers ahead.

WHAT I LIKED:
- The knife is so satisfying
- I love the art style
- The new throwables
- HACKing and the COREs
- The world map

WHAT I DISLIKED:
- The RNG
- How long the game is, and how most of it is retrying the same node that you can't pass over and over.
- Why does the katana only deflect bullets now? They missed an opportunity to make it more different from the rest of the melees.
- Why can the enemies use the knife melee but I can't?
- The invincible enemies. Oh my god, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ninja one.
- Sometimes the game just doesn't tell me when people are behind me.
- The game advertised as having MORE story. But it doesn't.
- beserk.hack + defall.hack + lightrflx.hack (+suppunch.hack)... it gives you the ability to make this combo almost every node and it wins every time.
- Overall game difficulty, it's harder than the original.
- The ending. Oh god the ending. First, it takes away your cores. Alright, makes sense, but then it takes away the hacks themselves. You're now basically just playing like SUPERHOT. Except, of course, they don't make you actually play like this, no, they make a sequence where it slowly takes away more and more of your core abilities, only to make the levels skippable, and then... the actual final sequence. This game gives you the illusion of multiple endings, and then forces you to sit through a TWO HOUR CREDITS SEQUENCE. The reward? The ability to play the game again.

GRAPHICS: 9/10 (INCREDIBLE)
Style is minimalist, but it's very pleasing and consistent within that limitation.
HOOK: 7/10 (VERY GOOD)
Sequels generally fail in hooks, but the original SUPERHOT hook is so good that it gets a 7 here.
GAME PLAY: 4/10 (LACKING)
It's fun, but so so so repetitive.
STORY: 3/10 (POOR)
It has no story, except tiny pieces of lore. By the end of the game, I wasn't even sure if the protagonist is the same person as from SUPERHOT.
CHARM: 6/10 (GOOD)
It's fun.

Overall: 6/10 (GOOD)
 
GiggyMantis
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

32.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2020
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

I have been a huge fan of SUPERHOT since the first game. I play the game to get away from well... other games. It might not make sense ( Neither does SUPERHOT XD ) but this game feels like it fulfils a desire no one knows they have. It has no storyline ( sort of ). Its enjoyment grows from your own search for something where there is none. You fight round after round after round after round, with no real explanation to why. It's murder in the most beautiful way possible. You go through the game dead confused, this path seems to lead you somewhere, but it feels like you've been here before... but it is so DAMN ADDICTING. I can't tell you why... even if you move on to other things, other games, in the back of your head you always long to kill that mindless body of red glass. You will always come back for more. It is not a matter of "will you?" it's a matter of "when will you?"

Pros

- SUPER fun (ironically)
- Controls are simple.
- You can leave the game for a month come back and still know "what" and "how to" do things.
- Makes you feel skilled AF for dodging, throwing, catching, shooting your way out of death.
- Good way to waste some free time.
- The game is unique, you won't find anything like it.

♥♥♥♥

- It can become a bit repetitive.
- There is no real reward system (Unless senseless murder is rewarding enough for you XD )
- The overall story is confusing (If there is one anyway)

I love this game for how weird and unique it is. The developers are awesome and you can see that they care about their game.

Everything i state above are my own experiences with the game. Therefore it is my OPINION, and should be seen as such. Hope you have a wonderful day.
 
Biowolf

Non recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2023
The original SUPERHOT was great, SUPERHOT VR was also great, but this sequel... is just awful, it's one of those unnecessary sequels to great titles that should not exist at the first place.

While keeping the core gameplay, MIND CONTROL DELETE introduces many new gameplay elements, such as health points, boss enemies, skill upgrades and abilities. Individually, all these new elements seem to make the original formula fresher and add more replayability. However in reality, the game ended up not being enjoyable; the game is long-winded, frustrating and boring. Instead of pre-designed scenarios, the game now offers only rogue-like randomized levels: this is one thing that does not work well with other parts of the game and hence ruins the whole experience. There is only a limited variety of environments, whereas enemy placement is randomized, which can often result in unreasonably difficult or unfair situations. To make things worse, often the player is required to beat multiple randomly generated levels in a row with a highly limited margin for error; this is not only extremely repetitive but also very frustrating and discouraging.

Surely the dev showed efforts to offer something different from the first game, but the so-called rogue-like elements alone ruined everything. While the dev added many new ideas, the lack of level design makes this game look like a lazy cash grab. Maybe they underestimated the importance of having hand-crafted stages, which are an integral part of what made the original game unique and outstanding.
 
AkizukiDenshi
188 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

买前作送的，所以还是给个推荐吧，如果你决定单独买此版本，那我还是不推荐买，虽然这个也叫SUPERHOT，但是本作一点也不HOT。

玩法还是前作的玩法，不过本作比前作多了一些新的武器敌人，也加入了技能，有些Rogue Like的意思，每一大关分好几个场景，然后开局选一个基本技能，每一大关根据场景数量还可以从技能池里额外获得2至4个技能，每次获得额外技能时都是二选一，技能随着进度解锁，乍一看还挺有意思，但实际就那么几个场景，最关键的是每个场景不需要消灭所有目标，消灭一定数量的目标后剩余目标就会跟着爆炸，一点也不尽兴。

另外我忘记前作回放是怎么回事了，但本作的回放可能是为了不让一些玩家看着头晕，结束后以正常速度播放回放时会删掉一些片段使整体画面没那么晃，这就导致了你欣赏自己的精彩击杀时会发现一些精彩镜头总是一闪而过，或者是以一种不可思议的角度开了一枪还击杀了目标，明明自己打的时候可是瞄的很准的啊，总之看起来就是很怪。

最后真想体验这个系列的，我还是推荐你买前作，最起码玩着很爽，本作玩起来就像你拉屎时拉到一半，然后把屎给夹断了，虽说这么形容很恶心，但感觉就是这个感觉。
 
CoolreX
1,154 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 septembre 2023
If you're looking at SH:MCD (MCD), you've probably played the original, and are looking for more of the same goodness. Well, I'm sad to say MCD doesn't live up to the original.

I liken SuperHot (SH) and SH:MCD to Quake and Quake Arena (QA). The original Quake had a story, a series of levels to traverse through, and a sense of progression. QA had you repeat the same maps over and over with a group of opponents with little in the way of any progression or story. Like QA, MCD relies on its predecessor's universe to play in, but it doesn't add anything substantial to the mix.

I enjoyed SH so much that I was thrilled to have more to play. After having a delicious main course with Super Hot, I expected a delicious, moist, double chocolate cake, but what I found was a store-brand, cardboard dry and unappetising dessert.

I could see MCD being a DLC for the main game, some roge-like progression, with randomised maps, start locations, and enemy weapons, a side dish, if you will. Playing in small doses is a great way to alleviate some stress, just popping on for a few minutes, having a few rounds of fun, and exiting out. This game overall, though, is nothing but these rounds over and over. It isn't a game to enjoy in one sitting, in fact, it gets boring relatively quick. There are 32 maps to play, but I felt like I was playing the same ones over and over again. It didn't feel fresh and different, it just felt like more of the same.

The game does have a 'map' for progression, but don't let it fool you, you'll still be reliving the same maps and enemies over and over again. Speaking of progression, just when I was getting bored with the whole monotony of MCD, I unlocked the disco map, and some pounding music kicked in. I thought to myself "Oh man, here we go, now its going to get good. They've been saving the sweet chocolate filling after a taste of dry cake, and I'm ready to be pleasantly surprised!" But, no. The music is related to the level itself, and serves no real purpose. There's no special unlock where things get wild, it is just a gimmick for that stage, and although damn impressive at first, I found it to be overall disappointing that there was no real purpose for it all. There was no buildup to anything, an opportunity wasted.

By the time I arrived at the 'end' of the game, I was relieved that I powered through the last 4 hours to come to some sort of conclusion. Maybe now I'd get some story. But, again, no. The 'ending' was as disappointing as the game itself.

This game is a time waster. It will waste your time. It knows it is wasting your time, and it enjoys wasting your time. In fact, when you are done with your time being wasted by the repetition of something that was once fun and unique, the end comes, and it wastes your time even more. In SH I found the ending to be, quite frankly, pretty ingenious, but I found myself in MCD pounding the action key over and over as fast as it would let me, just to get to where I wanted to be. Once there, the game has you wait another 2.5 hours of idling to see it to completion. And for what? Just so you can play the game again.

It isn't fun, it isn't exciting, it is no longer unique. This game outstayed its welcome well beyond what it should have. It almost as the team heard that the fans of SH wanted more, and decided to give us more, as painfully (slow/repetitive/long) as possible, without not adding much to the formula.

So, do I recommend this game? No, I don't. Not unless you have nothing better to do with your life and don't mind progressing through random maps for no real reward or reason. Do yourself a favour, go play Super Hot, if you haven't already. And, if you have, and you're considering more, just don't.
 
XaivierX
2,781 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

There's really no challenge in this. You just get thrown into random levels at random spawn points, defeat a certain amount of enemies for it to be over (then watch the remaining enemies randomly explode, disappointing) and get on with the next. The upgrades are okay, but they're not even that fun.

The sound design is lacking since the first game. That reverse shard-breaking sound effect when enemies spawn in is gone, as is the visual, and some of the new weapon sounds are lackluster.

"Red dudes" in this don't ever feel intimidating. They just feel like fodder. I see people saying that this game "makes you feel like a badass" but it's hard to feel that way if the guys don't even give you a run for your money in the first place.

I could forgive all that if it just wasn't SO easy. Even if you use the hacks that have less hearts, it's not really that much of a challenge. Enemies seem to have slower reaction times, less accuracy and sometimes I've seen shots just go straight through me when I know they should've hit. It's bizarre.

Lastly because of all this, replays in MCD also suffer. Seeing your footage be played back at a more full speed just looks jank. I guess it always has, but it just looks "off" in MCD. Everything just looks and feels floaty.

It just makes me want to play the original Superhot, to be honest.
 
Maddo

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

This is a tough one for me. I had a lot of fun with it for the first few hours: it's Superhot with a ton of new cool mechanics and powers! There are some great ones that really shake up the gameplay and keep things exciting.

However, as the timer kept ticking up, I eventually felt like I had seen everything the game really had to offer, but there was still a lot more to go. The excitement eventually became frustration as I kept going through repetitive mission clusters on the same few randomized maps. The roguelike structure would often mean having to do 10 maps in a row without running out of hearts (2 being the max for most classes, the only way to heal being to get lucky with random powers), and there are some ridiculous enemy types that come up later in the game that make it really aggravating to get further in a long set. It's tough, but not in the same way the other two Superhot games are. Those are about being patient, learning level patterns, and mastering each puzzle the game presents the player with. This one is just about working with whatever the game randomly gives you and hoping that you get lucky in some cases. The thrill wears off after a few hours.

Much like past entries, this one is going for a meta story, but it kind of comes off as pretty pretentious, especially as the game goes on. I will say that the sound design is fantastic, and I do like a lot of the combat changes, but the randomized nature of each level eventually makes it a slog. I didn't finish the story, but I can tell that I came pretty close. I was just tired of having to go through 10-level missions and having to hope I'd get lucky enough to either not get surprised by an enemy that spawned in a place where I couldn't see it or that I'd get the option to heal instead of taking a new power-up. It's hard to review because I genuinely think that the first few hours are a fantastic experience and that they were worth the price, but everything that came after just frustrated me in the end. If Steam had a mixed option, I'd absolutely give this one, but for now, the later game experience has me leaning towards not being very happy with the game. It's worth a try for fans if they can get it cheap, but for newcomers, I'd just say to get Superhot or Superhot VR personally.
 
Monado158

Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Let me start off by saying i got this game for free for purchasing SUPERHOT. And while i love that game this game in comparison just seems stale and boring. the gameplay and mechanics havent changed much but that isn't the issue the issue is that in the first SUPERHOT game all the levels felt special and handcrafted, and if you died you restarted that single level. In this game you get mini sections all consisting of 8 levels you have 3 hearts to complete these 8 levels. i don't like this concept but that is not the major flaw here. The major flaw is that in all these sections the 8 levels are the exact same. Which makes the game incredibly repetitive and boring.

Recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

这作继承了superhot大部分玩法，并加入了一些技能，随着玩家的深入还会加入更强大的敌人和陷阱，相比前作确实提高了不少游戏性，有点半roguelike的感觉。
但是可能正是为了提高游戏性和随机性，每一关都是由不同的地图随机组合而成，不像前作那样精心安排，而是像无尽模式一样从刷怪点里出来敌人，玩多了就会感觉重复，而且剧情部分也削弱了不少，不想前作那样让人一直想玩下去。
总而言之，个人认为这代并没有达到前作的高度，但是仍然不失为佳作。

SUPERHOT is an awesome game.

BUT.
SUPERHOT VR is MORE awesome.

So in summary if you want the full experience just purchase a computer worth approximately ~$1,100 and then also purchase a VR headset for about ~$400 and then you will get the full experience.

+$25 for the game sorry about that.
 
Jwog
117 produits enregistrés

0
Recommandé
22.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2020
Более отполированная, и более длинная версия игры Superhot, но с элементами прокачки в рамках узлов, с элементами рандома в плане последовательности карт, с элементами достойных игровых механик, и с чутка большим числом сюжета. Видно, что разработчики хотели сделать игру с куда большей реиграбельностью, чем оригинальная игра, которая проходилась в среднем за пару часиков. Хотя, как я считаю, в данной версии игры присутствует некоторый перебор с уровнями, и очень странные решения.

Говоря о переборе с уровнями, всего в игре 32 карты, которые на протяжении всей игры будут раз за разом повторяться. Мне кажется, что было бы куда круче сделать рандомную генерацию карт для ещё большей реиграбельности, плюс разбавить монотонную перестрелку каким-нибудь паркуром, вертикальным геймплеем, да и просто сместить акцент истории с банальных узлов, обладающих несколькими словами и фразами, на динамичные катсцены и видеовставки, для наиболее понятного и захватывающего сюжета. Да, игра и без этого вполне неплоха, но а так она больше получается на исключительного любителя, ибо немногие игроки смогли в принципе пройти игру до самого конца (около 4% с чем-то, судя по последней ачивке). Поэтому отношусь с пониманием к тем, кто не осилил полное прохождение, так как начиная с середины игры она начинает банально приедаться.

Что касается странных решений, то я без понятия, зачем в самой концовке игры делать 2 часа и 30 минут топорного ожидания восстановления данных. Я бы сократил это время как максимум до часа, и дал бы возможность путешествовать по финальной карте и играть во все мини-игры, которые там есть. По-моему это реально лучше и интересней было бы, чем просто оставлять игру свёрнутой, и заниматься своими делами по типу сёрфинга в инете, просмотра фильмов, видосов и прочего. Ну а так концовка у меня всё же вызвала больше положительных впечатлений, чем отрицательных. И кстати звуковое сопровождение и саундтреки очень хорошие, мне понравилось.)

Заключение
В целом говоря, для уровня инди-студии это вполне себе достойная игра. Да, она достаточно монотонна, присутствуют сомнительные моменты, да и вообще можно было бы неплохо её разнообразить и добавить больше всего, однако не стоит забывать, что данный шутан - инновационный! И геймплей у него с учётом всех нововведений от Mind Control Delete - обалденный, и этого у Superhot не отнять. Поэтому если вы любите шутеры, но совершенно не знакомы с данной серией игр, то советую приобрести эту версию игры, особенно если будет продаваться по скидке.

Оценка
81/100
 
NoloG $DoHoDoV

Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Jeżeli ktoś z was nie grał dotychczas w SuerHot, to pewnie nie zrozumie, gdy napiszę, że Mind Control Delete to po prostu „więcej, więcej, WIĘCEJ”? Właśnie taka opinia byłaby w przypadku wspomnianej produkcji nie tylko najkrótsza, ale jednocześnie najbardziej rzeczowa… 😊

Warto może jednak dodać, że schemat rozgrywki nieco się w stosunku do pierwowzoru zmienił. Tym razem przechodzimy poziomy pogrupowane w zestawy po kilka-kilkanaście sztuk, rozmieszczone na prostej mapce-labiryncie. Żeby zaliczyć każdy z takich zestawów, w trakcie jego pokonywania nie wolno nam zginąć… No, nie do końca, bo na starcie dysponujemy teraz kilkoma życiami, możemy też zawsze skorzystać z jednego z perków-rdzeni (takich jak dodatkowe życie czy przeskakiwanie do ciał wrogów) wybieranego na początku rozgrywki, a dodatkowo, co kilka kolejnych plansz wspomóc się możemy losowo przydzielanymi hackami (m.in. leczeniem, dodatkowym życiem, otrzymaniem na starcie katany czy losowej broni palnej, szybkostrzelnością itp). Zarówno rdzenie jak i hacki odblokowujemy najpierw podczas rozgrywki.

Ta jest powtarzalna i oparta na podobnych jak w oryginale założeniach – pojawiają się jednak nowi przeciwnicy, np. eksplodujący albo właściwie nieśmiertelni…. Powtarzalność w wielu opiniach uznawana jest za wadę, ale osobiście nie postrzegam jej w ten sposób. Gameplay i tak został w MCD urozmaicony, a jego siłę stanowi przecież od początku wspomniana prostota oraz fakt, że w jakiś magiczny, hipnotyzujący sposób przyciąga gracza, a ten chce… WIĘCEJ. 😊 Nie jest to jednak i nigdy chyba nie była produkcja przeznaczona na naprawdę długie posiedzenia. W przypadku długiej rozgrywki naturalnie zaczynamy odczuwać znużenie, ale nie jest to moim zdaniem wina gry samej w sobie.

Wiele osób narzeka też na poziom trudności. Cóż, nie dotarłem jeszcze do tych najtrudniejszych przeciwników i naprawdę długich zestawów etapów (pisząc te słowa jestem na czwartym poziomie mapy), ale ze słów innych wnioskuję, że mogą mieć rację. W końcu nawet początkowe zestawy musiałem powtarzać wiele razy. Nie były jednak na tyle długie, bym poczuł frustrację. Jeżeli jednak im dalej, tym gorzej, to czy powinno to zaważyć na ocenie gry? Trudne pytanie. W teorii tak i warto meić to na uwadze, ale IMHO nie warto się tego bać. W ostateczności nie ma obowiązku przechodzić MCD do końca, a pominąc je, jeśli jesteście fanami oryginału, byłoby jednak sporą stratą.

Co sam mogę zarzucić grze? Chyba tylko jedno. Nie dość, że poziomy na których toczymy walki się powtarzają, to są w większości mało przejrzyste i czasem słabo zaprojektowane. Te w oryginale były chyba prostsze, bardziej minimalistyczne, posiadały mniej elementów otoczenia, ale jednocześnie wyglądały lepiej, były też chyba lepiej cieniowane. Tutaj często wszystko zlewa się w jedną całość, a poza tym takie np. kanały czy metro nie robią specjalnego wrażenia. Ciekawa jest kuchnia albo dyskoteka, ale mam wrażenie, że słabsze projekty przeważają. W tego typu grze, o takiej strukturze, to jednak wada.

Czy warto jednak zagrać w MCD? Jeśli podobał wam się oryyinał zdecydowanie tak, niezależnie od tego, gdzie utkniecie.
Poza tym – tak produkcja gratis? Wielki szacunek dla autora, mimo ewentualnych niedociągnięć.
 
Herr Pietrus

0

Moxxi
708 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2020
SUPERHOT의 DLC겸 스핀오프, 게임 클리어 하고나서 리뷰 다시적음.

게임은 재미있다. 근데 재밌는 이유가 그냥 원작이 정말 잘 만들어져서 그런거지, 이 작품이 전작에 비해 개선되어서라고 생각은 안듬.

일단 게임 장르가 로그라이크로 바뀌었다. 원작에는 게속 죽어가면서 클리어 방법을 생각해보는 퍼즐 경향이 강했지만, 이 작품은 죽지않고, 랜덤으로 나오는 여러 스테이지를 클리어하는 방식으로 바뀌었다.

이 점은 몇몇 원작팬들에게는 혹평을 받는데, 원작의 퍼즐 형식을 줄여버리고, 그냥 높은 난이도에서 빨간 적들을 게속 죽이는 "반복적"인 게임이 되어버려서 이질적인 느낌이거나, 반복플레이에 지루함을 느껴서 싫어하는 사람도 좀 있다.

원작과 다른점을 주기위해 게임에 플레이어한테 특수능력을 주는 코어와 업그레이드 역할을 하는 핵이 추가되었지만, 그래도 게임의 반복성을 보완해주지 않는다. 코어의 개성을 굳이 고르자면 코어에 따른 핵 메타 정도? 근데 그 조차 핵의 선택지가 적어서 원하는대로 맞추기는 힘듬.

사실 혹평의 큰 이유는 스토리와 엔딩의 영향이 큰데, (스포긴 한데, 짜피 이겜은 스토리의 비중이 너무 적음) 이겜의 스토리는 빨간 메세지가 게임을 그만 하라고 하지만, 플레이어는 게임을 게속 원하는 마음에 무슨일이 생겨도 게임을 반복적으로 하는 식으로 전개된다. 스토리 중간에 나오는 연출은 좋지만 왜 이런 연출이 나오는지 설명이 적어 스토리 적으로 부실함이 느껴진다.

개인적으로 스토리의 가장 큰 불만점은 빨간 메세지가 게임을 그만 하라고 게속 말하는 점인데 원작 스토리에서는 이 빨간 메세지는 주인공이 더 게임을 하도록 유도했고, 이것이 빨간 메세지의 목적과 연결 되있고, 엔딩 후에도 추가요소를 클리어하면 오히려 이 빨간 메세지가 좋아했다. 근데 갑자기 후속작에서 겜하지 말라고 했다? 그럼 중간에 하지말라고 말하는 이유라도 있어야 하는데 그것도 없다. 전작 스토리와의 연결성이 부실하다. 아님 스토리가 원작의 평행세계일수도 있고.

혹평의 제일 큰 이유는 엔딩의 영향이 큰데, 엔딩이 더이상 게임을 못하게 하도록 프로그램을 삭제해버리는 식으로 끝나고, 주인공은 이 삭제된 프로그램을 복구 하기로 한다. 근데 복구가 리얼타임으로 2시간 30분 (패치 전에는 8시간) 걸린다. 그리고 이거, 치트엔진을 쓰는거 아닌이상 스킵 못한다. 게임 엔딩이 그냥 지루한 8시간 기달리기인데, 누가 좋아할까? 원작의 엔딩이 강렬했던거 생각하면 실망이 클수밖에 없다.

말은 이렇게 했지만, 먼저 말했듯이 게임은 재미있다. 원작의 게임플레이를 큰 변화없이 계승했지만, 그 원작의 게임플레이가 워낙 좋아서 말이지. 변화는 크게 부각되지는 않지만 그래도 하나하나 따져보면, 플레이에 더 큰 재미를 주었던건 사실이다.

원작의 스토리모드를 기대했었다면 이 게임에 실망을 할것이고, 원작의 챌린지모드와 무한모드 같은 추가요소를 기대했었다면 매우 재미있게 플레이 할것이다.
 
retborgor
1
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2021
Even though there are no point systems, SUPERHOT is a very arcade-y game at heart. Bad guys show up, you kill them, you win. The gimmick of this game is that time only moves when you do, (theoretically) giving you as much time as you need to think about your next move. It's an extremely original concept, and the fact that they were able to make a full game out of just this one idea proves it. For the most part it works fine- you get to feel like an awesome ninja (the streamer) without the need for the twitch reflexes. Also needless to say, the visuals are to die for. If the trailer entices you, I would get it. However it does experience some hiccups in places and that's what I'd like to talk about.

My main issue comes with how the main story mode is handled. In MIND CONTROL DELETE, the stages act as pseudo-roguelikes, giving you a certain amount of stages to clear each time in a row without dying. You're given some hit points as well so that you aren't just dead in one hit. And by "some" I mean 2 (unless you choose the extra HP option). This is where my first issue with the story missions come in- there are too many random elements for you to perform consistently. Enemy locations are random, the weapons they have are random, and in the later stages a lot of the hazards are random too. All of this equals a lot of unfair deaths. I've had more than my fair share of deaths because I was hanging around too closely to a doorway and had an enemy spawn behind me.

This is where I'll go on a small tangent to talk about The Dog. The Dog is an enemy type that shows up in lategame levels, and is the epitome of this issue of randomness. Only one spawns and whether it ever even appears is entirely random. However, once it's spawned, you are in immediate danger. It can move faster than all the other unit types and has a lunge that is essentially in real time as it's extremely fast. The issue I have with it is so many elements to it are random- where it spawns is random, IF it spawns is random, and depending on the spawn rates of enemies and where you are at the time, you could just be trapped with no way to clear the stage before it rips you into mincemeat. It's a neat concept executed poorly. If it spawned as a result of you taking too long in paused time that would be cool- a kind of Spelunky ghost type situation. But at the moment it just kind of shows up whenever it wants to ruin your day.

Next is my second issue, which is that enemies are too silent. You know how in Minecraft, creepers intentionally don't have any footstep sounds so they can more easily catch you by surprise? Well SUPERHOT has that too, except I don't think it was intentional. As mentioned before, a lot of my deaths came from having an enemy spawn behind me right in my blind spot. There *is* technically warning, as a red light will emanate from the doorway a few seconds before they spawn in, but this light is faint, easy to miss, and the doorways are oftentimes not in places you can see.

You might say "look around!" but that leads into my third issue: everything takes time. In SUPERHOT, nothing is ever truly at a standstill. Even when you're doing absolutely nothing, things ARE moving, just very slowly. This is exacerbated whenever you do something, even if it's extremely minor. This is fine for certain things (I think picking up a weapon, for example, should take time), but for others it's detrimental to the game experience. My biggest gripe is looking around. In a game where you need to have a complete grasp of the environment at all times, it actively punishes you for looking around by speeding time up. The real salt in the wound is that left clicking will advance time regardless of if it does anything. I assume this was put in so that you could advance time at a standstill if you needed, but it's resulted in me trying and failing to grab an item because it was out of reach and getting punished for it quite a few times.

My final issue is the requirements needed to pass. It's not good enough if you complete 6 of the 7 stages perfectly, if you die on the 7th one, you're sent aaaaallll the way to the beginning. It can wipe out several tens of minutes of progress at a time and is honestly very disheartening, especially on longer stages. I also think there's a severe lack of variety. Tucked away somewhere in the midgame, there is an endless mode where enemies infinitely spawn and you have to stay alive for as long as possible. I personally think this was underutilized, and a form of it could have made for interesting story missions (aka stay alive X amount of waves type missions). It would break up the monotony of the marathon trials that make up the rest of the game in my opinion.

Don't get me wrong! The core gameplay loop of SUPERHOT is extremely fun and MIND CONTROL DELETE expands on it in interesting ways with various abilities and powerups you can get. However, MIND CONTROL DELETE also introduces various extraneous elements that can make this loop feel very unfun and frustrating at times. I enjoy the story, but I don't know if it will be enough to entice me to push though and finish the game. I'd tentatively recommend MIND CONTROL DELETE. However if the idea of a larger story doesn't entice you, just get the base version of SUPERHOT instead.
 
Ozzi
365 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2022
PRZEPIS NA LECZO
Cebulę kroimy w kostkę i podsmażamy na oliwie, aż się zrumieni.
Następnie dodajemy czosnek, kiełbasę. Podsmażmy jeszcze przez kilka minut. Dodajemy oczyszczoną i pokrojoną w kostkę paprykę. Dolewamy wodę wraz z rozpuszczoną kostką rosołową. Chwile dusimy.
Następnie dodajemy, sparzone, obrane ze skórki i pokrojone w kostkę pomidory oraz również pokrojoną w kostkę, cukinię (młodej cukinii nie trzeba obierać). Doprawiamy papryczką chilii i przecierem pomidorowym.
Dusimy do momentu aż cukinia będzie miękka ale nie rozgotowana (czyli około 15-20 minut).
Przyprawiamy do smaku.
 
franq
37 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2022
感觉不如一代，二代虽然加了些东西，但是游戏的本质和前作一样，只不过改成了一个类似rougue like形式。一代是关卡式，虽然敌人和玩家都是受到一次伤害就死亡，但是玩家死亡后可以重开背板。到了二代分成了单个大关内需要连续通过数关，哪怕打到最后一关，只要一死就得重新再来，而关卡的地图池重复性太高，翻来覆去就那么些图，新鲜感很快就过去。

另外一代的剧情也比二代好，一代完全实现了一个meta game。至于本作，除了不停的rougue like和“更多、更多、更多”就没什么故事性与设计性。如果要玩，建议只玩一代。
 
Ray Chiang
1,951 produits enregistrés

0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Disclosure: Got a free key due to being a early backer for the original SUPERHOT.

I loved the orignal one and this expension (I believe free on release for prior owners, check storepage to be sure) doesn't seem to differ much from that.

What used to be mods (different modifications you could use while playing) are now implemented into the "minds". You now play a mind which has certain mods to keeps the gameplay fresh. Also the minds arent a bunch of lose levels but are a mission you begin at 0% and try to get a 100% without dying, you die you start at 0%.

Big difference from the first SUPERHOT is that you now have "lives" of which you start of with 2 and can get through progressing the mission up to 4 of (as of this moment, it's early access so this still can change). The lives basically lets you get hit without instant death. Does this make it easier? Yes for a single level, but your lives count like classic platformers over the entire mission. So you still need to watch out for those bullets.

My early verdict is, much of the same goodness I loved in SUPERHOT. So a thumbs up from me.

As of the moment of this review this is still an early access product, please bare this in mind.
 
TheDude1972
2
16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

✔️ EZ Game

Still the same simply amusing game that makes you feel like kewl dood, ka-chow.

Now feels more enjoyable than the base game with the different perks and playstyle options.

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

! gameplay spoilers !

The game brings in some new weapons, moves, and objects, but is all barricaded behind the insanely repetitive "campaign" that keeps cycling between 32 levels, which is not a lot considering you are forced to play each about 10 times or more.

Initial game focused on level design and each level was interesting in its own way. You only got one life and there was no need for more. And after completing the game you could play with various modes and endless runs.

This game made each level work as endless run, requiring you to kill X dudes to complete it. Each level can start in few different ways, but after killing those 2-3 dudes, the rest is pretty much the same. The concept of lives made the game more arcadey which supports the nature of its repetitiveness. All the hacks, modes, or enemy variations you unlock throughout the game are fun but don't give any better value to overall gameplay and pretty soon become repetitive.

Overall, the game has its cool moments (throwing a credit card into dude's skull; boomerang shurikens, disco room), but the moment is gone as soon as you start hitting the same level 5 or more times.
 
Winged

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE to najprościej ujmując połączenie SUPERHOT-a z mechaniką rguelike. Gra ma konstrukcję piramidy, w ramach której przemierzamy kolejne "pokoje" tutaj nazwane klastrami.
Każdy pokój to seria plansz rozgrywanych w stylu SUPERHOT-a, jednak w tym miejscu pojawia się wspomniana mechanika roguelike. W obrębie każdego pokoju poza potyczkami natrafiamy również na fragmenty kodu umożliwiające wprowadzenie do rozgrywki przeróżnych modyfikatorów. Od większej ilości żyć (w przeciwieństwie do pierwowzoru tutaj startujemy z 3 serduszkami symbolizującymi życia. Każde z nich tracimy w przypadku otrzymania obrażeń, ale nie przerywa to rozgrywki), odnowienia wszystkich żyć, możliwości rozpoczęcia poziomu z kataną, zwiększenia szybkostrzelności broni palnej, po tak egzotyczne jak wystrzelenie chmary shuriken-ów po utracie życia. Dostępne ulepszenia są losowane z puli tych, które już udało nam się odblokować. Modyfikatory oraz życia są przyznawane na konkretny pokój i po jego ukończeniu zostają nam odebrane, a ilość serduszek powraca do bazowych trzech. Niektóre pokoje zamiast serii zmagań mogą zawierać wstawki fabularne, przejścia na kolejne poziomy "piramidy" lub nowe modyfikatory, które możemy dodać do naszej puli. Plansze, na których przyjdzie nam się zmierzyć z przeciwnikami są dobierane losowo z przygotowanych przez twórców aren. Dodatkowo miejsce, w którym zaczynamy rozgrywkę, typy wrogów, ich uzbrojenie oraz rozmieszczenie i rodzaj przedmiotów dostępnych na planszy są dobierane losowo.
Wspomnieć też należy o świetlnej postawie developerów, którzy postanowili rozdać grę bezpłatnie każdemu, kto zakupił przed jej premierą oryginalnego SUPERHOT-a lub jego wersję VR.

Reasumując: Połączenie SUPERHOT-a z mechanikami roguelike to strzał w dziesiątkę! Jeśli chociażby intryguje Cię pomysł gry, w której czas płynie tylko, gdy Ty się poruszasz drogi czytelniku, to możesz kupować MIND CONTROL DELETE w ciemno.

Chciałbym również przy okazji tej recenzji podziękować SUPERHOT Team za udostępnienie bezpłatnie tak świetnej produkcji. :)
 
Dinool
603 produits enregistrés
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

The thing you need to understand about this game, is that it's not SUPERHOT+. It's not SUPERHOT, but more. Not SUPERHOT, but refined. Not SUPERHOT, but with upgrades.

This game is more on the lines of SUPERHOT, but Roguelike.

And many people will instantly be intrigued. "How will this change the game?" They may ask. "What new enemies exist? How does it compare to the previous one?" Unfortunately, the answers to these will dampen their moods.

Here's how the game works.

There's a pool of about 10-15 arenas, and the game loop is "Fight in an arena with randomly equipped Red Guys spawning, win, spawn in a new arena, repeat." The difficulty rises by increasing the number of enemies with guns that spawn and slowly restricting you on if enemies can actually drop their weapons or not. Every 1-3 arenas, you get to choose between 2 random upgrades, and once you complete 6-8 arenas you win the level and can go onto the next one where the overall difficulty increases. You're also given 2 Health Points to start off with, with the opportunity to gain more as you play through the arenas. If at any point you lose all your hearts, you are forced to do another 6-8 arenas with all of your upgrades lost. Each arena is chosen randomly, and if you die then the new set of arenas is also chosen randomly, meaning that you can't use a different strategy in the room you just died in, or do better in rooms you lost health in, since everything is always new.

Unlike the previous game, the levels are not crafted specifically to put the player in new situations and forcing them to solve the various puzzles that these situations create. No, instead the player is told to kill everything, with no nuance or strategy other than 'step to the side before you kill the next guy'.

The previous game used the Slow-Motion as a core gameplay mechanic, and a way to give you time to think through the situations and acting on your plans. This game uses it as a way to pick up guns and dodge bullets better.

The previous game used death as a way to force you to learn from your mistakes, and give you the opportunity to solve the puzzle once more. This game uses it as a method of punishment, forcing you to play more of the game but in different situations from the one that killed you so you never actually get the chance to understand what you did wrong.

The previous game gave you a sense of progression and discovery as you played through the story. This game works on a grid system so you can get upgrades and kill things better.

But you know what really annoys me over everything else?

The previous game gave you the chance to see how you played in real time.

This game moves between arenas so quickly that you're never given the chance.

The actions you just took will be forgotten forever, and it feels like this was done because the developers understood that if they kept it in, the players would realize that every single level is exactly the same. That, just like the game tells you, nothing you're doing matters. You're doing the mindless violence that it berates you for.

But, unlike what your character in-game seems to think, you won't actually be having any fun with it, let alone being obsessed.

I got this game for free. If you think that's a point against my review, then fine. But I will say this. If I DIDN'T get this game for free, if I bought it with my own money rather than getting it since I already owned SUPERHOT, then I'd have returned it by now.
 
Scranity
816 produits enregistrés
4
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1

遊戲玩法是蠻有趣的，在開始時有很大的新鮮感、爽快感，

而越玩越後面功能開始增加，角色會開始變強了，但難度也開始增加，

原本的爽快感開始消失，從有樂趣變成沉悶感，

整體來說我覺得這款是適合專門玩動作類的玩家，

如果不是只是抱持著有興趣，我個人是不大推。

В этой игре вы проведете несколько часов, и за это время наверняка обратите внимание на повторяемость карт. Впрочем, это – единственная претензия к детищу SUPERHOT Team, и если вам понравилась оригинальная игра, то дополнение обязательно придется по душе.

saaya

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I love Super Hot, Super Hot VR, and this game is honestly ok too. It doesn't improve too much on the old super hot but what it does do is add abilities and a rogue like element to the game which is fine.

What I've started realizing I dislike about the game is that every level seems to be randomized entirely. In fact, every single level in this game aside from the tutorial levels is identical in gameplay. You spawn into an arena that has a few doors for the enemies to spawn from all around you, kill 5 or so guys, and then you teleport to another arena. This process is repeated for the ENTIRE game with the same dozen or two rooms, and I honestly get no real sense of progression and accomplishment by completing a level.

The perks you get, like 2 or 3 each level as you progress through arenas, don't really matter. By the time you get a cool build, you have already won and have to start the next level with no perks.

In short, this game is incredibly monotone. Maybe I didn't play enough but I did get to a point where the individual enemies got harder, in that they had armored body parts and wouldn't drop their guns for you to take. The perks don't usually make the game that much easier or funner. What made Superhot fun to me was being put in an interesting environment, facing an interesting challenge and completing it and it's entirely missing from this game.

I recommend starting with Super Hot or Super Hot VR first. If you still want more, try this one.
 
Sushin

Non recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
Superhot was all about millisecond decisions, slowed down enough for you to actually pull them off so you could feel like an action movie badass. Mind Control Delete demonstrates how, in the original game, this was completely down to the very tight scripting of the individual levels.

The random enemy placement/semi-procgen nature of MCD means that the original's tense, exciting moments just don't happen - you will sometimes put some thought into how to handle a situation that crops up, but it's straight forwards and lacks the fine line between success and failure that characterised original Superhot. For the most part, an enemy appears and you kill it. Occasionally one appears behind you which you don't notice it and it kills you. Functionally it's just a very, very, boring first person shooter.

My 18 hours in it are wholly down to COVID lockdown boredom. It was a chore.
 
Capt. Eduardo del Mango

Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2021
Прошлая часть была все же через чур короткой, эту сделали подлиннее (я бы даже сказал, что слишком), добавили новые стволы и прокачку. Увернуться от этих уе*ков можно только случайно, тот кто придумал этих врагов просто конченый е*анат.
Пройдено
Оценка 5/10

Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2022

18.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2021
Points positifs (+) :
✅ Histoire : Comme pour SUPERHOT, il n'y a pas d'histoire à proprement parlé. C'est une succession de niveaux !
✅ Immersion/gameplay/réalisme : Comparé au premier opus, nous avons un système de capacités actives et passives, deux nouvelles armes ça fonctionne plutôt bien.
✅ Graphismes : Sympa, on a le droit à un léger lifting comparé au premier épisode, c'est appréciable !
✅ Level design : Pas de gros changement par rapport au jeu de base !
✅ Optimisation : Parfaitement fluide, ras !

Points négatifs (-) :
⛔ Gameplay : Difficulté très mal gérée. Surtout pour le dernier chapitre.
⛔ Niveaux : Recommencer l'intégralité de tous les niveaux du hack que nous faisons est clairement énervant
⛔ Contenu : Nous avons droit aux mêmes niveaux constamment réutilisés dont certain du premier volet...
 
SaiyajinK
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2022
Just by far a worse experience.

What I loved about SuperHot 1 were the individual levels and the aspect of problem-solving. It was really intriguing to play these levels as some sort of puzzle, but this game? It doesn't even have an ounce of that.

There are a few selected bigger maps on which you will spend your 6-9 hours on, these levels started boring me within the first 50 minutes of the game, since they sometimes felt like variations of already existing SuperHot levels.
The game also added lives and you have to use these lives to finish a string of levels. This is unenjoyable. SuperHot made each try so much more worth when it comes to learning these levels, but now you can be hit and be like "whatever". It feels more like you're fighting mindless waves of enemies in a room. The hacks were a fun and good addition, but why not just add these hacks and you lose them when you retry the level? That would make way more sense instead of taking a bullet, because the game allows you to do so.
For me this isn't SuperHot 2 or an extension. It's a boring shooter with waves, and only the graphics and time mechanic are reminiscent of SuperHot. Weapons and new enemies are fine, but they broke the gameplay loop and made it feel like a tiring experience.

I sincerely hope that if there's a SuperHot VR sequel in production it won't be made like this.
 
Na0ki
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

crossfire45
56 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2023
J'ai acheté "SUPERHOT", "SUPERHOT VR" et "SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE" en même temps lors d'une promotion en un seul pack pour moins cher que le prix d'un seul jeu, et je les évaluerai ici tous les trois ensemble pour une raison simple: c'est en gros le même jeu.

Le concept de "SUPERHOT" provient du fameux "bullet time", l'effet de ralenti que "Matrix" a popularisé mais qui était déjà présent bien avant dans les films d'action de John Woo, et qui a déjà été exploité dans un jeu vidéo avec "Max Payne": ici, l'originalité est que LE JEU ENTIER est en "bullet time", le temps s'y écoule très lentement lorsqu'on ne bouge pas et n'accélère que lorsqu'on bouge, avec des balles ennemies semblant suspendues dans les airs pour nous laisser le temps de réagir face à des hordes de tueurs déterminés.

Il en résulte un gameplay surprenant où l'on a presque les sensations d'un jeu de stratégie au tour par tour, avec beaucoup de planification requise. Sur le plan immersif, le jeu fait référence au concept de Réalité Virtuelle dès le début, avec des clins d'œil appuyés à "Matrix" et une esthétique "low poly" très propre et réussie.

Le souci du premier jeu, "SUPERHOT", est qu'il ne va pas beaucoup plus loin que son concept général: on doit survivre à 25 arènes prédéfinies avec toujours les mêmes "types rouges" qui apparaissent à chaque essai aux mêmes endroits, c'est donc du "die and retry" assez répétitif puisque le jeu offre très peu d'éléments différents (armes, types ennemis). Régulièrement, le jeu s'interrompt pour des séquences de narration abstraites assez agaçantes, qui jouent avec l'idée d'embrigadement, de perte de contrôle, d'autodestruction, etc. mais ça ne dépasse pas les clichés habituels. Le jeu est court et essaie de justifier son prix initialement exorbitant avec des modes alternatifs qui ne sont que des variantes peu convaincantes du mode principal. Ça reste amusant grâce à la solidité du concept fondateur, mais c'est léger.

"SUPERHOT VR" est bien meilleur sans être vraiment plus riche ou plus long, tout simplement parce que son concept se prête parfaitement à la Réalité Virtuelle: on ne peut plus se déplacer autrement qu'en bougeant soi-même, on est donc restreint à un périmètre limité (je dirais que le jeu demande de pouvoir se déplacer sur une aire carrée de deux mètres de côté), mais il est beaucoup plus amusant - on peut contrôler l'écoulement du temps plus finement en bougeant plus ou moins vite, viser devient très important (on doit fermer un œil pour aligner les viseurs des armes), l'immersion est très impressionnante, et le jeu gagne énormément en rejouabilité tellement son mode infini est plaisant (seul bémol, le lancer d'objet est peu intuitif).

Avec ces qualités, vous pouvez vous demander pourquoi "SUPERHOT VR" est moins bien noté sur Steam que le jeu original: initialement, le jeu comportait les mêmes thèmes narratifs, avec notamment des séquences où l'on nous obligeait à sauter dans le vide ou à se tirer une balle dans la tête. En Réalité Virtuelle, ce type de séquence a bien plus d'impact, et cela a fini par mettre les auteurs du jeu mal à l'aise, ils ont donc décidé de les retirer par le biais d'un patch obligatoire en 2021 - cela a déplu à certains joueurs, qui ont sous-noté le jeu en représailles. Pour ma part, je trouve le jeu plus agréable à jouer sans tout ce "gras" narratif, et j'approuve la décision des développeurs.

Enfin, "SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE" (sans Réalité Virtuelle) est de nouveau la même chose, mais enrichie et affinée et intégrée dans le schéma du Rogue-lite, avec des arènes et vagues ennemies tirées aléatoirement et des améliorations qui se débloquent progressivement (par exemple, recharger plus vite ou disposer d'un tir supplémentaire pour chaque arme) et entre lesquelles il faudra choisir, plus d'arènes et d'armes, de meilleurs graphismes, et surtout différents types ennemis: certains explosent en projetant des balles lorsqu'on les tue, d'autres bénéficient d'une armure sur l'essentiel du corps, d'autres encore sont fusionnés à leur arme, etc. Tout cela rend le jeu beaucoup plus intéressant et rejouable, mais une nouvelle fois le jeu est malgré tout moins bien noté que l'original: c'est tout simplement parce que ça reste assez répétitif et parce que quatre ans plus tard, l'effet de surprise "SUPERHOT" était passé, mais il s'agit ici de la meilleure version du jeu si vous ne disposez pas d'un casque de Réalité Virtuelle. La narration est aussi moins intrusive et agaçante, malgré un final stupide qui exige de laisser tourner son PC pour rien pendant 2h30 (la progression est mise sur pause en quittant le jeu).

Personnellement, je recommande "SUPERHOT VR" et "SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE", mais le premier jeu est superflu à moins de profiter d'une offre groupée.
 
Simbabbad
232 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
31.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

I recommend this time-moves-when-you-do FPS game to anyone who enjoyed the first one and enjoyed replaying various levels to challenge themselves to do better. If you expect much more, then it can be tough to enjoy the game. It is different in how a series of maps must be played in order to beat a node/level while abilities & lives are also introduced. The 4th wall breaking & pretentiousness has been decreased somewhat in MCD, but still a part of the game. You play a character who plays the game, which isn't 4th wall itself, but a few elements of the game are player-aware.
Here is what else you need to know:
+MCD introduces two types of hacks/abilities that are unlockable as you progress through level: Core abilities where you pick one before you start a node, and earned abilities between maps that lets you gain one of two random unlocked abilities for the rest of the node.
+There is good variety among abilities, but you may want to try to avoid unlocking abilities you don't like so that your random earned abilities between maps provides abilities that best suit your playstyle.
-Not much to the MCD story which focuses on a little bit about the character, their struggles, and what threatens them.
?Map variety seems to have increased from the first game, but given the random series' of maps for each node, it will seem more repetitive to most players.
+There are two nodes near and at the end game that are not meant to be beat, though it is theoretically possible & very time consuming for one of the two levels. This forces gamers down a path they normally don't take and is a unique experience unlike any game that I or reddit know of. I respect the ending in the same way Jacob Geller recaps it in "Games That Save the Best for Last" (END SPOILER):
Vidéo YouTube™: Games That Save the Best for Last 
Vues : 1,058,261
The tiger. He destroyed his cage. Yes. YES. | Directly support me and watch exclusive videos by joining Nebula at https://go.nebula.tv/jacob-geller Support me: https://www.patreon.com/JacobGeller...

?As for other optional non-standard nodes: ERROR nodes are optional and more difficult than usual with no memories or rewards to unlock. Short Endless mode is a single map with endless waves, and Core Infinite is an endless node that progresses through infinite maps.
 
Noble Gamer

Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2023
needed fewer unskippable/annoyingly long story/credit sequences, but generally a pretty good expansion of the first version of the game. new challenges, new mechanics, even new types of red guys to kill. for the most part the story is actually pretty interesting, and plays well into the subtle tone and analog style. it's nothing genius, as that adjective still applies solely to the game's core mechanic, but still interesting. overall a far cry from the browser prototype. i'm proud of how far this has come in ten years. i'll always be back for MORE!!! :D

Recommandé
14.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
Super. Hot. Super. Hot. Super Hot.

One of the most unique shooters ever made just got a semi-sequel that improves upon the original formula just enough to justify them charging more money for it. If you own the original game though you can even get this one for free. Time only moves when you do is the simplest premise of all time but also one that works insanely well here.

I wish it had more weapons and some more environments, but it's pretty fun for what it is and it's the closest we'll ever get to a "John Wick trapped inside a computer program" simulator.

Full video review:
Vidéo YouTube™: SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE - John Wick Meets The Matrix

67 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2022
SuperHot was The Most Innovative Shooter I've Played In Years. Superhot: Mind Control Delete is the least.

Super Hot had three (3) things going for it. The time mechanic was amazing, bullet time elevated to high art. The levels were well crafted and diverse, most were puzzles requiring thought and multiple attempts.The story and presentation were the sleeper element that sold it. Without spoilers the entire game is a multi-tiered creepypasta. And it's a good one. It was more effective and interesting than most games advertised as horror.

Superhot: Mind Control Delete has one (1) thing going for it. Do you like the Endless Modes in Boomer Shooters where you just try to survive against randomly spawning enemies in an arena? If so, MCD is that. It makes you play those in one minute snippets over and over ad infinitum. Zero thoughtful level design, hardly a hint of spoopy plot. The gunplay has some new tricks up its sleeve but nothing revolutionary. It's very one step forward and two steps back.

Maybe I'm falling for some deep meta ♥♥♥ and it gets good. Almost the first thing the game does is tell you to stop playing. But the thing is, I'm bored. Four hours in, probably long enough to complete the original twice and it's been a repetitive slog. It's been a good two hours since a plot point or anything new.

The game play is worse. You can play so sloppily. The AI is dumber, they can't lead their shots like in the first one. Time pressure on the player has been eased in multiple ways. The random battles have no structure or strategy, it's just twitch gameplay...but with pause.
 
Cargo

Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
They took the neat little well designed game called Superhot, added a bunch of cool stuff to it like skills and enemy types, and then turned it from a tactical puzzle-game into a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ endless arena shooter with weapons and enemies randomly spawning inside a few repeating maps. Who thought this was what anyone wanted? At least it's not complete garbage...

Also please don't start your game with "buy our other games now" followed by another screen with "buy now" on it, thanks.

0
Non recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

The original Superhot was an amazing game and Mind Control Delete utterly fails to live up to the original. It has a tiny handful of new features, a few of which are just annoying like enemies that actively limit your ability to run around having fun, and then stretches it out over 8 hours of torturous tedium.
I suffered through the endless dungeon crawls hoping for ANY sort of actual designed level like the original. Cool set pieces like the elevator fight, designed scenarios where you have to puzzle your way past an enemy horde?
Nope. Everything is the exact same dungeon crawl ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Even the boss fights. Even the ending.
Awful game. I'm not going to wait 8 hours for the ending to complete. What a joke.

The level warping is sickening and leads to you Hot-switching outside of the world which instantly kills all your lives. That should be fixed. Hot-switching and charging out of the world shouldn't be possible in the first place. Visual bugs also exist with multiple weapons.
(Got given it for free thanks to owning the other Superhot games. Currently regretting playing it.)
 
Rimmy
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
24.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

里面有一些新的技能：


冲刺：对着敌人按E给敌人一拳（主动技能，类似一代的换人，但是冲刺必须自己补一拳不然一下死不了，而且手上不能有东西且距离够近，冲刺过程中会被障碍物阻挡）

随机枪支：出生手上随机刷新枪支

武士刀开局：出生手上带把武士刀

手雷：指丢出去的物品碎裂会产生子弹（容易误伤自己不要带最好。

爆炸：指自己扣除生命值时会向四周迸发出一堆手里剑。

强力投掷：加强投掷物的伤害，如手里剑投出去可以反弹回来，各种投掷物威力加强，比较好用的一个技能。

二度冲刺：在你冲刺杀完一个人之后，再杀一个人可以立马刷新冲刺CD

连续冲刺：可以连续冲刺三个人，且一击秒杀

反弹：指玩家手中的枪射出去的子弹可以反弹到敌人身上

全面格挡：武士刀切子弹变成反弹子弹（似源氏）

武器大师：近战武器速度变快范围变大

增加移动速度：这个就不介绍了

加快武器使用间隔：字面意思

增加枪支弹药：字面意思

子弹穿透：枪支子弹可以穿透玻璃和敌人打到后面的敌人。

生命+1:字面意思（由于二代有生命值系统，一般三条命，如果选的是冲刺核心，那就只有两条命）

治愈：恢复所有生命值。

（可能还有些有遗漏的，我后面补上或者盒友帮忙补充啦）

新敌人：灰人。该敌人有些地方是灰色，灰色的地方是没伤害的，必须要打红色的地方。

新的AI：手持近战武器的敌人对着他丢东西会把你的东西拍飞。对着武士刀敌人开枪就会把你的子弹切掉。
应对方法：打脚

新武器：手里剑、飞刀、加农炮（神器）、飞镖、信用卡（也许吧）、咸鱼。

大概就这些了，如有遗漏，请帮忙补充一下啦

Anime girls are better :3
557 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Tłumaczyć zasad jakimi rządzi się gra nie będę, bo tytuł ten moim zdaniem powinien być traktowany jako rozszerzenie podstawki.

Fabularnie otrzymujemy historię nieco odrębną (choć nie do końca?) od tej z 'jedynki'. Nie będę spoilował, ale jest równie odjechanie co wcześniej. A biorąc pod uwagę końcówkę gry, to chyba nawet bardziej.

Jeśli zaś chodzi o mechaniki, to zastosowano tutaj tryb niemalże rogalikowy - przemierzamy kolejne piętra, na każdym piętrze mamy kilka poziomów, a każdy poziom składa się z kilku losowo dobranych map. Jeśli zginiemy, wracamy do pierwszej mapy poziomu i powtarzamy proces. Co prawda map nie jest jakoś dużo i dość szybko stają się powtarzalne, jednak żeby nuda nie dawała nam się we znaki, twórcy dodali kilka ciekawych mechanik:
-regularnie odblokowujemy nowe moce, których będziemy mogli używać w trakcie gry - więcej hp, przejmowanie ciał przeciwników, szarża i jeszcze parę innych bajerów,
-odblokowane moce możemy aktywować zależnie od rodzaju albo na początku poziomu albo pomiędzy kolejnymi lokacjami danego poziomu,
-z czasem lokacje są nieco modyfikowane. Nie na tyle, żebyśmy ich nie poznali, jednak dość, żebyśmy musieli zmienić swoją taktykę - tu parę beczek, inaczej ustawiona szafka i tym podobne szczególiki.

Przyznam, że pomimo tego, pod koniec nieco wiało powtarzalnością, a niektóre lokacje mnie zaczynały po prostu irytować, jednak śmiało można powiedzieć, że gra jest przyjemną odskocznią, pozwalającą na zabawę dosłownie kilka minut, jeśli mamy na to ochotę. Gra też jest długa 'w sam raz' by te wszystkie mechaniki i lokacje nie zaczęły robić się wkurzające. Nawet po przejściu możemy wracać do gry na krótkie posiedzenia, gdy akurat nabierzemy na to ochoty.

Myślę, że jeśli komuś było mało podstawowego Superhota, to ten tytuł powinien bez problemu zapewnić dodatkowe godziny zabawy.
 
ZygfrydQ

Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2021
Superhot: MCD takes the mechanics of superhot and turns it into a repetitive game that felt like a chore after 6 or 7 hours. There definitely is content here but since the stages are often repeated, the variation feels somewhat lacking. I would praise the developers for trying something new and (sort of) improving on the endless mode of the original, but the execution leaves a lot to be desired. Even though it was given for free to the owners of Superhot, but I still can't recommend it.

Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2020
В первой части вас ожидали небольшие, но уникальные карты с миниатюрным торрентиновским сюжетом. Здесь же вас задрочат репетативным экспириенсом на десятке карт, которые будут постоянно повторятся с крошечными изменениями. СУПЕР ДРОЧЬ СУПЕР ДРОЧЬ СУПЕР ДРОЧЬ. Поиграл три часика и положил болт.
 
Vaporeon
216 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
15.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Просматривая свою библиотеку, с удивлением обнаружил продолжение SUPERHOT. Как я понял, (но могу ошибаться) данная часть была бесплатно добавлена на аккаунты всех обладателей оригинала. Пару лет назад я познакомился с первой частью серии: игра порадовала крайне оригинальным геймплеем и визуальным стилем, а также интересным сюжетом и сеттингом, которые крайне удачно удалось связать с игровым процессом. Но что из себя представляет MIND CONTROL DELETE?

▒Игровая структура.█▒
Разработчики отошли от привычного линейного повествования. MCD очень сильно напоминает игру в жанре roguelike, однако с некоторыми отличиями от эталонных представителей жанра. Прогресс не сбрасывается после проигрыша, игрока лишь откинет в начало местного аналога "комнаты", зачистка которой не даст никакой награды, кроме возможности продвинуться дальше по карте. Все улучшения и новые способности расположены в отдельных узлах карты и к ним придется прорываться с боем. Также апгрейды по правилу жанра roguelike не являются чем-то перманентным. Они лишь дают возможность случайным образом отыскать себя в процессе прохождения "комнаты" и воспользоваться собой для завершение текущего уровня. Помимо улучшений внутри уровня, игрок может разблокировать набор способностей, с одной из которых ГГ начнет прохождение "комнаты".

▒Игровые механики и арсенал.▄▀
Оригинал был довольно скуден в плане различных механик и разнообразия доступных средств умерщвления противников. Не знаком с SUPERHOT VR и не знаю, были ли там новые фишки, которые могли перекочевать в MCD, но предположу, что VR версия целиком повторяет оригинал. Так вот. В плане новых механик игра ушла далеко вперед. Различные улучшения позволяют ускорять персонажа, практически останавливать подлетающие пули, отражать пули ударом кулака, совершать рывок с ударом в ближнем бою, наделять пули повышенной пробивной способностью или же заставлять их рикошетить, и это лишь часть апгрейдов, которые вы можете открыть по ходу игры. Также был расширен набор инструментов для уничтожения врагов: доски с гвоздями, трубы, метательные ножи, лезвия циркулярных пил, местный аналог рельсатрона (низкая скорострельность, огромная скорость пули), виниловые пластинки, дротики и еще россыпь различных объектов, которые неплохо подходят для зачистки локаций.

░Противники▒
Разнообразие врагов также шагнуло вперед. Появились оппоненты, чье оружие главный герой не способен использовать, некоторые враги стали почти полностью неуязвимы к внешнему воздействию и умирают лишь от попадания в свою слабую точку, враги с катанами научились отражать почти все пули, появились "заминированные" противники, чья смерть сопровождается разлетом шрапнели от их тел. Отдельно стоит отметить местных боссов, которые обладают по своему уникальными особенностями.

▀Локации▒
Разработчики придумали множество уровней, однако построенный ими roguelike геймплей подразумевает постоянное повторение одних и тех же локаций. Пусть их пул расширяется постепенно и нам какое-то время регулярно подкидывают новые уровни, сравнительно быстро игрок знакомится со всеми игровыми локациями. Около половины игрового процесса я провел в уже поднадоевших интерьерах, каждый уголок которых был мною хорошо изучен.

░Саундтрек▀
Его почти нет... Среди местных локаций есть ночной клуб. Сражение в нем сопровождается весьма бодрой и подходящей под геймплей электронной музыкой, которая реагирует на скорость течения времени. Это, если не ошибаюсь, единственный момент в игре, где мы будем расправляться с врагами под музыку. Весь остальной геймплей проходит в тишине, и это, на мой взгляд, второе упущение разработчиков после надоедающих локаций.

█▒История▄
В оригинале довольно часто игровой процесс прерывался на различную активность главного героя во всемирной паутине, преимущественно это было общение в чате с интернет-знакомыми, через которое раскрывался лор игры. В MCD сюжет стал, как мне кажется, скуднее, при этом его ощутимая часть стала необязательной: вам самим придется приложить усилия, чтобы открыть доступ к сюжетным записям, которые разбросаны как вне уровней, так и на самих игровых локациях в виде замаскированных терминалов. Лично мне повествование в первой части было ближе, тем не менее понимаю, что многим придется по душе возможность скипнуть лор и сконцентрироваться на геймплее, который без сомнения стоит на первом месте в серии SUPERHOT.

Подведу итог.

Недостатки игры:
- Малое разнообразие уровней;
- Отсутствие адекватного саундтрека;
- Несбалансированность сложности на некоторых игровых этапах.

Достоинства игры:
+ Масса новых механик;
+ Возросший арсенал;
+ Новые противники, а также появление боссов;
+ SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT SUPER HOT
+ В игре не так много достижений Стима и они простые. Выбить платину довольно легко;
+ Есть бесконечный режим с отбиванием волн противников, что в купе с большим разнообразием способностей и roguelike основой делает игру достаточно реиграбельной;
+ Стоимость, а точнее ее отсутствие: владельцы оригинала получили MCD бесплатно.
 
DeVertu
169 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2021
So far from what I've played, the game heavily expands upon the original Superhot in a mostly positive manner. For starters, there's significantly more variety in terms of enemies. They're still essentially dudes but now you've got guys with red weapons who can't be disarmed as well as "armored" enemies (Basically white enemies who don't die unless you hit whichever part of their body is red). Dudes with melee weapons can also block gunfire as well which makes them stand out more than they did in the original.

The overall structure of progression is vastly different as well. The first game followed a linear formula. Here you've basically got a kind of Mario 3 kind of overworld with an ASCII appearance where you progress by completing nodes. Each node contains a series of levels you need to beat to progress. There's also nodes that grant you "hacks" which are essentially traits which you'll be given chances to choose from between levels in a node. These go a long way in adding a bit of variety in playthroughs since a fair number of them add some interesting effects.

It's hard to say whether or not the game is more or less forgiving. You've actually got some semblance of a health system this time around instead of just dying in one hit. You get two hits by default and sometimes if you're lucky you'll get a chance to heal between levels or even get more health when you're presented with your choices for hacks. The trade-off though is that when you die you have to start the whole node over. There also seems to be a sort of protection system in place against unarmed enemies. I can't quite tell if it's just matter of giving you a warning or if it outright blocks a single strike but either way the game offers some degree of protection so you don't suddenly get instakilled from a guy sneaking up behind you and punching you in the back.

The one issue I have is with the levels. The original Superhot was short but at the same time almost every level was unique. Here you've basically got a handful of levels that are randomly selected when you enter a node. Item placement, enemy spawns, and your starting point are determined somewhat randomly but the levels themselves never change. So basically you'll enter a node, do the same dojo level you've already done like 20 times, then go on to the same garage level you've done God knows how many times, then the same server room you've already done who knows how many times, and then what do you know, you're back to the dojo level. More levels get added to the mix as you progress but it still gets monotonous.

On top of that, due to the nature of the levels themselves, the game feels like it lacks memorable levels. For example, the elevator level in the original game utilized the game's whole "time only moves when you do" mechanic to turn a hand to hand fight with a few guys in an elevator into more of a puzzle than a standard fight. Levels like that went a long way in adding variance to the game. I've yet to experience anything quite like that in Mind Control Delete. Still, if you can look past that fault, the game is still worth picking up if you're essentially craving Superhot with new elements, new enemies, and new weapons
 
Phucket
561 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game requires you to leave it running for 8 hours (2.5h after devs caved in due to criticism) in order to actually progress the final ending. Not quit and return after that time - actually leave the game running.

Someone on Reddit said: there is a thin line between creative expression and wasting my time. There is also electricity bills, environment, and so on, that are clearly not a concern to whoever came up with such idiocy.

At this point it does not matter if the game overall was good or not (it was average, great premise with flawed execution) - it is completely soured by the ending. Devs could use to learn something that other artists know already: audience is your life, and while you should challenge the audience, you must never disrespect them.

(Game received for free as I already owned Superhot prior to SH:MCD release)

Recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
SHMCD is pretty awesome. They add some really fun tweaks to the core SUPERHOT gameplay that are really fun to toy with in a roguelike formula, and even synergize in cool ways. I really liked it, but there are a handful of problems holding it back from being as great as it should be. (Minor spoilers of abilities below)

- The charge (and probably hotswap, didn't test) core allows you to get caught in monster closet doors and immediately kills you, forcing you to start over.
- Enemies holding red guns will not drop them, which is cool, but also they're often hard to make out when held against their body making for cheap deaths when trying to make snap judgments as you often do. Maybe a white gun with red stripes wouldn't be too much of a change for the art style?
- After a short while, the menus may become unusable as they scroll far too quickly (might be 60+ refresh rate issue)
- The sewer level's implementation of water just looks broken more than anything.
- The DJ level has incredibly loud music depending on your position in the level that doesn't seem to be affected by the music volume setting. I also heard a terrifyingly loud screeching noise probably completely independent of the level itself at one point.
- The campaign lasts too long for the amount of variety there is in the gameplay. It fits with the theme, but it still got on my nerves a bit as someone who suffered the same addiction as the 'protagonist'.

It's still great fun, I just hope it gets polished up a bit more and I wouldn't recommend playing all the way through in long bursts, as it does need a bit more variety. All that said, I can't really complain considering I got the game for free as an owner of SUPERHOT.
 
AwesomeNick

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier
İlk oyunu oynayıp bitirdiğimde tadı damağımda kalmıştı ve o zaman oyunun tek eksikliğinin oyun süresinin kısalığından bahsedip ''keşke biraz daha uzun olsaydı'' demişim. Oyun yapımcıları da bu oyunu ilk oyundan uzun yapmışlar ve sıkıntıdan öldüm sonlara doğru. Belki de benim için oyunun sonlara doğru heyecanının yitirmesinin sebebi tek seferde bitirmek istemem olabilir.
Her anlamda ilk oyunun üstüne bayağı geliştirme yapılmış. Ben de suyunu sıkana kadar oynadım. 7-8 saatte bitirdim. Yetti.

Puan tablom ise;

50 < Oynanmaya değmez
51 - 59 = Çok Kötü
60 - 69 = Kötü
70 - 79 = İdare Eder
80 - 89 = İyi
90 - 95 = Çok iyi
96 - 99 = Mükemmel
100 = Yok öyle bir oyun.

PUAN = 89
 
GNT Gin0
892 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2023
The Superhot games are games about trial and error, about thinking before acting, and about doing what is necessary over what is clear. The premise is simple. You are a gamer suddenly loaded into a game where you think faster than bullets move. At first, your movements are jerky, disjointed and unskillful. Soon, however, you tap into the mind of, well, minds. You see things before they happen, predict certain outcomes based on predetermined behaviors and reviews of what you see. You plan your moves before you execute them, and soon, you think so quickly that these thoughts take only seconds, which is in reality imperceptible amounts of time. You leap over an enemy, slamming your heels into another. The window comes closer, alerting you to several enemies behind it. Your goal is them. You do not keep them waiting, smashing through the window. The first and closest is stunned by the broken glass and quickly dispatched. The second is fluidly disarmed of his knife and shattered by the same. You skillfully take the knife back and launch it at a sword-wielding ruffian just in front. He parries the attack, and you take him out with fists, before hearing a shot and turning, to meet your fate at a shotgun blast. You think faster than you move, you think faster than time itself. Make every second count.
 
Cthonmon

Gray_Fox_96_
