1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
28.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
이 게임의 장점

1.원작보다 상향된 아크로바틱하고 스타일리쉬한 플레이가 가능함
2.전작보다 상향된 난이도를 즐길수 있게끔해주는 새로운 적 (지뢰,자폭병,아누비스맨,바꿔치기맨,헬리콥터맨,부분석고맨)

이 게임의 단점

1.내가 원하는 최적의 조합을 순수 운빨로정해야 한다 (자유도가 없음)
2.약 서른두가지의 맵을 뺑뺑이 돌리면서 진행되는 게임 (루즈함+3000)
3.의미없는 뺑뺑이+더욱 지루함을 더해주는 쓸데없는 무한모드
4.막판에 레벨링되어있는 논스탑100층 깨기컨텐츠 (플레이시간의 80%허비함,깨도 아무것도 없음,뒤졌을때의 깊은 빡침 )
5.안그래도 어려운 난이도 후반에 능력들 다 압수해감, 그상태에서 10단계 깨야됨(뇌절)
6.게임 끝나고 다시 하려면 복구기능 누르고 3시간정도 기다려야됨 이런 싯팔~예미~
7.개 줫같은 체력시스템+노개념세이브


 
무술적으로빠르다
46 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Un'ottima espansione dell'originale
Premetto che ho ricevuto questo gioco gratuitamente avendo acquistato SUPERHOT prima che MIND CONTROL DELETE uscisse dall'early access (un grazie al team di sviluppo che ha permesso ad un sacco di persone di divertirsi ♥♥♥ questo capolavoro gratuitamente), ma se anche avessi dovuto acquistare questo gioco a prezzo pieno non avrei comunque avuto un'opinione diversa;
parliamo in ogni caso di un gioco estremamente divertente ♥♥♥ controlli migliorati e un sacco di livelli e modalità. Mi ha lasciato piacevolmente sorpreso anche la "modalità storia" dalla quale non mi aspettavo niente di che ma che è riuscita a stupirmi più di quanto ci fosse riuscito l'originale SUPERHOT.
 
Harablo
197 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juillet 2020
SUPERHOT MIND CONTROL DELETE (ou SHMCD, ou MCD) est un FPS se déroulant dans l'univers de SUPERHOT (que je vous conseille vivement au passage).

Pour ceux ne connaissant pas la série, SUPERHOT est un FPS qui consiste à éliminer tous les "red guys" (les méchants quoi) d'un niveau. Mais pour cela, le temps avance seulement lorsqu'on bouge (le temps se fige lorsqu'on ne touche pas au clavier et à la souris), ce qui permet de planifier des stratégies dans les combats et de pouvoir réaliser des actions ultra stylées.

Le coeur de ce jeu se déroule dans le gameplay du premier tout en ajoutant un côté rogue-like au jeu avec de nouveaux pouvoirs durant l'avancée du jeu - les .core - ; de nouvelles techniques - les .hack - ; de nouveaux ennemis (avec l'arrivée d'ennemis spéciaux) ; et des objets tranchants à lancer et plein de nouveaux niveaux.

La boucle de gameplay est assez basique. On se retrouve à enchaîner une dizaine de niveaux à la suite on l'on doit éviter de se faire toucher en tirant et en balançant des objets sur les ennemis au ralenti, tout en utilisant le .core choisi au début ainsi que différents .hack que l'on va engranger afin de devenir plus puissant dans cette série de niveaux.

Là où j'adore le gameplay de SUPERHOT et qu'avoir du nouveau contenu se suffit à lui-même pour ma part, je ne sais pas si d'autres fans du jeu s'y retrouveront, alors j'aurais préféré mettre un avis mixte pour plusieurs raisons :

Dans le côté positif :

- Le gameplay est toujours aussi jouissif et fun
- Tout le nouveau contenu SUPERHOT fait plaisir
- Le lore et l'histoire du jeu sont toujours mystérieux et addictifs à essayer de comprendre
- Le délire méta dans l'histoire est plutôt sympa MAIS...

Dans le côté négatif :

- ... SPOILER ATTENTION : A la fin du jeu il faut laisser tourner le jeu 2h30 si vous voulez pouvoir rejouer à d'anciens niveaux après avoir terminé l'histoire. Et même si c'est un peu une "blague" méta, bah laisser tourner un jeu 2h30 sans rien pouvoir faire, c'est chiant (j'ai du utiliser un programme pour faire passer le temps du jeu plus vite).

- C'est un peu répétitif, les niveaux reviennent assez vite, le jeu nous encourage pas à utiliser les autres .core que celui dont on a l'habitude d'utiliser. Une sorte de routine de tuerie (c'est un peu glauque dit comme ça) s'installe assez vite.

- Le jeu est vraiment court pour son prix (il peut se finir en 4-5 heures en traçant je dirais, mais en voulant faire tous les niveaux il se finira en une dizaine d'heures, voire plus).

C'est donc un jeu vraiment sympa, mais doté de plus de côtés négatifs que ses prédécesseurs, donc à choper en soldes je dirais ! J'en reste quand même content de son achat.
 
Shabakam
420 produits enregistrés
0

10.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Given to free to owners of the main game, free-ness is somewhat debatable.


Pacing is terrible, game doesn't really get interesting until the (__@_) series of levels. Total reset of a segment after failure is a hindrance, and the levels are all identical until stage corruptions start showing up later.

Some of the community is a bit rude in the Discussions, trying to justify game flaws with in-game reasons.

Other than that, just read the reviews about other poor design decisions. Not worth the full price tag of 25 USD.
 
Werewing
1,405 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2020
So basically imagine superhot 1, but you play every level 20 times. This game has great additions from the first, but ultimately is dragged down with how levels and menus work.

The game is a massive slog that overstays it's welcome, I've been playing for 7 hours and I think I'm near the end, but I can't tell, but that's 7 hours of the same 20 levels, and I'm pretty fast at superhot so those 7 hours are gruelling. The lack of a normal menu is strange in favour of this weird mario 3 map thing, which is annoying if you want to play endless and have to go through 2 worlds to get back there.

The game also has mini boss characters that show up randomly in a mission, 2 of the 3 can't be killed and is just there to piss you off. While looking if I can kill them on the forums I did see the ending is pretty rank, so I'm really excited for that annoying feature.
It just feels this expansion for the fans has done everything it can to annoy core fans who enjoyed the simple mechanics of the previous game, and honestly I would have preferred a $5 map pack for the first game.

In addition to that, Linux performance is iffy, the proton version doesn't work without tweaking, and native has some lags and resolution issues. In both cases you won't get the standard unity options dialog. Regardless it shouldn't be having these issues.
 
bastois

Évaluation publiée le 19 aout 2019
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

SUPERHOT is easily one of my favorite games of all time, so when I found out that there was a non VR stand alone expansion I bought it right away. I was blown away by how much they improved from the original SUPERHOT. there are endless ways to play based on how you choose to upgrade your mind, there are new levels with new enemies and environmental hazards, and countless new ways to kill red guys.

Im so happy to see a company that cares about their product, lets hope that the SUPERHOT Team makes more incredible games in the future.

Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

emm目前达到了放弃那里，难度越来越难了，看在白嫖的份上给个好评
新增加的技能啥的看其他人评测就好了，我个人比较喜欢冲刺core，闪电反应hack和随机枪支hack
玩到游戏中后期的时候，难度高的我想放弃，不仅要2条命连通15个关卡，还需要躲着无敌的boss，一开始不知道走狗（冲刺boss）是干嘛的突然就少了血我还觉得莫名其妙，忍者就不用说了，穿墙扔刀，我被忍者逼墙角的时候真的想退游戏。再说说成瘾者（热切换boss），突然就把我热切换了，然后3个爆炸人以及那个boss拿着步枪围着我打，根本躲不了，敢问这游戏真的有平衡性吗？
还有，打关的时候经常epic fail，死在最后一关最后一个敌人手上是什么感受你体会过吗？一味地增加难度，无法获得玩家的青睐。
我们不想要高难度，不想more and more，我们想要创新，想要一个有剧情有任务的superhot
 
蒸汽砂糖Spun

Non recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

First of all, a really nice game on its own, really love the massive jump from the original to this one
But there's one thing that bothers me and genuinely makes this game unplayable for me:
At some point the levels start getting actively nauseous, meaning your viewing distance gets significantly decreased and after a certain distance the level zooms away from you, letting everything around you appear rooted in the void
And when you move the effect moves with you, meaning the level is basically in constant motion
This also affects the way you perceive the enemies since you have no real context for distance

And I only became actively aware of that effect when I was already severely nauseous (and I rarely get motion sick or anything similar, not even related to moving images but this is something extreme)
So, if any developers see this, please add at least an option to disable the "zooming" as I call it
 
DarquosLeblack
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
6
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE

John Wick + Matrix Styled Game

SUPERHOT’s slick shootouts are back but with a twist. This game has no story or narrative aspect. It’s just so.......Random. SUPERHOT is basically a fusion of John Wick’s badass ways of killing people plus The Matrix’s time stopping bullet-dodging feature. You will encounter several “Endings” but the game doesn’t really end until you finish the 100th level.

You would think the game would be repetitive, but this is where you are wrong. It does have a sprinkle of repetition, but all the levels differ from each other as they are randomly generated. Enemies become stronger and tougher to defeat as you progress. But you get access to abilities too! You can switch places with enemies, pounce at them, thrown objects explode on impact like a frag grenade, and several other abilities that enable you to face tougher enemies.

Storyline

If you are expecting a storyline from this game, then don’t bother getting this game. This game is the embodiment of randomness. It’s so random that it will drive you crazy. At one time, you will be going through a planned path of Nodes, then suddenly, you encounter a random flow of crazy and senseless levels. So yeah, no storyline.

Gameplay

There is no specific path for you to follow to kill the enemies. Smash ‘em with your fists, slice ‘em with you Katana, Shred ‘em with a shotgun, puncture ‘em with shurikens or knives and there are so many other props that can be used to kill them. I can say that the possibilities in ways of killing them are almost endless. I forgot to mention that this game is in First Person Perspective!

Several shooters use a feature called “Bullet Time” which basically slows down time which enables you to get accurate shots and conserve ammo. This game took that concept and enhanced it. They made it so time stops when you stop. When you move, time moves. This permits you to dodge bullets like in the Matrix. It amplifies your reaction time, giving you more time to react. But it is not as easy as it seems. You only have 2 Hearts/Lives (Or more depending on the Hack/Buff you choose) and there is no room for mistakes here. So you fight, you die, you fight, you win or die again.

Enemies spawn randomly here. They can spawn even behind you, and in this case, the game will flash text warning you to check your back. There are also doorways from which enemies come in. More than the required number of enemies spawn. You pass a level if you get the required number of kills, which isn’t mentioned.

Enemies get tougher as you progress. Enemies with weapons that you cannot grab from them, enemies that take damage only if you hit the red crystal part on them, and other parts are white concrete which cannot be damaged, spiked enemies, etc. are some of the harder enemies that you will encounter. In my opinion, enemies with the Assault Rifle (Burst Fire) and Shot Guns are the hardest. Enemies with Katanas can slice your bullets but can be taken down by shooting them on the legs. Other types comparatively pose a lesser threat.

The “weapons” you have access to range from a paintbrush and a palette to an Assault Rifle and Nail Gun. The combat system along with the time-stopping mechanism is what gives this game its charm. There are 9 main ways to kill enemies with the available weapons, but you can be creative and combine these ways to kill an enemy. Stunning enemies by throwing objects at them plays a crucial role as it can disarm armed enemies (Except the ones for whom the weapons become a part of them) and stun enemies that are charging at you.

Graphics

The game is restricted to a palette of 3 colors; Red, Black, and White. It also uses only two textures, Glossy and Matte. Most of the props and enemies look like glossy glass/crystals. For a game with limited colors and textures, the graphics are actually good. The animations of the enemies or weapons getting shattered are on point. The art style used is a Refined version of Low Poly assets.

Pros
  • Immersive Gameplay that guarantees hours of fun.
  • Gives a good feeling to players. Makes you feel badass.
  • Unique concept.
  • Not very high system requirements.
  • Has a lot of humor which is showcased through intentional visual glitches and meaningless and crazy levels.
  • May be repetitive, but every level is random and you gain access to new buffs and abilities.

♥♥♥♥
  • Some people may feel the game is repetitive.
  • The game is too bright and has a lot of flashing lights and bright text which may affect players with epilepsy.
  • The game gets progressively harder and towards the end, it may become a bit too difficult for the players.

Conclusion

This game is a whole new concept that I have never come across. I really liked the gameplay and its whole idea of randomness and craziness! The game is free for people who owned Superhot before its release. It is also a Standalone now, and there are a lot of sales for this game!

Reviewer: Midplayz
Juan Wick

Rating: 9/10

Please follow United Critics for the full review and more quality reviews.
 
Midplayz
1,598 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

A very polished and improved version of the original SUPERHOT, but overstays its welcome. The roguelite nature is an interesting concept, but in my opinion it's not very well executed. The game provides tons of cool modifiers to make the game experience more interesting and fresh, but repeats the same few levels with little to no changes too often. New enemy types aren't fun to fight with, they have no weaknesses at all, and that's simply bad design. When they show up (which seems to be random), the only thing you can really do is run and hurry to finish off the other enemies still alive, which can be complicated seeing as some of the new enemy types that are invincible can attack you through walls, or teleport to you through obstacles.

What I really disliked the most was the developer's apparent dislike over the original game's fans asking for more content. The game provides that, yes, but it also actively mocks and taunts said players ingame, treating them like addicts or violent psychos for wanting more to play. It's not even faintly teased, it's even directly said at times, via logs written by some obsessed SUPERHOT fan. I don't think it's right to do something like that.

But to close off with the good, the new levels are fun (until you play them too many times and realise they're too samey), the increased amount of environmental weaponry is fantastic, the game looks great, keeping its original minimalistic look but improving upon it. The replay tool and website are still here, and it's an amazing feature.

But overall as an experience, I think the original SUPERHOT was much better. It respected the player, it was ridiculously short, yes, but it was also more memorable. I wish there had been a middle ground between the two here, seeing as this game already has the groundwork for that. Just needed to pace the upgrade unlocks better, improve on the new enemy types, have more levels (or some sort of randomization, as roguelites tend to have). I also think it shouldn't have had, among its already short list, so many levels taken from the original SUPERHOT. It's not all levels from what I can recall, but might as well have gone all the way in with that. Would've slightly helped with the lacking level selection.

But overall, if there was a "Neutral" option, it's what I'd choose. It's not a bad game by any means, it's a great game filled with ideas not well implemented that upsets the beautiful balance of the original, turning this game from a beautiful ballet of death into a repetitive, trial and error, luck-based experience.

I think the original is better. I recommend playing that only. Stay away from it is my suggestion. Too repetitive and pretentious just for the sake of making a point.

Spoilers ahead for some more ranting on the game’s ending message.

I get the game’s message. It’s the developers trying to tell the player to let go, to not obsess over more content in the game. To not ask for sequels, gameplay additions and whatnot. To not ask for more plot and lore. “Less is more” is a repeated message near the end of the game. It’s the name of the last achievement I’m willing to get, that according to Steam only 6.7% of the players have.

That is a beautiful message. I imagine it’s a critique of games that pad out content, repeating so much meaningless content over and over and players are still craving for more. I will give it credit, the message is not bad at all, but… the execution? Why do that in SUPERHOT? Why not make something else to show this point?

Up until now, I never really thought I wanted more SUPERHOT. Hell, I didn’t even buy MIND CONTROL DELETE. I got it for free for owning the original, apparently due to the promise of the developers to do so, or something like that. But I got curious, and wanted to check it out. It’s just baffling that in here, there’s mechanics to make a killer expansion/sequel to the original SUPERHOT.

“More is less” is valid. I found it weird how this game kept adding new “hacks” as it calls it. Gameplay changers you can activate after surviving long enough in a few levels. The game starts to take them away near the end, and the funny part is, I actually loved that. I loved that they started to strip out the modifiers that make the game more diverse of course, but also were the only reason I could stand replaying these 15-ish levels so many times. They were fun to mix around!

But when the game took them all out and had me do one last level playlist, one after the other, die and it’s a restart from the beginning, OF ALL levels in the game… that’s when I had the most fun with this game.

When it played just like the original, it felt absolutely great. But if that was the only reason this game existed, and the additions are here just to prove the point that “the original is fine as it is, go replay it”, then that’s… really pretentious. After the game taking away your newly acquired powers, it starts to also strip you of basic game functions. You can’t say no. Jumping? Gone. Shooting? Gone. Punching? Gone. Throwing? Gone.

… Looking around with the mouse?... Gone.

… Moving?

Gone.

I’m gonna need some time to think and research, but in the end this game is a really weird experience. Like I said, I think the original is better. I recommend playing that instead, and only that.

The final nail in the coffin is requiring you to keep the game on for 2 and a half hours to get back inside, which the game already says is meaningless, filler content. I’m not going back. There’s ways to skip the timer but I don’t wanna do that. It feels wrong, and I don’t really support this kind of message in this way. Plus I have other things to play and do. Not to mention the waste of electricity and computing power. I don’t wanna get an achievement for that, just too dumb.

I rambled on for long enough. I guess what I’m trying to say is, it’s just silly to use a game that was indeed as it claims in the first game and the community repeats over and over “the most innovative shooter I’ve played in ages”. But this is the equivalent of a greedy corporation making a sequel and just butchering everything. All in the name of telling the player that “less is more”. It might be a critique to the industry.


But it also is a paid product. In the end, I think it wasn’t a great call to make this sort of social commentary using SUPERHOT. All it did for me was make sure I don’t want to play anything else related to it anytime soon.

Unless there’s a hidden unlocked progression system once the game is completed and you wait for almost 3 hours for the game to let you go back in (yeah right), I’m absolutely done for a long while. Maybe forever. It’s a shame, really.

All of the ingredients for a phenomenal expansion are there, but the price to pay to make a statement was to make the game stale and repetitive on purpose. Taking away the sweetness SUPERHOT was all about and making it into a mediocre roguelite game.

Didn’t even have a cool song in the credits like in the original this time. Just telling the player to wait 2 hours and 30 minutes for no timeworthy content. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.
 
Mega
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Pretty disappointing for me, honestly. This went the route of padding time with quantity over quality in my opinion.

The original SUPERHOT had a relatively short campaign but it was well-crafted with puzzle-based combat. Further, the game had challenges where you would replay the campaign levels with buffs or weaknesses. I'll be honest in that I was fine with most (but not all) of the challenges in the original game, because sometimes they made for completely different experiences going through some levels.

But MIND CONTROL DELETE genericized the "challenges" aspect of the first game and churned out a repetitive shooter that's based on the bare bones of roguelites. It's even sillier in that the developers seem to almost troll consumers with their attitude in this one.

The biggest complaint for the first game was that it was simply too short of a campaign and thus was overpriced. This expansion (it really doesn't deserve "sequel") starts out with a fake "campaign" that is maybe a few minutes long and then has a credits screen, which seems to be looking to mess with people who complained about the length of the original.

Then the story (at least as far as I've seen) is some computer entity repeatedly asking "You want more? You're addicted?" and then the game just becomes a boring repeat. You have this digital map where you choose nodes to start off "mini-campaigns" which have a handful of levels. The game randomly picks the levels and also you get randomly-generated buffs every few levels. If you die during any mini-campaign, then you have to restart that node.

The puzzle aspect of the game is gone in that every level is essentially a small-to-medium sized arena with endlessly spawning enemies. Guns, throwables, and other stuff are scattered all over the place to the brim. You finish each level by killing a specific amount of enemies as they continue to spawn... But there's nothing else to it.

A few hours into the game and I made it to the 2nd section of nodes and did a handful more, and then decided I don't care enough to play anymore. It's all the same levels repeated, with no uniqueness to them as far as I can see.

Returning to an earlier point in order to address repetition: the reason I mostly liked the "challenges" in the first game is because the levels were manually crafted to make the puzzle aspect the main focus. The developers had the layout done, chose where enemies spawned and what weapons they had, etc. So replaying some of the same levels with different goals felt like it made sense; it was cohesive.

But here, the manual crafting is no more. The layouts were formed to be generally open rooms, sometimes multiple rooms connected, but there isn't a puzzle anymore. The randomness of enemies, buffs, and also the scattered weapons and items makes it less interesting.

In the original SUPERHOT, I remember levels where you'd spawn while enemies are already firing at you (or something along those lines), and you'd have to figure out how to maneuver your way out of the situation and take everyone down. Each time you failed, you'd respawn into the same situation, ready to continue tackling the same puzzle. That was the fun part of the game.

But MIND CONTROL DELETE removed that and turned it into a mini-roguelite arena fight. The uniqueness is gone for me, and so I'm done with it.
 
Dravvad

Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2022
Ovladani zustalo stejne stejne jako v jednicce. Pokud se otacite nebo pohybujete, cas plyne normalne.
Navstivite celkem 4 patra (celkem 32 levelu), ktera postupne prochazite.
Na zacatku levelu mate k dispozici vzdy dva zivoty. S nimi postupne musite projit vygenerovnou serii map. Mezi levely je moznost odemknout si nahodny hack, coz je usnadnujici schopnost.
Pokud zemrete, musite blok cele serie map opakovat.
V poslednim patre uz to zacalo byt dokola, ale zase se vyrazne zvedla obtiznost.
Bohuzel na tento level design je tu malo map.
Mezi novinky se radi napriklad spawnuti nesmrtelnych nepratel, vracejici se katana nebo odrazeni kulek.
Jednoduche na 100% achievement (vse story+najit terminal+2,5hodky pockat na konci hry na smazani dat).

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Superhot has great branding, and the theme of this game is that you want MORE SUPERHOT.
Any semblance of story is just "you wanna keep playing? Have fun here's some fun stuff!" Every one of the steam achievements is just more, More, MORE

There's some cool new mechanics, which make the beginning much more forgiving: you can take multiple hits and you don't have to kill every single enemy. This encourages faster gameplay which is very enjoyable compared to being so careful not to get hit or restart each level, which was a real problem in Superhot VR where you had to restart the entire set if you get hit once.
As the game progresses it does get more difficult due to the rng of each stage and the upgrades you are offered, which gives a great amount of replayability.

Considering the content and price I would say MCD is a better pick than the original, but I think the price may have been arbitrary since the Superhot team just gave it away!
Thanks for the free game, stay SUPER!


HOT!
 
Chadworthy
1,015 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

There is nothing wrong with title in technical sense. The gameplay is also fun and varied. Issue really comes from the gameplay loop. Playing the same areas again and again just doesn't feel different or too rewarding. Too much effort is needed for new things and runs are quite long so bit punishing.

If you really loved the originals gameplay and can stomach just running it over and over again with minor variations. Then this game is for you. But for me the repetition destroys enjoyment. There is handful of arenas to play, but they don't in many cases offer too much difference in experience. And also you will see them many many times, especially if you keep failing after completing few and then getting backstabbed...

In the end I just didn't start enjoying what game had to offer.
 
Ekaros

Recommandé
20.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2020
Nowy SuperHot to doskonała definicja słowa więcej, co przez twórców prezentowane jest na każdym możliwym kroku i bez wątpienia sprawiło, że moja wiara w polskie gry ponownie przybrała na sile.

PLUSY, czyli czego jest więcej:
- Jeszcze bardziej skomplikowana oraz niosąca za sobą wiele tajemnic fabuła, która od samego początku wciąga gracza w swój specyficzny świat;
- Wzbogacone o większą ilość szczegółów i smaczków lokacje;
- Kapitalna muzyka, która nadaje wielu sekwencjom dynamizmu i nie raz pozwala poczuć się niczym John Wick w świecie Matrixa;
- Genialny system hacków, który w pomysłowy sposób urozmaica rozgrywkę i daje graczowi spore pole do popisu;
- Większy arsenał broni palnej i białej, a także różnorodność przedmiotów rzucanych, spośród których poszczególne z nich zostały przypisane do konkretnych poziomów;
- Nowi i zarazem skłaniający do strategicznego myślenia przeciwnicy;
- Mnóstwo pobocznej zawartości, takiej jak dodatkowe tryby rozgrywki, wymagające większych umiejętności wyzwania oraz sprytnie ukryte sekrety, za którymi stoi więcej tajemnic związanych z opowiadaną historią.

MINUSY, czyli gdzie pojawiły się luki w systemie:
- Niezniszczalni przeciwnicy, którzy od czasu do czasu pojawiają się w losowych lokacjach, są moim zdaniem niepotrzebni i po części zmniejszają frajdę z zabijania czerwonych gości. Moim zdaniem lepiej sprawdziłoby się rozwiązanie, w którym mieliby oni po prostu więcej życia i wymagane byłoby postrzelenie ich kilka razy. Sprawdziłoby się to zarówno w kwestii utrudnienia, jak i nie dawania grającemu poczucia, iż musi jak najszybciej skończyć sekcję, żeby nie narazić się komuś, kogo nie da się uśmiercić;
- Zakończenie, w którym trzeba czekać 2 godziny, żeby wszystko wróciło do normy i można było ponownie zagrać w poszczególne etapy.

Zachęcam do odwiedzenia mojej strony kuratora: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38175180/
 
Gespatio

Non recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

(When I say I got it for free, I got it for having bought the original, so there was some cash down originally.)

So, I played through this game, having actually really enjoyed the first one, and liked the story, for all that it was not super brilliant. And then I got this, and there was no story or plot. Ok, fine, the gameplay still held up more or less. I found the levels got repetitive eventually, and that due to the randomisation there was not the ability to iterate until you had a level down perfect, sure, but it was still fun.

And then I got to the end. And I had to wait 2.5 hours (down from the original 8) in order to be able to replay and go through the couple of nodes I had missed.

As many have stated, that is stupid and annoying. If they had stuck an achievement at the end, or let you skip and you miss an achievement, then that might be inline with the Stanley Parable and other weird meta achievements, but as it is, they abandoned the story from the prototype, from the original, and from VR (which is still IMO the best VR game on steam), in favour of telling us there was no story.

I would have been less annoyed if this was not hyped up with statements about how much there was in this, because in many ways there is less content here than in the original.

Ultimately, I want to like this game, and I would say it was an adequate successor to Superhot, and a good game to play when you just want to relax for half an hour or something, but with that wait time slapped on at the end, I have to say it is aggravating, more than fun.

Edit: Also, if the Devs don't want people to play their game, which they repeatedly say, why are they selling it at all? If they didn't want to make another Superhot, that's cool, they can do other things, these seem like smart folks.
 
Tzeentch
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2022
Naja ich weis ja nicht.
Das Spiel ist definitiv nicht schlecht. Und Super Hot war ein wirklich besonderes außergewöhnliches Spiel.
Dies hier ist es nicht...

Dieses besondere Spielprinzip ist so besonders, dass es leider auch sehr schnell repetitiv wird.
Und genau das ist dieses Spiel. Repetitiv.

Es gibt keine wirkliche Story, außer dieses MEHR MEHR MEHR Ding was irgendwie merkwürdig ist.
Das Spiel wiederholt sich an allen Ecken und Enden. Jede Map sieht man mehrere Dutzend Mal.

Es geht einfach Stumpf in jedem Level darum, alle Gegner zu töten. Alle? Nein! Natürlich nicht. Aus irgendeinem Grund
verwehrt einem das Spiel, alle Gegner zu killen. Du hast schon gewonnen obwohl noch min. 2 Gegner im Raum sind, aber die werden dann einfach vom Spiel gekillt. Why?

Natürlich ging es in Super Hot auch einfach darum alle Gegner zu killen. Aber es war trotzdem anders. Die Level unterschieden sich teilweise enorm während sich hier alles stumpf wiederholt.

Die einzige Neuerung dabei ist übrigens auch dass manche Gegner nur an bestimmten Stellen getroffen werden können.
Machts jetzt irgendwie nicht interessanter.

Es fühlt sich alles eher an wie ein Sandbox Game um einfach ganz viele Gegner zu killen. Als wenn das der einzige Grund wäre für dieses Spiel.

Und das alles für 25 Euro? Nein. Dann lieber Super Hot kaufen wenn man interessiert ist. Also am Ende gerade so negativ
 
ChickNorris

Honestly, this game is weird.

I don't know man. I got it for free. If you did, nice. If you didn't, wait for a sale. The hacks are pretty fun but it breaks the progression in my opinion.

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

对不起，前作勉为其难给了好评，本作就只能给差评了。子弹时间的精彩创意重复使用不能成为推荐的理由，屈指可数的关卡设计以及广义rogue-like机制是本作最大败笔。

继承而来的玩法就不多说了，我现在玩到了第二张图的node 4，肉眼可见的新元素有：
1. 更多种类投掷物，比如有趣的咸鱼，虽然玩法没有什么变化。
2. 石膏铠甲人，只能打露出来的红玻璃。我个人认为是一个比较合理且成功的难度升级。
3. 自爆人，死亡原地发射散弹枪，charge死亡可以沉默。我个人认为是一个失控的难度升级。
4. perk，分两部分，一个是进入每个node前的天赋，我现在只有+1s和charge。打出来一个日本刀回收，但是我没携带。另一个是节点中的perk，随机二选一。
5. 臭不可闻的rogue-like机制。不知从什么时候开始万物皆可rogue-like，就好像更早一些时候的万物皆可开放世界。本作的每个node里边都有固定几个地图，随机顺序。通过一定关卡后奖励随机perk二选一。刷新敌人种类应该也是随机，这个没重复玩同一关比较过。每个node开始有两条命（more有三条），死亡刷新地图从头开始。

开始玩还好，但是越往后越对像勺子一样浅的地图池感到疲劳。难度提升体现在增加普通敌人数量以及引入高阶敌人（石膏铠甲和自爆人），前面关卡躺着过，往后掉了一颗心就会稍微谨慎一些，但基本上还是一遍过。这时候的谨慎玩法就让我产生了反感，平心而论这里任意找一关难度都不会比前作要高，每一关最多只会掉一条命就能通关，不像前作一遍一遍背板。但是本作的难度体现在了保持低失误连续过好几个简单的关卡，否则就要无意义地重复挑战之前的简单关卡，然而这种重复挑战并不会使人提高技术，即使身法再好枪法再准也有可能失手。这种设计无疑是在恶意延长游戏时间，作者无法做出足够多的难度适宜的地图，从而选择这种方式来重复利用。这种无聊的游戏模式让我看到了作者的无能。

老实说我是卡关了才跑出来写评论，可以说是无能狂怒啦XD node 4的敌人数量大概是线性增长到了我不能接受的临界点，而自爆人的出现更是雪上加霜。选择more多一条命但是没有charge可以有效克制爆炸人，选择charge少一条命又感觉很慌。这个节点我大概重来了3-4次，反复挑战实在是太过无聊。

游戏里的perk有流派区别，有快速换弹、出生随机枪、增加弹药、子弹穿透的枪械流，还有charge减cd、charge多人的...charge流，还有一些独特的实用技能，比如加移速、投掷物爆炸。有些perk确实帮助很大，但是如果没选到真不会有太大影响。或者说即使选到了成体系perk也不代表一定稳。玩到后面一个node可能只有2个perk，那是真的有等于没有了。

还有要注意的是在开发新perk时，如果你判断出这个不是很有用，可以在拿光碟后的training room退出来，这样这个perk就不会进入perk池，以后就能有更大概率选到有用的perk。

我应该不会弃，毕竟这种无脑游戏可以随时捡起来玩一把。虽说是免费的，但这个评测是想告诉没买过的朋友们，本作真心不如前作，想体验这个玩法不如去买前作。这么一个偷懒的作品居然还敢卖88。
Posted: 16 Aug @ 2:18am

=====================================================================

想不到这么一个傻逼游戏我还要开cheat engine，而且开挂玩也无聊，后面除了难以外没有任何新意，而且节点数多的令人发指，又臭又长。我相信再怎么脑残粉一遍遍重来也该吐了。难得一个有cheat engine的游戏都让我半途而废了。

总的来说就是剧情无聊，关卡设计简陋，rogue-like机制寒酸。枪械手感子弹时间没什么大毛病，但是玩了一遍前作也够了，本作毫无价值。
 
Maborosi
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Non recommandé
30.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MCD is one of the most passive-aggressive developer to consumer relationships i've ever experienced.

While the game absolutely delivers on expanding the original gimmick system as promised, it's filled with artificial padding and a snide attitude that begs the question; 'why are you still playing superhot? surely there's nothing more for you here.'

while this fits with the original narrative, i'd certainly hope there would be more content for the whopping $25 MCD wants you to shill. i'm more than happy to support developers with fair prices, but what you get here is a glorified endless mode that rewards you with a few additional mechanics as you progress. however, the progression becomes a massive slog the further in you get, with artificial difficulty spikes to the eventual stripping of any mechanics that might've made this experience enjoyable in the first place.

it's just funny, because while i thoroughly enjoyed the original superhot's endless mode, i found MCD's gameplay to be both shallow, and surprisingly manipulative. Original endless was fun because it had no stakes. it was something to be enjoyed at your own pace and was a nice challenge for anyone looking to get more mileage out of what otherwise was a very short game. MCD however, attempts to reward you for playing endless with new mechanics and lore, creating a drive that quickly exhausts any novelty from a game mode I once considered a relaxing distraction.

MCD as a package has very little to offer, and it's quick to let you know that. There's a consistent tone of pretentiousness that comes with the developers practically criticizing their players for wanting to play a game as frustrating and fruitless as this.

Here's a hint SUPERHOT Team. If you don't want to make more content, then don't, because what you have here is a huge middle finger to the people who support your content.
 
JP bubbies

Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Новая часть SUPERHOT вышла гораздо лучше первой, разработчики двигаются явно в нужном ключе. Хоть концепция игры и не поменялась, но стало на много больше уровней, режим бесконечной игры с постоянно валящими на вас врагами, + враги эти стали разнообразнее, со своими фишками. Добавились различные плюшки, по типу - рывка, что позволяет моментально пересечь комнату и напинать по репке врагу, взрывающиеся предметы, вылетающие из героя сюрикэны при получении урона, обмен телами, телекинез и м.д. Игра явно стала лучше по сравнению с первой частью, хотя и первая была более чем не плохой. Если хотите в полной мере ощутить себя героем МАТРИЦЫ, вам сюда =) И пусть нет какого то сюжета и супер графики, игра не про это, здесь важен сам игровой процесс. 10 NEO из 10 ! Игруха бомба =) Надеюсь разработчики придумают что то еще, и порадуют нас новыми частями.

MIND IS SOFTWARE.

기존 슈퍼핫의 액션이 30퍼 진화했다.
즐길거리는 확실히 늘어났으나 빡집중해야되는 긴장감으로 인한 피로때문에 지속적인 플레이에는 다소 무리가 있는듯.
만일 슈퍼핫을 재밌게 플레이하고 게임이 너무 쉬워서 부족하다 싶으시면 그냥 주저없이 사는걸 추천드림.

여기까지가 기존내용
--------------------------
어느정도 마지막까지 진행하고 수정내용

중독자 나오는 상황부터 진짜 난이도가 말도안되게 붕괴됨.
게다가 중독자의 핫스위치 + 특정 스테이지의 왜곡효과 + 특정 레벨 컷씬의 줌효과로 인해서 VR이 아닌데도 상당한 멀미를 느낌. 거의 10분하고 4시간 끄고 10분하고 4시간끄고 반복인듯.
진득하게 파서 엔딩좀 볼려고 했는데 멀미로 엔딩을 못보게끔 만드는게 너무 짜증남.
진지하게 이게 정가 25000원의 가치가 있는가? 없는것같음.

Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2022
SUPERHOT was cool but short, this one is much longer and features more enemies, levels, and character abilities. However, despite great gameplay, the game gets a bit repetitive since it's now a roguelite shooter with short levels.

If you like the gameplay (the time moves when you move and whatnot), this is a game for you, but prepare to die a lot, especially in the later levels. If you are here for the story, just skip it and play the original SUPERHOT.

0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2022
Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimin olduğu küratör sayfamı takip edin.

SUPERHOT ama daha SUPER (değil)

Aslına bakarsanız ilk oyun baya keyifliydi, zaman manipülasyonunu çok iyi işlemişti. Bilmeyenler için SUPERHOT "bullet time" denilen tarzdan yararlanan bir oyun. Yani ağır çekimden yararlanıyor. Oyun içerisinde siz hareketlenip hızlanana kadar her şey ağır çekimde ilerliyor, siz hareket ederseniz zaman da ona göre hızlanıyor. Zamanı bir hızlandırıp bir yavaşlatarak karşınıza çıkan beyinsiz düşmanlarınızı öldürüyorsunuz. Şimdi neden ilk oyun keyifliydi dedim de bu oyuna biraz laf dokundurdum onu açıklayayım. Bu oyun da ilk oyunun sahip olduğu mekaniklere ve hatta daha fazlasına sahip, lakin şöyle bir durum var, ilk oyunun yaratıcılığından yoksun. İlk oyunda da sürekli olarak ağır çekimde düşman öldürüyorduk bu oyunda da ama bu oyunda sürekli olarak 3-5 mekandan birindeyiz ve rastgele gelen rakiplere karşı savaşıp duruyoruz. Sanki sürekli aynı bölümü oynarmış gibi hissettiriyor. Öte yandan ilk oyunda her bölümün az çok kendine has basit bir senaryosu vardı, örneğin birinde bar kavgasındaymış havası verilirken birinde diskodaymış gibi hava veriliyordu. Bu oyunda hiçbiri yok. Sürekli aynı bölümü oynar gibiyiz.

Peki iyi yanı yok mu? Evet var, örneğin her bölümü açtığımızda ilerledikçe farklı özellikler seçebiliyoruz. Mesela can puanı alıyoruz veya katana ile oyuna başlıyoruz gibi. Lakin bunun da çok çeşitliliği yok, çeşitliliğin olmaması nedeniyle de bizi o sürekli tekrar eden bölüm havasından kurtaramıyor.

İlk oyunu aşırı beğendiyseniz ve az da olsa farklı şekilde aynı oyunu tekrar oynamak istiyorsanız bu oyunu da alabilirsiniz. Lakin tekrar eden bölümlerden dolayı herkese ilk oyunu almalarını öneririm, bence bu oyun sadece ciddi indirimlerde alınır. 65SP
 
Setna
1,028 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020

0
Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2020
If you enjoyed SUPERHOT, there's really no reason not to get this one. It's an improvement in almost every way, introducing new enemies, weapons and gameplay mechanics. The levels in MCD are also, in my opinion, a lot more fun to play in compared to the levels in the original SUPERHOT, you get more environment weapons and the levels themselves feel less confined.

This might have been just a "me" issue, but they also changed your hitbox to make you more "slim". Often in the original game, enemy shots that seem a miss (as they are too far to the left/right) would still hit you, and I noticed that that doesn't happen here.

This game also introduces a new mechanic which allows you to select perks which can change gameplay drastically, helping you with enemies and making it more fun to play.

All in all, this game to me is a definite step up from SUPERHOT; it's more polished, has more features, and is overall more fun.
 
Gyde

Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : Phantom

Авторы, внезапно, захотели сделать из простенькой игры-головоломки про стрельбу по красным человечкам некое подобие рогалика (Rogue like), но как-то подзабыли, что одной из главных проблем для них ранее было полное пренебрежение такой механикой как прогресс игрока. А это – один из столпов жанра.

В оригинале весь прогресс сводился к скомканным сюжетным вставкам, которые в виду слабой проработки мира и полного отсутствия персонажей скорее вызывали тоску, чем интерес. Тут же нам докинули несколько усложнённых противников и суперспособностей персонажа, которые, во первых из рук вон плохо сбалансированы, а, во вторых, из-за особенностей построения мира игры, постоянно сменяются на случайные. Последний факт, естественно, полностью обнуляет прогресс, и нам опять остаются только невнятные потуги создателей в сюжет.
SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : Phantom

Авторы SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE, как и раньше, топчутся на месте со своим концептом, не зная что с ним делать, как та знаменитая мартышка из басни. Развить его во что-то сложное, интересное и похожее на современную игру, они явно не могут. Считать за прогресс бесконечные забеги по дюжине одних и тех же унылых уровней с псевдослучайными врагами и способностями я отказываюсь и вам не советую 👎
 
Phantom
654 produits enregistrés
34
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

前作プレイ済みVR未プレイです
ストーリーよりもシステム面重視のレビューになっています

今作の要素
・ステージ
前作ではステージクリア型で次々と進んでいく形でしたが、今作ではマップからノードを選び10前後のランダムなステージを体力2でクリアするという形になっています。
マップは10から20種類くらいから選出されて、ノードごとの特殊効果が追加された状態でプレイすることになります。
クリア条件も全滅ではなく一定数の敵を倒す、が条件になっています。

・武器
前作の武器に追加して弾速が速い銃や敵を倒せる投げものなどが追加されています。
後述のスキルも併せて敵を倒す手段は前作よりも増えているように感じます。

・スキル
今作からの完全新規要素でコアスキルとランダムスキルの2種類が存在します。
コアスキルは、ノード開始前に選択するスキルで、「最大体力1増加」「前作のHotSwitch」「手元に戻せる刀装備」「敵に飛びついて殴る」などが存在します。
ランダムスキルは、ノード内で数ステージごとに2個から選択して取得できるスキルで「移動速度アップ」「近接武器の範囲と速度アップ」「投げものが爆発する」「一定距離内の弾が減速する」などが存在します。

・敵
今作では普通の赤いやつだけでなく「一部しか攻撃の通らない赤いやつ」「爆発する赤いやつ」「コアスキルを使ってくる死なない赤いやつ」などが追加されています。
また、AIも新しくされたようで突っ込んでくるだけでなく回避する行動をとったりなどもするようになっています。

良いところ
前作の基本システムをそのままに各種要素追加により遊び方が多くなっています。
特にコアスキルではプレイスタイルをある程度固定できるので同じステージでも違う動きをしたりなどができます。
また、スキルシステムのおかげで前作よりも超人的なプレイができるようになっており、「ショットガンの弾をすべて刀で返して倒す」「マシンガンの跳弾で壁の奥の敵を一掃する」などができます。

悪いところ
・ステージに関して
ノードの数に対しステージ数が少ないのでどのノードを選んでもほとんどおなじステージばかりを遊ぶことになります。
ノード毎に多少特殊な要素もありますがそれも数種類程度なのであまり差はありません。
また、ノード内のステージ数が終盤になると15なども出てくるため体力2では死にやすく、同じノードを何度もプレイすることになるためより同じようなプレイをすることになります。

・スキルに関して
スキルごとの性能差がかなりあります。正直コアスキルの「敵に飛びついて殴る」やつは範囲も狭いし無手か近接武器状態でしか使えないし飛びついてから殴る必要もあるのでHotSwhichの下位互換にしかなってないです。
ランダムスキルも、「条件が限定で使いにくいうえ弱い」「使えるけどデメリットもそこそこ」「強い」という感じでよほどがなければ強いスキルが出るまでリセマラした方がいいような感じになっています。

・敵に関して
「一部しか攻撃の通らない赤いやつ」の攻撃が通る部位は胴体、四肢のどれかからランダムで選ばれるようなのですが明らかに胴体とそれ以外での差がひどいです。足のやつが出てきた場合は止まってなきゃ近接ぐらいしかまともに通りません。
「コアスキルを使ってくる死なない赤いやつ」は初見じゃ倒せないのが分からない見た目をしているうえ初見じゃなくてもイマイチ判別しにくいため邪魔でしかないです。特に「HotSwitch使ってくるやつ」は立ち位置変えてくる上普通に攻撃もしてくるのであまりにも爽快感を落としている気がしました。
AIの変更も微妙にストレスになるような変更で手の届かないギリギリの範囲でショットガンの引き打ちなどされるとキレそうになります。偏差射撃も心なしか当たりにくくなっている気がします。

・全体的に
基本上振れを引かなければつらいという印象が強く、ランダム性がゲーム性と微妙にかみ合ってないように感じます。
前作からではありますが足音などが特にないため後ろから来た敵に気付かず被弾するということがあるのですが、前作なら「あそこから敵が来るのか。覚えて対応しよう」というようになりますが今作ではランダムなせいで不意打ちがよりストレスになっています。そのために常に周りを見回して敵の位置を確認するというプレイになりがちで前作に求めていた超人的かっこいいプレイとはかけ離れた感じになります。

総評
ここまで散々こき下ろしていますがあくまで前作との比較が主で、単体のゲームとして見た場合にはある程度の無双感がありながらも難易度高めの面白いゲームだと思います。
前作のパズルや詰将棋的な楽しみを期待して買うのは全くお勧めできませんが、ちょっと無双感のあるプレイをしたいという人にはお勧めできると思います。(ただ、そういう人にも前作持ってないなら前作買った方がいいよと言いたくなるのでお勧めしないレビューです)
 
Takotubo
676 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE is a lot of things. Many of them I really wish it wasn't.

- It's Superhot, but more.

The original Superhot had an incredibly captivating gimmick. Time only moves when you move. Other than that, it didn't have much going for it. The presentation was stylized, but very lackluster. Gameplay was fun, but got very repetitive a decent amount into the game with how it stopped adding new content. The story was... eh. MCD is all of that, but more, including the bad parts.

- It's Superhot, but roguelite?

The roguelite elements in MCD were cool at first, but quickly got incredibly annoying. Linear levels don't exist anymore. Instead, levels are broken up into "nodes," which are broken up into smaller level chunks. Nodes can consist of as much as 30* levels at a time (actually unsure if there is a max, I was just told 30 was the highest), and you can only take damage a limited amount of times before having to restart the entire node. This is actually mildly similar to Superhot VR, but it worked in VR because each level was still unique. Here, it's essentially an endless mode broken up.

Additionally, in every node you can choose from a few "hacks" to augment your gameplay. This is an interesting concept and a genuinely fun system when you actually get what you want. Unfortunately, so many of the hacks are just questionable to take and there are some that genuinely give you a disadvantage if you were to take them. I would rather be able to choose hacks I want at the start of a node than having to get ones I may not want at random points throughout it, and risk losing them all midway through.

- It's Superhot, with new and weird enemy design.

MCD does have better enemy variety than the original Superhot, This means that it has more than one type of enemy. In fact, it has 5! Red dudes, very red dudes, spiked dudes, stone dudes, and bosses.

Red dudes are essentially the same as in the first game. Sometimes they carry some of the new weapons. Only one of them is actually interesting, a "railgun" type thing that has incredibly fast bullets that are essentially hitscan. It's alright.

Very red dudes are red dudes, but you can't pick up their weapon and they won't drop it on being stunned. Fine enough.

Spiked dudes are where my problem in the new enemies start. Spiked dudes are normal enemies, but they explode into bullets on death. These have the capacity to kill other enemies and are generally fun to encounter, except when they're at the start of the level and immediately damage you because you could not possibly get away in time. This would not be a problem if this game had actual level design. The gimmick of spiked dudes are also sometimes used in stationary mines randomly placed around a level. Fine enough, when they're not on the ceiling. You generally don't look up in Superhot.

Stone dudes are normal enemies with only one of their body parts red. This would be fine, but melee feels incredibly inconsistent with them, sometimes hitting the stone parts despite me clearly aiming at the red part. They would feel much better to fight if only their torso or head could be the red parts.

Bosses are just awful. Completely unkillable, unstunnable enemies with special attacks that come in at random in levels. Sometimes they'll show up in every level. Sometimes they'll show up in none, Sometimes they'll show up at the start and sometimes they'll show up as the level is ending. Dog is annoying to dodge in any level with tight spaces and no verticality, Ninja is annoying in any level that you can get cornered in, and Addict... Addict is fine enough, I suppose. He would be much more interesting as a normal killable enemy type though. My main problem in the bosses stems from the fact that they're so random. I would be more fine with them if you could predict them coming into a level, or at least which one might come into a level and plan accordingly. Additionally... c'mon, I really can't hotswitch into them? Just make it not kill them and only stun them for a bit after.

- It's Superhot, but with a really dumb story and ending.

The original story in Superhot was serviceable enough. Not great, but it was decent. MCD's story is too focused on being meta and constantly referencing the fact it's "more Superhot" instead of doing anything interesting. I get it. It's the point. I don't like it as a point. The ending is really interesting, up until a point. The final few levels involve you "giving up" aspects of gameplay to approach the end. The first three are genuinely really sick and interesting! In order to give up the three main abilities you've unlocked along the way, you have to complete a series of stages using them and fighting the boss that corresponds to the ability. It's great! And then Powerless comes along and ruins everything. It's just... normal Superhot. 15 stages of normal Superhot, and if you lose you have to do them again. No special enemies. No special abilities. No hacks. Just the main gimmick and red guys. Then, the ending... wander around a virtual world for a while until you get told you have to wait 8 real life hours to be able to play the game again!* (This was changed to 2.5 hours in an update.) Fun!

- It's Superhot, but really, really repetitive.

32 different small arenas, many of which you can't distinguish from each other meaningfully and all of which you'll have to play multiple times throughout the game. 3 selectable special gameplay abilities, which are fun but often get you killed if you try to use them in interesting ways due to the nature of the enemy spawns. A lot of hacks, most of which don't make much of a difference. 4 guns, only one of which really feels unique. 3 bosses, who are almost never fun to fight against. Presentation near identical to the original Superhot. And an ending that makes you wait 8 hours to be able to play the game again.* (Again, has since been changed to 2.5 hours. The fact it was 8 to begin with is still ridiculous.)

I really want to like MCD, but I can't possibly recommend it with the amount of flaws I have with it. It's fun at times, sure, but the amount of stress and anger I felt throughout the game massively outweighed the amount of fun I did have.

If you got it for free, you might as well give it a shot. Maybe you'll like it. I wouldn't recommend buying it.
 
Fritzy
257 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2020

Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

It's fun, but it outstays its welcome. You repeat the same areas several times, and the new abilities, enemies and complications that slowly filter in didn't add enough depth or novelty for me to stay invested through the end. The story also isn't much more than cryptic sentence fragments aiming for allusions to addiction, specifically addiction to this game series; which is ironic considering I was pretty much the opposite of addicted by the end.

It's still Superhot, and it's still fun, but it's basically a race to see if you can finish the game before you get tired of it.

It's the same thing over and over. The story is nice when you get it. But there is so much of the same thing over and over. And you'll hate the ending, I won't spoil it but you will hate it.
Pros:
- The fun slow-mo gameplay is back!
- New guns
- Katana now deflects instead of slicing bullets in half
♥♥♥♥:
- You essentially do the same thing over and over (excluding the story and content you get in the first 50% of the story)
- The music in disco level gets so annoying when you've played it for the 30th time
- And was that ending really needed? I didn't need all that extra time on my record
I waited a long time for this, I can get past the repetitiveness, the annoying music. The annoying new enemy types. But the ending really ruined this experience for me :(

12.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juin 2023
Like a Rouge
SUPER–HOT SUPER– HOT SUPER–HOT SUPER–HOT SUPER-hang on, someone is watching, aren’t they? Hi, please hold the red flag. You know the chant, don’t you? Sure thing you do, it’s SUPERHOT, the indie sensation where “time moves when you do” or at least that’s what I am going to assume, things are easier this way. SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE presents itself as all solid sequels should – it is more of the gameplay that fans of the original look for but remixed in a way that make it go above and beyond what veterans of first instalment are used to. Now, imagine two indie game trends have a car accident, except nobody dies and the contents of both vehicles get thoroughly mixed together.

The comparison doesn’t make any sense? Lovely, let’s delve a little further. Driving a red Ferrari F350 was the original SUPERHOT, while approaching from the opposite direction in a silver Bentley Continental was the rougelike genre, both pedal to the metal towards a fiery conclusion. The result of ensuing collision is a pleasantly solid sequel, which finds a reasonably engaging twist to a formula which otherwise might’ve seemed as a one-time gimmick.

Love-hate relationship
SUPERHOT has an angry relationship with its player. The original was calling out the user for their violent urges propelling the game forward, repeatedly highlighting that the only reason behind game progression is a temporary outlet for brutal tendencies. MCD at large drops the pretence of morality or being a story-driven journey, fully embracing the fact that the player is there to indulge in unapologetic carnage and that they are keen to do so. If you’ve found yourself at odds with SUPERHOT’s moralising tone, while you were just enjoying how a funny red polygon man shatters into pieces, this aspect is grossly reduced in MIND CONTROL DELETE.

That is not to say that “cursed arcade” aesthetic of the original has been withdrawn from, quite the opposite. The user still traverses the peculiar world of BIOS interface adaptation, as with each completed chapter a new “node” is unlocked for the player to explore. This arrow navigated roadmap allows the player to gradually explore the system, continuously unlock new power-ups and occasionally snippets of lore. Most importantly though, every “node” is a gauntlet of several levels, which player has to handle in one go in order to progress.
Random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ go!!!! 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : Alvarion

New kids on the block
Clearing several challenges in a row may initially seem awfully unfair, however the player is not an unrelenting deathdealer for nothing. To facilitate continuous clearing of levels, the player has a wide variety of gradually unlocked power-ups at their disposal. Chief and first among them is having 3 lives, allowing you some margin of error rather than dying from the first hit. Notably superpowers can be divided into melee and range oriented, allowing the player to create a “build” best suited to preferred playstyle. Are you a sharpshooter, eager to use extra ammo with piercing capabilities? Perhaps you are a CQC specialist, enjoying a direct dash to an enemy while holding a katana yearning to strike? Maybe you are a jack of all trades and it would be an awful shame if the bottle you just snatched off the table turned into lethal shrapnel when thrown? MCD has it all.

Introduction of the power-ups may lull you into an impression that you are an unstoppable force of nature. Fair enough, at first you are. However, SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE has a steadily increasing difficulty curve which will require you to fully employ skills learnt during the early stages, once the game properly kicks into gear. To begin with, MCD introduces a number of new opponent types: “glitches” holding a weapon unusable by the player, “concretes” having only a single limb susceptible to damage and “mushrooms” exploding with spikes once they die. Not to mention hunters wielding otherwise player-exclusive powers, further down the line.

Mindless self indulgence
“Time moves when you do” shenanigans combined with this title’s distinct aesthetic deliver a more than solid core for MIND CONTROL DELETE to build around. However, the rougelike blocks used as a finishing touch are a much more divisive aspect. Truth be told, the first SUPERHOT was an overwhelmingly successful proof of concept. Now that the concept has been comprehensively proven, where is one supposed to go from there? MIND CONTROL DELETE isn’t a series of pre-planned engagements, introducing the player to diverse combat scenarios while sprinkling bits of story along the way. Instead, the game offers a number of arenas with defined spawn points and has the player kill several enemies before transitioning to the next level, thus eventually making it up to the player and powers selected, to keep the combat interesting. To give credit where it is due, there is a lot of levels in MCD and with varied spawns it takes a while for the repetition to sink in. That said, it inevitably does, sooner than later at that – to the point where I would recommend playing this title in hour-long sessions, otherwise it may overstay its welcome uncomfortably quickly.
One section of the game involves levels "loading in" during play. The effect is nauseating. 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : Alvarion

I cannot in clear conscience recommend the game for being exhausting, although the effect does seem to be intentional. Tedious game progression is fitting to the game’s theme of mindless grind for the sake of it. Any notion of enjoyment, accomplishment or even purpose are slowly discarded. Through and through, MCD is dedicated to those who were left hungry for more and means to feed you until your stomach bursts.

As a noteworthy mention, I am compelled to highlight the game’s soundtrack by Zardonic. Powerful electronic tunes, occasionally break the indistinct ambience of this title. In doing so, granting gravity to every scene where it springs in to life.
SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : ...{ODuHo4K@}...

Time to move on
MIND CONTROL DELETE is a game that was always going to have the odds stacked against it. Novel idea was a major factor behind the success of the first SUPERHOT, now that spirit of originality is spent, any direct continuation is bound to be viewed as inferior. Nonetheless, the developers chose to squeeze as much as humanly possible out of the gameplay mechanics. Thus, a genuinely decent sequel was born, which was given for free to all owners of the original game. While I have utmost respect for this title as a part of the series, it doesn’t hold all that well on its own. Fans of the genre will likely enjoy the rougelike touch and won’t frown at inherent repetition that comes along with it. That same quality will however be a deal-breaker for those who expected MCD to deliver a journey. Should you happen to already own this title it is more than worth at least checking out. If you are to buy a SUPERHOT game, by all means do try the original and come back once you feel thirsting for more.
 
Alvarion

Non recommandé
15.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
This is a difficult review to write. The gameplay, is basically the original Superhot but even more hectic and includes a various amount of new abilities. The way the game goes about progression in levels though is very tedious. Towards the end of the game, every "level" you're doing is basically 15 consecutive levels in a row. If you die at any point, it resets the entire thing. While I am not spoiling any specific details, if you don't even want *an idea* about what happens at the end, stop reading this review. If you choose to do that, all I will say is ***DO NOT PLAY THE FINAL LEVEL***.




While I won't spoil the game, as a warning to anyone playing, when you get to the final level ***DO NOT PLAY IT***. I won't explain what happens, because this game is new and I don't want to spoil it, but basically the game pulls some artsy-fartsy bull**** and you aren't able to play the game for ***8 Real Life Hours!***. The worst part is you can't just shut the game off and come back later. No no no, you must leave the game open as far as I'm aware. I'm not leaving my computer idle on a game for 8 hours just because the developers wanted to prove a point or something. So yeah, I recommend this for the gameplay, but whatever you do, ***DO NOT PLAY THE FINAL LEVEL***. This is kinda hard for me to give a positive review. The first 2 hours were incredibly fun, but after that it became a repetitive slog. Then there's the whole ending ordeal. The TL;DR version of this review is this game is a worthy follow-up to the past 2 Superhot's, and with plenty of fun new mechanics. But the game becomes really repetitive and straight up locks you out of the game for *8 Real Life Hours, 8 Hours you have to leave the game open for*, just for the "plot" of the game. If you liked the original Superhot, you'll like this. But between the story ordeal and the repetitiveness of what you would consider this game's "story mode", I consider this game a step down from the original Superhot. I wish I could give this game more of a mixed review score than a negative, but those 2 things are enough to make me feel more negative about the entire game than positive.
 
Ziggy Spadesdust

Recommandé
7.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Независимые разработчики – важная часть игровой индустрии. Небольшим коллективам гораздо проще экспериментировать с жанрами и стилями, чем их коллегам из больших студий и крупных корпораций. В 2016 году поляки из команды SUPERHOT выпустили одноименную игру, в которой умело объединили минималистичный дизайн с шутером от первого лица и идеей остановки времени. Этот эксперимент сразу же полюбился публике и прессе, что позволило разработчикам сначала портировать игру на все актуальные платформы, включая VR, а потом заняться производством самостоятельного дополнения SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE. Данный проект развивает идеи, заложенные в оригинале, и в этом обзоре мы разберемся, насколько удачно.
SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : ...{ODuHo4K@}...

Сюжет практически не двигает историю первой части и в большей степени концентрируется вокруг своеобразного метаповествования. Практически с самого начала разработчики говорят, что ничего изменить не получится, а все, что происходит на экране – это лишь бессмысленное насилие. Эта идея будет проговариваться на протяжении всего прохождения много раз. Примерно через час можно увидеть финальные титры, но на самом деле именно в этот момент игра только начинается. Далее время от времени пользователя спрашивают: “Вы хотите большего?” и просят все время кликать на определенную кнопку для продолжения. С каждым нажатием вылетают слова “Super” и “Hot”, что поначалу кажется прикольной идеей.

После псевдо-финала появляется своеобразная карта, выполненная в стиле командной строки из DOS. Здесь нужно направлять курсор в специальные квадратики, на которых находятся наборы локаций, а после их прохождения открывается путь дальше. Это первое нововведение по сравнению с оригиналом. Теперь нет связанных друг с другом локаций, а вместо этого разработчики создали множество независимых друг от друга сцен, которые выбираются случайным образом во время старта всего набора уровней. Для того, чтобы продвинуться дальше на той самой DOS-карте, нужно пройти весь комплект сразу и на это дается несколько попыток. Количество сцен может варьироваться от четырех до почти двух десятков. В целом уровни небольшие, а прохождение одного занимает всего пару минут. Но если вы потратите все сердечки (попытки), то начнете с первого. Тут стоит учитывать, что набор уровней будет уже совсем другим. Кроме того, случайная расстановка противников и главного героя не дает заучить правильный порядок действий и привыкнуть к тому или иному отрезку. В целом такой подход вносит разнообразие в геймплей, но через пару часов игры одни и те же декорации все равно начинают утомлять.

Второе нововведение – это своеобразная прокачка в виде “взломов” системы. По мере исследования карты можно получать различные способности, например, усиление рукопашки или превращение метательных предметов в осколочные гранаты. Список умений весьма обширный, но доступен он не всегда. Между некоторыми уровнями в том или ином наборе локаций есть специальные опции, где случайным образом выбираются два умения из списка, а игрок должен выбрать из них лишь один. Таким образом, если повезет, то вы сможете облегчить себе игру навыком “катана сразу” или “оружие сразу”. Не все способности кажутся очень полезными. Некоторые, такие как осколочная граната, способны навредить главному герою, если этот предмет неаккуратно бросить перед собой. Другие кажутся и вовсе ситуационными и по большей части бесполезными, вроде навыка, убивающего противника, если напрыгнуть на него сверху.
SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE 
Une capture d'écran de SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE
Par : ...{ODuHo4K@}...

Несколько раз за игру также встречаются специальные ядра. Это модификаторы, позволяющие начинать SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE либо с увеличенным количеством жизней, либо с каким-то определенным навыком. Например, ядро "возврат катаны" позволяет стартовать каждую сцену вместе с японским мечом. Им можно не только разрубать на части врагов, но и бросать вперед, а потом притягивать. У всех умений есть откат, поэтому без специального “взлома” нельзя использовать тот или иной навык несколько раз подряд. В целом ядра меняют подход к тактике и стратегии поединков, но не сильно облегчают задачу. Возможность бросать катану как бумеранг или перемещаться в тело врага немного упрощает игровой процесс, но это компенсируется постоянно увеличивающимся пулом уровней, которые нужно пройти подряд. Смерть главного героя здесь примерно такое же частое явление, как в играх серии Souls или различных roguelike-проектах.

Что касается врагов, то тут они бывают разных типов. Одни взрываются во время убийства, поражая осколками всё в радиусе досягаемости, другие уязвимы лишь в определенных частях своего тела. Ближе к концу появляются своеобразные мини-боссы, которых никак нельзя убить, что усложняет и без того непростую игру.

В остальном в плане игрового процесса SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE похожа на первую часть и сохраняет в себе элементы шутера и головоломки. Противники двигаются лишь тогда, когда действует главный герой и практически замирают, когда тот останавливается. Игрок должен все время грамотно оценивать ситуацию и взвешивать каждое свое действие. Боевая система позволяет выполнять различные трюки. Например, уклоняясь от пуль и ударов, можно перехватить оружие у одного врага, выстрелить во второго и бросить этот пистолет в третьего. А после завершения эпизода посмотреть на свои действия без замедления, что может выглядеть очень зрелищно и подстегивает действовать более изящно. В целом игровой процесс способен затянуть на несколько часов, однако несмотря на все время меняющиеся условия и возможности, в какой-то момент наступает усталость, особенно после очередной безуспешной попытки пройти дальше. Поэтому я бы рекомендовал проходить SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE короткими сессиями, чтобы сохранить свежесть восприятия и увлекательность до самого конца.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2346290139
Плюсы
Минусы
Ураганный, несмотря на остановку времени, геймплей;
Впечатляющее разнообразие способов убийства врагов;
Хаки, новые противники, новые карты.
Много рандома из-за которого умирать будете часто;
Локации со временем начинают повторяться.


SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE – классическое самостоятельное дополнение с некоторыми нововведениями. Разработчики не стали называть его сиквелом, но при этом постарались развить уникальную идею оригинала. Здесь появилась система случайного подбора уровней, которая позволяет перепроходить игру бесконечное количество раз, а своеобразная система прокачки в виде “взломов” и “ядер” вносит некоторое разнообразие в тактические подходы к той или иной ситуации. С другой стороны, эксцентричные решения в метаповествовании придутся по вкусу не всем. Но даже несмотря на спорные решения и эксперименты, с SUPERHOT: MIND CONTROL DELETE стоит ознакомиться всем любителям головоломок и необычных проектов.
 
...{ODuHo4K@}...

I didn't hate the game, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Story is interesting, very meta considering it's a video game.

But the confusingness of the levels, of how to actually find the ending, and the repetitiveness of it ruins it. It waaaay overstays its welcome and I had seen everything there was to experience 6 hours in, I've just forced myself to go another 6 to get to the end credits

Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Superhot ma roguelike, la definizione per definire SUPERHOT MIND CONTROL DELETE.
Rispetto al gioco precedente hanno aggiunto dei poteri nuovi, armi nuove, e nemici nuovi... per il resto è simile al predecessore. Durante l'avventura ci saranno tot round da sopravvivere ♥♥♥ 2 vite, se morite dovete ricominciare da capo. Durante questa scalata di livelli ci saranno dei potenziamenti vari (esempio: ricaricare la vita o avere più munizioni dell'arma).
Per chi non ama la ripetitività non lo consiglio, ma per chi ha amato SUPERHOT (sparatutto che si muove in slowmotion quando state fermi) lo consiglio.
 
Faber
2,007 produits enregistrés
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
